classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs
classes.description: Configs service provides operations to manage desired configuration specification of an appliance.

methods.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: validate$task
methods.description: Validates the desired profile specification.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all the profiles which are registered. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires Infraprofile.Read.

methods.name: export
methods.description: Exports the desired profile specification. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires Infraprofile.Read.

methods.name: import_profile$task
methods.description: Imports the desired profile specification.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs_import__profile__spec
classes.description: The Configs.ImportProfileSpec structure represents a spec information for import and validate.

attributes.name: config_spec
attributes.description: The JSON string representing the desired config specification.

attributes.name: profile_spec
attributes.description: The profile specification, if any only set if there is a profilespec avaliable for this import profilespec.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs_profile__info
classes.description: The Configs.ProfileInfo structure defines the information about profile.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the profile which is also a profile identifier. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.infraprofile.profile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.infraprofile.profile.

attributes.name: info
attributes.description: Description of the profile.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs_profiles__spec
classes.description: The Configs.ProfilesSpec structure represents a spec information for export operation.

attributes.name: encryption_key
attributes.description: Encryption Key to encrypt/decrypt profiles. If unset encryption will not be used for the profile.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Custom description provided by the user. If unset description will be empty.

attributes.name: profiles
attributes.description: Profiles to be exported/imported. If unset or empty, all profiles will be returned. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.infraprofile.profile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.infraprofile.profile.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs_validation__result
classes.description: The Configs.ValidationResult structure contains fields to describe result of validation of profile specification.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Status of the Profile spec.

attributes.name: notifications
attributes.description: Notifications to the user Only set if the notifications were reported by this particular validation.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_configs_validation__status
classes.description: The Configs.ValidationStatus structure defines possible values of status of profile spec.

attributes.name: VALID
attributes.description: Profile spec is valid.

attributes.name: INVALID
attributes.description: Profile spec is invalid.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_notification
classes.description: The Notification structure contains fields to describe any info/warning/error messages that Tasks can raise.

attributes.name: notification
attributes.description: The notification id. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.infraprofile.notification. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.infraprofile.notification.

attributes.name: time
attributes.description: The time the notification was raised/found. Only set if the time information is available.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: The notification message.

attributes.name: resolution
attributes.description: The resolution message, if any. Only set for warnings and errors.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_notifications
classes.description: The Notifications structure contains info/warning/error messages that can be reported be the task.

attributes.name: info
attributes.description: Info notification messages reported. Only set if an info was reported by the task.

attributes.name: warnings
attributes.description: Warning notification messages reported. Only set if an warning was reported by the task.

attributes.name: errors
attributes.description: Error notification messages reported. Only set if an error was reported by the task.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_infraprofile_task__info
classes.description: The TaskInfo structure contains information about a task.

attributes.name: progress
attributes.description: Progress of the operation. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of is one of RUNNING, BLOCKED, SUCCEEDED, or FAILED.

attributes.name: notifications
attributes.description: Notifications to the user Only set if the notifications were reported by this particular task.

attributes.name: result
attributes.description: Task result. This field will be unset if the task has no result.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of the operation associated with the task.

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: Identifier of the service containing the operation. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.service. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.service.

attributes.name: operation
attributes.description: Identifier of the operation associated with the task. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.operation. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.operation.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.description: Parent of the current task. This field will be unset if the task has no parent. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on. This field will be unset if the operation has no target or multiple targets.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Status of the operation associated with the task.

attributes.name: cancelable
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED". If unset the description of why the operation failed will be included in the result of the operation (see Info.result).

attributes.name: start_time
attributes.description: Time when the operation is started. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of CommonInfo.status is one of RUNNING, BLOCKED, SUCCEEDED, or FAILED.

attributes.name: end_time
attributes.description: Time when the operation is completed. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of CommonInfo.status is one of SUCCEEDED or FAILED.

attributes.name: user
attributes.description: Name of the user who performed the operation. This field will be unset if the operation is performed by the system.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_logging_forwarding
classes.description: The {@name Forwarding} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage forwarding of log messages to remote logging servers.

methods.name: com_vmware_appliance_logging_forwarding
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the configuration for forwarding log messages to remote log servers.

methods.name: test
methods.description: Validates the current log forwarding configuration by checking the liveness of the remote machine and optionally sending a test diagnostic log message from the appliance to all configured logging servers to allow manual end-to-end validation. The message that is sent is: "This is a diagnostic log test message from vCenter Server."

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the configuration for forwarding log messages to remote logging servers.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_logging_forwarding_config
classes.description: The {@name Config} {@term structure} defines the configuration for log message forwarding to remote logging servers.

attributes.name: hostname
attributes.description: FQDN or IP address of the logging server to which messages are forwarded.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: The port on which the remote logging server is listening for forwarded log messages.

attributes.name: protocol
attributes.description: Transport protocol used to forward log messages.

attributes.name: hostname
attributes.description: FQDN or IP address of the configured remote logging servers.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: State of the configured remote logging server.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: Message associated with the state of the configured remote logging server.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_logging_forwarding_connection__status_state
classes.description: The {@name State} {@term enumerated type} defines the state values that a remote logging server can be in.

attributes.name: UP
attributes.description: The remote logging server is reachable.

attributes.name: DOWN
attributes.description: The remote logging server is not reachable.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: The status of remote logging server is unknown.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_logging_forwarding_protocol
classes.description: The {@name Protocol} {@term enumerated type} defines transport protocols for outbound log messages.

attributes.name: TLS
attributes.description: Log messages will be forwarded to the remote host by using the TLS protocol.

attributes.name: UDP
attributes.description: Log messages will be forwarded to the remote host using the UDP protocol.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_networking_firewall_inbound
classes.description: The {@name Inbound} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage inbound firewall rules.

methods.name: com_vmware_appliance_networking_firewall_inbound
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Set the ordered list of firewall rules to allow or deny traffic from one or more incoming IP addresses. This overwrites the existing firewall rules and creates a new rule list. Within the list of traffic rules, rules are processed in order of appearance, from top to bottom. For example, the list of rules can be as follows: Address	Prefix	Interface Name	Policy 10.112.0.1	0	*	REJECT 10.112.0.1	0	nic0	ACCEPT In the above example, the first rule drops all packets originating from 10.112.0.1 and the second rule accepts all packets originating from 10.112.0.1 only on nic0. In effect, the second rule is always ignored which is not desired, hence the order has to be swapped. When a connection matches a firewall rule, further processing for the connection stops, and the appliance ignores any additional firewall rules you have set.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get the ordered list of firewall rules. Within the list of traffic rules, rules are processed in order of appearance, from top to bottom. When a connection matches a firewall rule, further processing for the connection stops, and the appliance ignores any additional firewall rules you have set.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_networking_firewall_inbound_policy
classes.description: {@name Policy} {@term enumerated type} Defines firewall rule policies.

attributes.name: IGNORE
attributes.description: Drop packet with correpsonding address.

attributes.name: ACCEPT
attributes.description: Allow packet with corresponding address.

attributes.name: REJECT
attributes.description: Drop packet with corresponding address sending destination is not reachable.

attributes.name: RETURN
attributes.description: Apply default or port-specific rules to packet with corresponding address.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_networking_firewall_inbound_rule
classes.description: {@name Rule} {@term structure} Structure that defines a single address-based firewall rule.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: CIDR prefix used to mask address. For example, an IPv4 prefix of 24 ignores the low-order 8 bits of address.

attributes.name: policy
attributes.description: The allow or deny policy of this rule.

attributes.name: interface_name
attributes.description: The interface to which this rule applies. An empty string indicates that the rule applies to all interfaces.

classes.description: The {@name Origin} {@term enumerated type} defines IPv6 address origin values.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned by a DHCP server. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: RANDOM
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned randomly by the system. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: The IPv6 address was manually configured to a specified address, for example, by user configuration. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: LINKLAYER
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned by IPv6 Stateless Address Auto-configuration (SLAAC). See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: OTHER
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned by a mechanism other than manual, DHCP, SLAAC, or random. See RFC 4293.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_networking_interfaces_ipv6_status
classes.description: The {@name Status} {@term enumerated type} defines IPv6 address status values. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: TENTATIVE
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is in the process of being verified as unique. An address in this state cannot be used for general communication. It can be used to determine the uniqueness of the address.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: The status of this address cannot be determined.

attributes.name: INACCESSIBLE
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is inaccessible because the interface to which this address is assigned is not operational.

attributes.name: INVALID
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is not a valid address. It should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet.

attributes.name: DUPLICATE
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is not unique on the link and cannot be used.

attributes.name: PREFERRED
attributes.description: This is a valid IPv6 address that can appear as the destination or source address of a packet.

attributes.name: DEPRECATED
attributes.description: The is a valid but deprecated IPv6 address. This address cannot be used as a source address in new communications, although packets addressed to such an address are processed as expected.

attributes.name: OPTIMISTIC
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is available for use, subject to restrictions, while its uniqueness on a link is being verified.

If NTP based time synchronization is used internally, the NTP daemon will be restarted to reload given NTP configuration. In case NTP based time synchronization is not used, this method only replaces servers in the NTP configuration.

methods.description: Get the NTP configuration status. If you run the 'timesync.get' command, you can retrieve the current time synchronization method (NTP- or VMware Tools-based). The 'ntp' command always returns the NTP server information, even when the time synchronization mode is not set to NTP. If the time synchronization mode is not NTP-based, the NTP server status is displayed as down.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_techpreview_monitoring_snmp_SNMP__config
classes.description: {@name SNMPConfig} {@term structure} Structure that defines the SNMP configuration, provided as input to set(), and never the result of get(). See SNMPConfigReadOnly. This structure is used to configure SNMP v1, v2c, and v3.

attributes.name: authentication
attributes.description: Set the default authentication protocol. Values can be none, MD5, or SHA1.

attributes.name: communities
attributes.description: Set up to ten communities, each of no more than 64 characters long. The format is: community1[,community2,...]. This setting overwrites any previous settings.

attributes.name: engineid
attributes.description: Set SNMPv3 engine ID. The engine ID must contain 5 to 32 hexadecimal characters. "0x" and colon (:) are removed from the ID.

attributes.name: loglevel
attributes.description: System Agent syslog logging level: debug

attributes.name: notraps
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of trap OIDs (object identifiers) for traps not to be sent by the agent. Use 'reset' to clear the setting.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Set up a UDP port which the SNMP agent uses to listen on for polling requests. The default UDP port is 161.

attributes.name: privacy
attributes.description: Set the default privacy protocol. Values: none or AES128.

attributes.name: remoteusers
attributes.description: Set up to five inform user IDs. The format is: user/auth-proto/-

attributes.name: syscontact
attributes.description: System contact string as presented in sysContact.0. Up to 255 characters long.

attributes.name: syslocation
attributes.description: System location string as presented in sysLocation.0. Up to 255 characters long.

attributes.name: targets
attributes.description: Set up to three targets to which to send SNMPv1 traps. The format is: ip-or-hostname[@port]/community[,...]. The default port is UDP 162. This setting overwrites any previous settings.

attributes.name: users
attributes.description: Set up to five local users. The format is: user/-

attributes.name: v3targets
attributes.description: Set up to three SNMPv3 notification targets. Format is: ip-or-hostname[@port]/remote-user/security-level/trap

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_techpreview_monitoring_snmp_SNMP__config__read__only
classes.description: {@name SNMPConfigReadOnly} {@term structure} Structure that defines the SNMP configuration, the result of get(), and never provided as input to set(). This structure differs from SNMPConfig because it contains localized keys (as defined in http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3826#section-1.2), instead of raw secret strings. This structure can be used to configure SNMP v1, v2c, and v3. Keep this structure in sync with vmw_snmp.py:_default_config(). Note that if a field if left empty, it is considered unset and will be ignored. Existing array elements below can be unset by sending an element with the string 'reset'.

attributes.name: authentication
attributes.description: Set the default authentication protocol. Values can be none, MD5, or SHA1.

attributes.name: communities
attributes.description: Set up to ten communities, each of no more than 64 characters long. The format is: community1[,community2,...]. This setting overwrites any previous settings.

attributes.name: enable
attributes.description: Set enable to true/false

attributes.name: engineid
attributes.description: Set SNMPv3 engine ID.

attributes.name: loglevel
attributes.description: System Agent syslog logging level: debug

attributes.name: notraps
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of trap OIDs (object identifiers) for traps not to be sent by the agent. Use 'reset' to clear the setting.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Set up a UDP port which the SNMP agent uses to listen on for polling requests. The default UDP port is 161.

attributes.name: privacy
attributes.description: Set the default privacy protocol.

attributes.name: syscontact
attributes.description: System contact string as presented in sysContact.0. Up to 255 characters long.

attributes.name: syslocation
attributes.description: System location string as presented in sysLocation.0. Up to 255 characters long.

attributes.name: targets
attributes.description: Set up to three targets to which to send SNMPv1 traps.

attributes.name: users
attributes.description: Set up to five local users.

attributes.name: remoteusers
attributes.description: Set up remote users.

attributes.name: v3targets
attributes.description: Set up to three SNMPv3 notification targets. Format is: ip-or-hostname[@port]/remote-user/security-level/trap

attributes.name: pid
attributes.description: Set up pid

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_techpreview_monitoring_snmp_SNMP__hash__config
classes.description: {@name SNMPHashConfig} {@term structure} Structure to provide up to two secrets to combine with the SNMPv3 engine ID and authentication or privacy protocol to form a localized hash. auth_hash is always required, priv_hash can be empty. By default arguments are paths on the local filesystem, raw_secret takes path to be the actual raw secret. First implementation was in ESXi: esxcli system snmp hash --help

attributes.name: auth_hash
attributes.description: Provide filename to secret for authentication hash, use in set --users (required secret)

attributes.name: priv_hash
attributes.description: Provide filename to secret for privacy hash, use in set --users (secret)

attributes.name: raw_secret
attributes.description: Make --auth_path and --priv_path flags read raw secret from command line instead of file.

attributes.description: IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example , 24. See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion. Set this argument to 0 if the mode is "unconfigured" or "dhcp".

attributes.name: default_gateway
attributes.description: IPv4 address of the default gateway. This default gateway value is used if the mode argument is set to "static" This configures the global default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

attributes.description: The IPv6 address was manually configured to a specified address, for, example, by user configuration. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: IPv6 address, for example, fc00:10:20:83:20c:29ff:fe94:bb5a.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: IPv6 CIDR prefix, for example, 64.

attributes.name: origin
attributes.description: Origin of the IPv6 address. For more information, see RFC 4293.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Status of the IPv6 address. For more information, see RFC 4293.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_techpreview_networking_ipv6_I__pv6__address__status
classes.description: {@name IPv6AddressStatus} {@term enumerated type} Defines IPv6 address status values.

attributes.name: tentative
attributes.description: This IPv6 address is in the process of being verified as unique. Do not use addresses in this state for general communication. You can use them to determine the uniqueness of the address. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: unknown
attributes.description: The status of this address cannot be determined. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: inaccessible
attributes.description: This IPv6 address is inaccessible because the interface to which this address is assigned is not operational. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: This IPv6 address is not a valid address. It should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: duplicate
attributes.description: This IPv6 address is not unique on the link. Do use this IPv6 address. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: preferred
attributes.description: This is a valid IPv6 address that can appear as the destination or source address of a packet. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: deprecated
attributes.description: This is a valid but deprecated IPv6 address. Do not use this IPv6 address as a source address in new communications, although packets addressed to such an address are processed as expected. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: optimistic
attributes.description: This IPv6 address is available for use, subject to restrictions, while its uniqueness on a link is being verified. See RFC 4293.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_techpreview_networking_ipv6_I__pv6__config

attributes.description: Network interface, for example, "nic0" to configure.

attributes.name: dhcp
attributes.description: Address assigned by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: autoconf
attributes.description: Address is assigned by Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC).

attributes.name: addresses
attributes.description: A list of addresses to be statically assigned.

attributes.name: default_gateway
attributes.description: Default gateway for static IP address assignment. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_techpreview_networking_ipv6_I__pv6__config__read__only
classes.description: {@name IPv6ConfigReadOnly} {@term structure} Structure that defines an existing IPv6 configuration on a particular interface. This structure is read only.

attributes.name: interface_name
attributes.description: Network interface, for example, "nic0" queried.

attributes.name: dhcp
attributes.description: Address assigned by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: autoconf
attributes.description: Address is assigned by Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC).

attributes.name: addresses
attributes.description: A list of all addresses assigned to this interface. The origin field of each address determines how the address was assigned, for example, statically, by DHCP, SLAAC.

attributes.name: default_gateway
attributes.description: Default gateway. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

attributes.description: Download Size of update in Megabytes.

classes.description: The {@name Category} {@term enumerated type} defines update type

attributes.name: SECURITY
attributes.description: Fixes vulnerabilities, doesn't change functionality

attributes.name: FIX
attributes.description: Fixes bugs/vulnerabilities, doesn't change functionality

attributes.name: UPDATE
attributes.description: Changes product functionality

attributes.name: UPGRADE
attributes.description: Introduces new features, significantly changes product functionality

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_update_common__info_priority
classes.description: The {@name Priority} {@term enumerated type} defines the update installation priority recommendations.

attributes.name: HIGH
attributes.description: Install ASAP

attributes.name: MEDIUM
attributes.description: Install at the earliest convenience

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: Install at your discretion

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_update_common__info_severity
classes.description: The {@name Severity} {@term enumerated type} defines the severity of the issues fixed in the update.

attributes.name: CRITICAL
attributes.description: Vulnerabilities that can be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker from the Internet or those that break the guest/host Operating System isolation. The exploitation results in the complete compromise of confidentiality, integrity, and availability of user data and/or processing resources without user interaction. Exploitation could be leveraged to propagate an Internet worm or execute arbitrary code between Virtual Machines and/or the Host Operating System.

attributes.name: IMPORTANT
attributes.description: Vulnerabilities that are not rated critical but whose exploitation results in the complete compromise of confidentiality and/or integrity of user data and/or processing resources through user assistance or by authenticated attackers. This rating also applies to those vulnerabilities which could lead to the complete compromise of availability when exploitation is by a remote unauthenticated attacker from the Internet or through a breach of virtual machine isolation.

attributes.name: MODERATE
attributes.description: Vulnerabilities where the ability to exploit is mitigated to a significant degree by configuration or difficulty of exploitation, but in certain deployment scenarios could still lead to the compromise of confidentiality, integrity, or availability of user data and/or processing resources.

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: All other issues that have a security impact. Vulnerabilities where exploitation is believed to be extremely difficult, or where successful exploitation would have minimal impact

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_address
classes.description: The Address structure provides the structure used to name an IPv6 address.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: The IPv6 address, for example, fc00:10:20:83:20c:29ff:fe94:bb5a. If set, the address was never set.

attributes.name: origin
attributes.description: The Origin of the IPv6 address. For more information, see RFC 4293. If set, the origin was never set.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: The IPv6 CIDR prefix, for example, 64. If set, the prefix was never set.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The Status of the IPv6 address. For more information, see RFC 4293. If set, the status was never set.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_address_origin
classes.description: The Address.Origin enumerated type defines IPv6 address origin values.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned by a DHCP server. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: RANDOM
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned randomly by the system. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: The IPv6 address was manually configured to a specified address, for example, by user configuration. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: LINKLAYER
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned by IPv6 Stateless Address Auto-configuration (SLAAC). See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: OTHER
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is assigned by a mechanism other than manual, DHCP, SLAAC, or random. See RFC 4293.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_address_status
classes.description: The Address.Status enumerated type defines IPv6 address status values. See RFC 4293.

attributes.name: TENTATIVE
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is in the process of being verified as unique. An address in this state cannot be used for general communication. It can be used to determine the uniqueness of the address.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: The status of this address cannot be determined.

attributes.name: INACCESSIBLE
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is inaccessible because the interface to which this address is assigned is not operational.

attributes.name: INVALID
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is not a valid address. It should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet.

attributes.name: DUPLICATE
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is not unique on the link and cannot be used.

attributes.name: PREFERRED
attributes.description: This is a valid IPv6 address that can appear as the destination or source address of a packet.

attributes.name: DEPRECATED
attributes.description: The is a valid but deprecated IPv6 address. This address cannot be used as a source address in new communications, although packets addressed to such an address are processed as expected.

attributes.name: OPTIMISTIC
attributes.description: The IPv6 address is available for use, subject to restrictions, while its uniqueness on a link is being verified.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_appliance__management
classes.description: ApplianceManagement structure This structure contains the Spec required for Appliance Management configurations.

attributes.name: smtp
attributes.description: The LocalAccounts service provides operations to manage local user account.

attributes.name: network
attributes.description: Network configurations to be applied. Only set if the network configurations are set in vCenter.

attributes.description: CEIP (Customer Experience Improvement Program) enabled state. Only set if ceip are set in vcenter.

classes.description: ApplianceNetwork structure This structure contains the Spec required for Appliance Network configurations.

attributes.description: List of Firewall Rules to be applied. Only set if the FirewallRulePolicy is set in vCenter.

attributes.name: dns_server_configuration
attributes.description: DNS configuration to be applied. Only set if the DnsServerConfiguration is set in vCenter.

attributes.name: proxy_configuration

attributes.name: interfaces
attributes.description: Interfaces configuration to be applied. Only set if the Interfaces configuration is set in vCenter.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_backup__schedule
classes.description: The BackupSchedule structure contains fields to be specified for creating a new schedule. The structure includes parts, location information, encryption password and enable flag.

attributes.name: parts
attributes.description: List of optional parts to be backed up. Use the com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.Parts#list operation to get information about the supported parts. If unset all the optional parts will not be backed up.

attributes.name: backup_password
attributes.description: Password for a backup piece. The backupPassword must adhere to the following password requirements: At least 8 characters, cannot be more than 20 characters in length. At least 1 uppercase letter. At least 1 lowercase letter. At least 1 numeric digit. At least 1 special character (i.e. any character not in [0-9,a-z,A-Z]). Only visible ASCII characters (for example, no space). If unset the backup piece will not be encrypted.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: URL of the backup location. Only set if URL is set in BackupSchedule

attributes.name: location_user
attributes.description: Username for the given location. If unset authentication will not be used for the specified location.

attributes.name: location_password
attributes.description: Password for the given location. If unset authentication will not be used for the specified location.

attributes.name: enable
attributes.description: Enable or disable a schedule. If unset the schedule will be enabled.

attributes.name: recurrence_info
attributes.description: Recurrence information for the schedule. If unset backup job will not be scheduled. See RecurrenceInfo

attributes.name: retention_info
attributes.description: Retention information for the schedule. If unset all the completed backup jobs will be retained forever. See RetentionInfo

attributes.name: schedule_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the schedule.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_dns__server__configuration
classes.description: DnsServerConfiguration structure This structure represents the configuration state used to determine DNS servers.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Define how to determine the DNS servers. Leave the servers argument empty if the mode argument is "DHCP". Set the servers argument to a comma-separated list of DNS servers if the mode argument is "static". The DNS server are assigned from the specified list.

attributes.name: servers
attributes.description: List of the currently used DNS servers. DNS server configuration.

attributes.name: domains
attributes.description: List of the search domains. DNS Search Domains.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_dns__server__configuration_DNS__server__mode
classes.description: DnsServerConfiguration.DNSServerMode enumerated type Describes DNS Server source (DHCP,static).

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: DNS address is automatically assigned by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: IS_STATIC
attributes.description: DNS address is static.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_firewall__rule__policy
classes.description: FirewallRulePolicy structure Structure that defines a single address-based firewall rule.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: CIDR prefix used to mask address. For example, an IPv4 prefix of 24 ignores the low-order 8 bits of address.

attributes.name: policy
attributes.description: The allow or deny policy of this rule.

attributes.name: interface_name
attributes.description: The interface to which this rule applies. An empty string indicates that the rule applies to all interfaces. Only set if interface name required

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_firewall__rule__policy_policy
classes.description: FirewallRulePolicy.Policy enumerated type Defines firewall rule policies.

attributes.name: IGNORE
attributes.description: Drop packet with correpsonding address.

attributes.name: ACCEPT
attributes.description: Allow packet with corresponding address.

attributes.name: REJECT
attributes.description: Drop packet with corresponding address sending destination is not reachable.

attributes.name: RETURN
attributes.description: Apply default or port-specific rules to packet with corresponding address.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_interface
classes.description: Interfaces structure Provides information about network interface.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Interface name, for example, "nic0", "nic1". If set, the name was never set

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Interface status. If set, the name was never set

attributes.name: mac
attributes.description: MAC address. For example 00:0C:29:94:BB:5A. If set, the mac was never set

attributes.name: ipv4
attributes.description: IPv4 Address information. ipv4 This set IPv4 is not set.

attributes.name: ipv6
attributes.description: IPv6 Address information. ipv6 This set IPv6 is not set.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_interface_interface__status
classes.description: Interface.InterfaceStatus enumerated type Defines interface status

attributes.name: DOWN
attributes.description: The interface is down.

attributes.name: UP
attributes.description: The interface is up.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_ipv4
classes.description: The IPv4 structure defines IPv4 configuration. to perform IPv4 network configuration for interfaces.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The Address assignment mode.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: The IPv4 address, for example, "10.20.80.191".

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: The IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example, 24. See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion.

attributes.name: default_gateway
attributes.description: The IPv4 address of the default gateway. This configures the global default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces. If set, the defaultGateway was never set.

attributes.name: configurable
attributes.description: The IPv4 is configured or not.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_ipv4_mode
classes.description: The Ipv4.Mode enumerated type defines different IPv4 address assignment modes.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: The IPv4 address is automatically assigned by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: STATIC
attributes.description: The IPv4 address is static.

attributes.name: UNCONFIGURED
attributes.description: The IPv4 protocol is not configured.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_ipv6
classes.description: The Ipv6 structure defines Ipv6 configuration. to perform Ipv6 network configuration for interfaces.

attributes.name: dhcp
attributes.description: An address will be assigned by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: autoconf
attributes.description: An address will be assigned by Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC).

attributes.name: configurable
attributes.description: The IPv6 is configured or not.

attributes.name: addresses
attributes.description: The list of addresses to be statically assigned. If set, the addresses were never set.

attributes.name: default_gateway
attributes.description: The default gateway for static IP address assignment. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_local__accounts
classes.description: The LocalAccounts service provides operations to manage local user account.

attributes.name: fullname
attributes.description: Full name of the user If unset, the value was never set.

attributes.name: roles
attributes.description: User roles

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the account is enabled

attributes.name: has_password
attributes.description: Is the user password set.

attributes.name: min_days_between_password_change
attributes.description: Minimum number of days between password change If unset, pasword can be changed any time.

attributes.name: max_days_between_password_change
attributes.description: Maximum number of days between password change If unset, password never expires.

attributes.name: warn_days_before_password_expiration
attributes.description: Number of days of warning before password expires If unset, a user is never warned.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: Password If unset, value will not be changed

attributes.name: email
attributes.description: Email address of the local account If unset, value will not be changed

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_local__accounts__policy
classes.description: The LocalAccountsPolicy service provides operations to manage local user accounts password lifecycle.

attributes.name: max_days
attributes.description: Maximum number of days a password may be used. If the password is older than this, a password change will be forced. If unset then the restriction will be ignored.

attributes.name: min_days
attributes.description: Minimum number of days allowed between password changes. Any password changes attempted sooner than this will be rejected. If unset then the restriction will be ignored.

attributes.name: warn_days
attributes.description: Number of days warning given before a password expires. A zero means warning is given only upon the day of expiration. If unset then no warning will be provided.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_log__forwarding
classes.description: The LogForwarding service provides operations to manage forwarding of log messages to remote logging servers.

attributes.name: port

attributes.name: protocol
attributes.description: Transport protocol used to forward log messages.

classes.description: The LogForwarding.Protocol enumerated type defines transport protocols for outbound log messages.

attributes.name: TLS
attributes.description: Log messages will be forwarded to the remote host by using the TLS protocol.

attributes.name: UDP
attributes.description: Log messages will be forwarded to the remote host using the UDP protocol.

attributes.name: TCP
attributes.description: Log messages will be forwarded to the remote host using the TCP protocol.

attributes.name: RELP
attributes.description: Log messages will be forwarded to the remote host using the RELP protocol.

classes.description: The ProxyConfiguration structure defines proxy configuration.

attributes.name: protocol
attributes.description: The protocol for which proxy should be set.

attributes.name: server
attributes.description: URL of the proxy server Only set if server set in ProxyConfiguration.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Port to connect to the proxy server. In a 'get' call, indicates the port connected to the proxy server. In a 'set' call, specifies the port to connect to the proxy server. A value of -1 indicates the default port. Only set if port set in ProxyConfiguration.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: Username for proxy server. Only set if proxy requires username.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: Password for proxy server. Only set if proxy requires password.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: In the result of the #get and #list operations this field indicates whether proxying is enabled for a particular protocol. In the input to the test and set operations this field specifies whether proxying should be enabled for a particular protocol.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_proxy__configuration_protocol

attributes.name: HTTP

attributes.name: HTTPS
attributes.description: Proxy configuration for https.

attributes.name: FTP
attributes.description: Proxy configuration for ftp.

classes.description: The RecurrenceInfo structure contains the recurrence information associated with a schedule.

attributes.name: minute
attributes.description: Minute when backup should run. Only set if minute is present in Recurrence Info of backup schedule.

attributes.name: hour
attributes.description: Hour when backup should run. The hour should be specified in 24-hour clock format. Only set if hour is present in Recurrence Info of backup schedule.

attributes.name: days
attributes.description: Day of week when the backup should be run. Days can be specified as list of days. If unset the backup will be run everyday.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_applmgmt_recurrence__info_day__of__week
classes.description: The RecurrenceInfo.DayOfWeek enumerated type defines the set of days when backup can be scheduled. The days can be specified as a list of individual days. You specify the days when you set the recurrence for a schedule. See RecurrenceInfo.days.

attributes.name: MONDAY

attributes.name: TUESDAY

attributes.name: WEDNESDAY

attributes.name: THURSDAY
attributes.description: Thursday

attributes.name: SATURDAY

attributes.name: SUNDAY

attributes.name: ENABLED
