attributes.description: Privilege identifier.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Privilege description.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: Group to which the privilege belongs to.

attributes.name: is_on_parent
attributes.description: does this apply to the parent entity?

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_authmanagement_roles
classes.description: Roles structure This structure represents the configuration for Roles.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Role name which is unique across roles.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Role description.

attributes.name: privilege_ids
attributes.description: List of Privileges present in the Role.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_authmanagement_token__policy
classes.description: TokenPolicy structure This structure represents the configuration in Token Policy.

attributes.name: clock_tolerance
attributes.description: Clock tolerance ms.

attributes.name: token_renewal
attributes.description: Maximum token renewal count.

attributes.name: token_delegation
attributes.description: Maximum token delegation count.

attributes.name: bearer_refresh
attributes.description: Maximum Bearer RefreshToken lifetime.

attributes.name: hok_refresh
attributes.description: Maximum HoK RefreshToken lifetime.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_cluster__config__info
classes.description: The ClusterConfigInfo structure contains fields describing the complete configuration of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations of DRS, HA VSAN Cluster etc.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the cluster

attributes.name: parent_path
attributes.description: Absolute path from root folder to cluster's parent. If unset, then inventory object placed in root folder.

attributes.name: ha
attributes.description: List of vsphere HA configurations for clusters. If unset, then HA configurations are not set.

attributes.name: ha_vm_overrides
attributes.description: Settings for HA vm overrides.

attributes.name: drs
attributes.description: Cluster-wide configuration of the vSphere DRS service.

attributes.name: drs_vm_overrides
attributes.description: List of virtual machine configurations for the vSphere DRS service. Each entry applies to one virtual machine. If a virtual machine is not specified in this list, the service uses the default settings for that virtual machine. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: rules
attributes.description: Cluster-wide rules. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: Cluster-wide groups. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: proactive_ha
attributes.description: Cluster-wide configuration of the vSphere InfraUpdateHA service. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: hosts
attributes.description: Host configuration on the datacenter. If unset, then no hosts present in the datacenter.

attributes.name: permissions
attributes.description: Permissions defined on the cluster. If unset, then no permissions defined on this inventory object.

attributes.name: resource_pools
attributes.description: List of Resource pools.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_additional__options
classes.description: The AdditionalOptions structure contains fields describing the HA specific configurations of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations for vSphereHA.

attributes.name: advanced_options
attributes.description: Drs configuration additional options

attributes.name: scalable_shares
attributes.description: Enable scalable shares for the resource pools on this cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_affinity__rule
classes.description: The AffinityRule structure defines a set of virtual machines that DRS will attempt to run on the same host.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is currently satisfied.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is enabled. Set this property when user configures the rule. The default value is false (disabled). If there is a rule conflict, the Server can override the setting to disable a rule. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: in_compliance
attributes.description: Flag to indicate if the rule is in compliance. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the rule.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether compliance with this rule is mandatory or optional. The default value is false (optional). If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: user_created
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether the rule is created by the user or the system. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vms
attributes.description: List of virtual machines.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_automation
classes.description: The Automation structure contains fields describing the HA specific configurations of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations for vSphereHA.

attributes.name: automation_level
attributes.description: Specifies the cluster-wide default DRS behavior for virtual machines. You can override the default behavior for a virtual machine. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: migration_threshold
attributes.description: Threshold for generated recommendations. DRS generates only those recommendations that are above the specified vmotionRate. Ratings vary from 1 to 5. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: proactive_drs_enabled
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether or not the ProactiveDRS is enabled. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: virtual_machine_automation
attributes.description: Flag that dictates whether DRS Behavior overrides for individual VMs.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_dependency__rule
classes.description: The DependencyRule structure defines VM-to-VM dependencies. A VM-VM Dependency rule identifies the following groups. - A virtual machine group - DependencyRule.vm-group - A "depends on" virtual machine group - DependencyRule.depends-on-vm-group. The VMs in DependencyRule.vm-group depends on the list of VMs specified in DependencyRule.depends-on-vm-group.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is currently satisfied.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is enabled. Set this property when user configures the rule. The default value is false (disabled). If there is a rule conflict, the Server can override the setting to disable a rule. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: in_compliance
attributes.description: Flag to indicate if the rule is in compliance. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the rule.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether compliance with this rule is mandatory or optional. The default value is false (optional). If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: user_created
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether the rule is created by the user or the system. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_group
attributes.description: Virtual group name. The virtual group may contain one or more virtual machines.

attributes.name: depends_on_vm_group
attributes.description: Depdendency virtual group name. The virtual group may contain one or more virtual machines.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_dpm__behavior__info
classes.description: The DpmBehaviorInfo enumerated type defines the automation level for DPM service on a cluster.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: Specifies that VirtualCenter should generate recommendations for host power operations, but should not execute the recommendations automatically.

attributes.name: AUTOMATED
attributes.description: Specifies that VirtualCenter should generate recommendations for host power operations, and should execute the recommendations automatically.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_drs__behavior__info
classes.description: The DrsBehaviorInfo enumerated type defines the automation levels that can be set on a DRS cluster.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: Specifies that VirtualCenter should generate recommendations for virtual machine migration and for placement with a host, but should not implement the recommendations automatically.

attributes.name: PARTIALLY_AUTOMATED
attributes.description: Specifies that VirtualCenter should generate recommendations for virtual machine migration and for placement with a host, but should automatically implement only the placement at power on.

attributes.name: FULLY_AUTOMATED
attributes.description: Specifies that VirtualCenter should automate both the migration of virtual machines and their placement with a host at power on.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_drs__config
classes.description: The DrsConfig structure contains fields describing the HA specific configurations of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations for DAS.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether or not DRS service is enabled. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: automation
attributes.description: vSphere HA configuration for Automation Level, Migration Threshold Predictive DRS and VM Automation.

attributes.name: additional_options
attributes.description: vSphere HA configuration for VM Distribution, CPU Over commit Scalable Shares.

attributes.name: power_management
attributes.description: vSphere HA configuration for DPM, AutomationLevel, DPM Threshold.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_drs__vm__overrides
classes.description: The DrsVmOverrides structure contains the fields describing DRS behavior override for individual virtual machines in the cluster.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Reference to the virtual machine.

attributes.name: behavior
attributes.description: Specifies the particular DRS behavior for this virtual machine. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_group
classes.description: The Group structure describes the properties of virtual machine and host groups.

attributes.name: vm_groups
attributes.description: List of VM Group details. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: host_groups
attributes.description: List of HOST Group details. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Unique name of the group.

attributes.name: entities
attributes.description: List of VMs or Hosts belonging to the group. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: user_created
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether the group is created by the user or the system. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_power__management
classes.description: The PowerManagement structure contains the fields describing DPM specific configurations of a cluster.

attributes.name: dpm_enabled
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether or not the service is enabled. This service can not be enabled, unless DRS is enabled as well. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: automation_level
attributes.description: Specifies the default VMware DPM behavior for hosts. This default behavior can be overridden on a per host. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: dpm_threshold
attributes.description: DPM Advanced options. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_proactive__HA__config
classes.description: The ProactiveHAConfig structure defines the Configuration of the vSphere InfraUpdateHA service on a cluster.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether or not the service is enabled. InfraUpdateHA will not be active, unless DRS is enabled as well. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: automation_level
attributes.description: Configured behavior. Values are of type BehaviorType. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: remediation
attributes.description: Configured remediation for moderately degraded hosts. Values are of type RemediationType. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: providers
attributes.description: The list of health update providers configured for this cluster. Providers are identified by their id. If the provider list is empty, InfraUpdateHA will not be active. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_proactive__HA__config_behavior__type
classes.description: The ProactiveHAConfig.BehaviorType enumerated type defines the behavior for executing the proposed DRS recommendations.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: With this behavior configured, the proposed DRS recommendations require manual approval before they are executed.

attributes.name: AUTOMATED
attributes.description: With this behavior configured, the proposed DRS recommendations are executed immediately.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_proactive__HA__config_remediation__type
classes.description: The ProactiveHAConfig.RemediationType enumerated type defines the types of remediation behaviours that can be configured.

attributes.name: QUARANTINE_MODE
attributes.description: With this behavior configured, a degraded host will be recommended to be placed in Quarantine Mode.

attributes.name: MAINTENANCE_MODE
attributes.description: With this behavior configured, a degraded host will be recommended to be placed in Maintenance Mode.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_rule
classes.description: The Rule structure describes affinity and anti-affinity DRS rules that affect the placement of virtual machines in a cluster.

attributes.name: vm_affinity_rules
attributes.description: Cluster-wide VM affinity rules.If this is set then AntiAffinityRule, DependencyRule, VmHostRule can not be set. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_anti_affinity_rules
attributes.description: Cluster-wide VM anti affinity rules.If this is set then AntiAffinityRule, DependencyRule, VmHostRule can not be set. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: dependency_rule
attributes.description: Cluster-wide VM-to-VM dependency rules.If this is set then AffinityRule, AntiAffinityRule, VmHostRule can not be set. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_host_rule
attributes.description: Cluster-wide VM-to-Host affinity rules.If this is set then AffinityRule, AntiAffinityRule, DependencyRule can not be set. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: DISABLED
attributes.description: Do not scale shares

attributes.name: SCALE_CPU_AND_MEMORY_SHARES
attributes.description: Scale both CPU and memory shares

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_status
classes.description: The Status enumeration defines a general "health" value for a managed entity.

attributes.name: GRAY
attributes.description: The status is unknown.

attributes.name: GREEN
attributes.description: The entity is OK.

attributes.name: YELLOW
attributes.description: The entity might have a problem.

attributes.name: RED
attributes.description: The entity definitely has a problem.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_drs_vm__host__rule
classes.description: The VmHostRule structure defines virtual machines and host groups that determine virtual machine placement. The virtual machines and hosts referenced by a VM-Host rule must be in the same cluster. A VM-Host rule identifies the following groups. - A virtual machine group (vim.cluster.VmGroup). - Two host groups - an affine host group and an anti-affine host group (vim.cluster.HostGroup). At least one of the groups must contain one or more hosts.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is currently satisfied.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is enabled. Set this property when user configures the rule. The default value is false (disabled). If there is a rule conflict, the Server can override the setting to disable a rule. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: in_compliance
attributes.description: Flag to indicate if the rule is in compliance. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the rule.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether compliance with this rule is mandatory or optional. The default value is false (optional). If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: user_created
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether the rule is created by the user or the system. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_group_name
attributes.description: Virtual group name. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: affine_host_group_name
attributes.description: Name of the affine host group. The affine host group identifies hosts on which VmHotRule#vmGroupName virtual machines can be powered-on. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: anti_affine_host_group_name
attributes.description: Name of the anti-affine host group. The anti-affine host group identifies hosts on which VmHotRule#vmGroupName virtual machines should not be powered-on. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_admission__control
classes.description: The FailuresAndResponses structure contains fields describing the Failures and responses specific configurations of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations for vsphere HA.

attributes.name: host_failures_cluster_tolerates
attributes.description: Number of host failures that should be tolerated, still guaranteeing sufficient resources to restart virtual machines on available hosts. If not set, we assume 1.

attributes.name: host_fail_over_slot_policy
attributes.description: This policy allows setting a fixed slot size

attributes.name: dedicated_failover_hosts
attributes.description: List of hosts dedicated for failover.

attributes.name: performance_degradation_vm_tolerate
attributes.description: Percentage of resource reduction that a cluster of VMs can tolerate in case of a failover.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_cluster__resource__percentage
classes.description: This class defines CPU, Memory resource percentages.

attributes.name: cpu
attributes.description: Reserved failover CPU capacity

attributes.name: memory
attributes.description: Reserved failover Memory capacity

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses
classes.description: The FailuresAndResponses structure contains fields describing the Failures and responses specific configurations of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations for vsphere HA.

attributes.name: default_vm_restart_priority
attributes.description: Restart priority for a virtual machine. If not specified at either the cluster level or the virtual machine level, this will default to medium. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: restart_priority_condition_timeout
attributes.description: This setting is used to specify a maximum time the lower priority VMs should wait for the higher priority VMs to be ready. If the higher priority Vms are not ready by this time, then the lower priority VMs are restarted irrespective of the VM ready state. This timeout can be used to prevent the failover of lower priority VMs to be stuck infinitely. Timeout specified in seconds. To use cluster setting for a VM override, set to -1 in per-VM. setting. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: additional_delay
attributes.description: After condition has been met, a mandatory delay before starting the next VM restart priority.

attributes.name: host_isolation_response
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the virtual machine should be powered off if a host determines that it is isolated from the rest of the compute resource. If not specified at either the cluster level or the virtual machine level, this will default to powerOff. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: datastore_with_pdl_failure_response
attributes.description: VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as Permenant Device Loss (PDL). PDL indicates storage device failure or LUN removal. In case of PDL, the failed datastore or device is unlikely to recover. The details of PDL are

attributes.name: apd_failure_response
attributes.description: VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as All Paths Down (APD). APD is a condition where a storage has become inaccessible for unknown reasons. It only indicates loss of connectivity and does not indicate storage device failure or LUN removal (Permanent Device Loss or PDL)

attributes.name: response_recovery
attributes.description: Action taken by VM Component Protection service for a powered on VM when APD condition clears after APD timeout. This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are specified by FailuresAndResponses.VmReactionOnAPDCleared. The default value is VmReactionOnAPDCleared#none for cluster setting and VmReactionOnAPDCleared#useClusterDefault for per-VM setting.

attributes.name: response_delay
attributes.description: The time interval after an APD timeout has been declared and before VM Component Protection service will terminate the VM. The default value is 180 seconds if not specified. To use cluster setting for a VM override, set to -1 in per-VM setting.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses_isolation__response
classes.description: The enum defines values that indicate whether or not the virtual machine should be powered off if a host determines that it is isolated from the rest of the cluster.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: Do not power off the virtual machine in the event of a host network isolation.

attributes.name: POWER_OFF
attributes.description: Power off the virtual machine in the event of a host network isolation.

attributes.name: SHUTDOWN
attributes.description: Shut down the virtual machine guest operating system in the event of a host network isolation. If the guest operating system fails to shutdown within five minutes, HA will initiate a forced power off. When you use the shutdown isolation response, failover can take longer (compared to the response) because the virtual machine cannot fail over until it is shutdown.

attributes.name: CLUSTER_ISOLATION_RESPONSE
attributes.description: Use the default isolation response defined for the cluster that contains this virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses_restart__priority
classes.description: The enum defines virtual machine restart priority values to resolve resource contention. The priority determines the preference that HA gives to a virtual machine if sufficient capacity is not available to power on all failed virtual machines. For example, high priority virtual machines on a host get preference over low priority virtual machines.

attributes.name: DISABLED
attributes.description: vSphere HA is disabled for this virtual machine.

attributes.name: LOWEST
attributes.description: Virtual machines with this priority have the lowest chance of powering on after a failure if there is insufficient capacity on hosts to meet all virtual machine needs.

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: Virtual machines with this priority have a lower chance of powering on after a failure if there is insufficient capacity on hosts to meet all virtual machine needs.

attributes.name: MEDIUM
attributes.description: Virtual machines with this priority have an intermediate chance of powering on after a failure if there is insufficient capacity on hosts to meet all virtual machine needs.

attributes.name: HIGH
attributes.description: Virtual machines with this priority have a higher chance of powering on after a failure if there is insufficient capacity on hosts to meet all virtual machine needs.

attributes.name: HIGHEST
attributes.description: Virtual machines with this priority have the highest chance of powering on after a failure if there is insufficient capacity on hosts to meet all virtual machine needs.

attributes.name: CLUSTER_RESTART_PRIORITY
attributes.description: Virtual machines with this priority use the default restart priority defined for the cluster that contains this virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses_service__state
classes.description: Possible states of an HA service. All services support the disabled and enabled states.

attributes.name: DISABLED
attributes.description: HA service is disabled.

attributes.name: ENABLED
attributes.description: HA service is enabled.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses_storage__vm__reaction
classes.description: The VM policy settings that determine the response to storage failures.

attributes.name: DISABLED
attributes.description: VM Component Protection service will not monitor or react to the component failure. This setting does not affect other vSphere HA services such as Host Monitoring or VM Health Monitoring.

attributes.name: WARNING
attributes.description: VM Component Protection service will monitor component failures but will not restart an affected VM. Rather it will notify users about the component failures. This setting does not affect other vSphere HA services such as Host Monitoring or VM Health Monitoring.

attributes.name: RESTART_CONSERVATIVE
attributes.description: VM Component Protection service protects VMs conservatively. With this setting, when the service can't determine that capacity is available to restart a VM, it will favor keeping the VM running.

attributes.name: RESTART_AGGRESSIVE
attributes.description: VM Component Protection service protects VMs aggressively. With this setting, the service will terminate an affected VM even if it can't determine that capacity exists to restart the VM.

attributes.name: CLUSTER_DEFAULT
attributes.description: VM will use the cluster default setting. This option is only meaningful for per-VM settings.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses_vm__monitoring__state
classes.description: The enum defines values that indicate the state of Virtual Machine Health Monitoring. Health Monitoring uses the vmTools (guest) and application agent heartbeat modules. You can configure HA to respond to heartbeat failures of either one or both modules. You can also disable the HA response to heartbeat failures.

attributes.name: VM_MONITORING_DISABLED
attributes.description: Virtual machine health monitoring is disabled. In this state, HA response to guest and application heartbeat failures are disabled.

attributes.name: VM_MONITORING_ONLY
attributes.description: HA response to guest heartbeat failure is enabled.

attributes.name: VM_AND_APP_MONITORING
attributes.description: HA response to both guest and application heartbeat failure is enabled.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_failures__and__responses_vm__reaction__on__APD__cleared
classes.description: If an APD condition clears after an APD timeout condition has been declared and before VM Component Protection service terminated the VM, the guestOS and application may no longer be operational.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: VM Component Protection service will not react after APD condition is cleared.

attributes.name: RESET
attributes.description: VM Component Protection service will reset the VM after APD condition is cleared. Note this only applies if the subject VM is still powered on.

attributes.name: USE_CLUSTER_DEFAULT
attributes.description: VM will use the cluster default setting. This option is only meaningful for per-VM settings.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_fixed__size__slot__policy
classes.description: This policy allows setting a fixed slot size

attributes.name: cpu
attributes.description: The cpu component of the slot size (in MHz)

attributes.name: memory
attributes.description: The memory component of the slot size (in megabytes)

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_ha__vm__overrides
classes.description: The VmOverrides data object contains the HA configuration settings for vm as a override from cluster. All fields are optional.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Reference to the virtual machine.

attributes.name: vm_restart_priority
attributes.description: Restart priority for a virtual machine. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_additional_delay
attributes.description: After condition has been met, a mandatory delay before starting the next VM restart priority.

attributes.name: vm_restart_priority_timeout
attributes.description: This setting is used to specify a maximum time the lower priority VMs should wait for the higher priority VMs to be ready. If the higher priority Vms are not ready by this time, then the lower priority VMs are restarted irrespective of the VM ready state. This timeout can be used to prevent the failover of lower priority VMs to be stuck infinitely. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_isolation_response
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the virtual machine should be powered off if a host determines that it is isolated from the rest of the compute resource. If not specified at either the cluster level or the virtual machine level, this will default to powerOff. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm_datastore_with_pdl_failure_response
attributes.description: VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as Permenant Device Loss (PDL). PDL indicates storage device failure or LUN removal. In case of PDL, the failed datastore or device is unlikely to recover. The details of PDL are

attributes.name: vm_apd_failure_response
attributes.description: VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as All Paths Down (APD). APD is a condition where a storage has become inaccessible for unknown reasons. It only indicates loss of connectivity and does not indicate storage device failure or LUN removal (Permanent Device Loss or PDL)

attributes.name: vm_apd_failover_delay
attributes.description: The time interval after an APD timeout has been declared and before VM Component Protection service will terminate the VM. The default value is 180 seconds if not specified. To use cluster setting for a VM override, set to -1 in per-VM setting.

attributes.name: vm_apd_response_recovery
attributes.description: Action taken by VM Component Protection service for a powered on VM when APD condition clears after APD timeout. This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are

attributes.name: vm_monitoring
attributes.description: Virtual machine health monitoring is disabled. In this state, HA response to guest and application heartbeat failures are disabled.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_heart__beat__data__stores
classes.description: The HeartBeatDataStores structure contains fields describing the HeartBeatDataStores It contains cluster-wide configurations for vsphere HA.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_heart__beat__data__stores_HB__datastore__candidate
classes.description: The policy to determine the candidates from which vCenter Server can choose heartbeat datastores.

attributes.name: USER_SELECTED_DS
attributes.description: vCenter Server chooses heartbeat datastores from the set specified by the user (see #heartbeatDatastore). More specifically, datastores not included in the set will not be chosen. Note that if #heartbeatDatastore is empty, datastore heartbeating will be disabled for HA.

attributes.name: ALL_FEASIBLE_DS
attributes.description: vCenter Server chooses heartbeat datastores from all the feasible ones, i.e., the datastores that are accessible to more than one host in the cluster. The choice will be made without giving preference to those specified by the user (see #heartbeatDatastore).

attributes.name: ALL_FEASIBLE_DS_WITH_USER_PREFERENCE
attributes.description: vCenter Server chooses heartbeat datastores from all the feasible ones while giving preference to those specified by the user (see #heartbeatDatastore). More specifically, the datastores not included in #heartbeatDatastore will be chosen if and only if the specified ones are not sufficient.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_vm__tools__monitoring__settings
classes.description: The vim.cluster.VmToolsMonitoringSettings data object contains virtual machine monitoring settings that are used by the Virtual Machine Health Monitoring Service. The Service checks the VMware Tools heartbeat of a virtual machine. If heartbeats have not been received within a specified time interval, the Service declares the virtual machine as failed and resets the virtual machine. All fields are optional. In case of a reconfiguration, fields left unset are not changed.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether or not the Virtual Machine Health Monitoring service is enabled. The Server does not use this property.

attributes.name: cluster_settings
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether to use the cluster settings or the per VM settings. The default value is true.

attributes.name: failure_interval
attributes.description: If no heartbeat has been received for at least the specified number of seconds, the virtual machine is declared as failed. The default value is 30.

attributes.name: min_up_time
attributes.description: The number of seconds for the virtual machine's heartbeats to stabilize after the virtual machine has been powered on. This time should include the guest operating system boot-up time. The virtual machine monitoring will begin only after this period. The default value is 120.

attributes.name: max_failures
attributes.description: Maximum number of failures and automated resets allowed during the time that VmToolsMonitoringSettings.max-failure-window specifies. If VmToolsMonitoringSettings.max-failure-window is -1 (no window), this represents the absolute number of failures after which automated response is stopped. If a virtual machine exceeds this threshold, in-depth problem analysis is usually needed. The default value is 3.

attributes.name: max_failure_window
attributes.description: The number of seconds for the window during which up to VmToolsMonitoringSettings.max-failures resets can occur before automated responses stop. If set to -1, no failure window is specified. The default value is -1.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_ha_vsphere__HA
classes.description: The DasInfo structure contains fields describing the HA specific configurations of a cluster. It contains cluster-wide configurations for DAS.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: HA Enabled or Disabled Flag to indicate whether or not vSphere HA feature is enabled.

attributes.name: failures_and_responses
attributes.description: Configuration settings for HA Failures and responses. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: admission_control
attributes.description: Configuration settings for HA admission control. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: heartbeat_datastores
attributes.description: Configuration settings for heart beat data store policy. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: advanced_options
attributes.description: Advanced settings. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_option__value
classes.description: Describes the key/value pair of a configured option.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: The name of the option using dot notation to reflect the option's position in a hierarchy. For example, you might have an option called "Ethernet" and another option that is a child of that called "Connection". In this case, the key for the latter could be defined as "Ethernet.Connection"

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the option. The Any data object type enables you to define any value for the option. Typically, however, the value of an option is of type String or Integer.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_vsan_host__default__info
classes.description: Default VSAN service configuration to be used for hosts admitted to the cluster.

attributes.name: checksum_enabled
attributes.description: Whether the VSAN service is configured to enforce checksum protection. If omitted while enabling the VSAN service, this value will default to false. Change this value to false shall not affect any existing disk status. Changing this value to true shall do disk enforcement check that all VSAN disks are checksum enabled.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_cluster_vsan_vsan__config__info
classes.description: The VsanConfigInfo data object contains configuration data for the VSAN service in a cluster. This data object is used both for specifying cluster-wide settings when updating the VSAN service, and as an output datatype when retrieving current cluster-wide VSAN service settings.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Whether the VSAN service is enabled for the cluster.

attributes.name: default_config
attributes.description: Default VSAN settings to use for hosts admitted to the cluster when the VSAN service is enabled. If omitted, values will default as though the fields in the HostDefaultInfo have been omitted.

attributes.name: type

attributes.name: maintenance_mode
attributes.description: The current maintenance mode state of the datastore. If unset, then the current maintenance mode state of the datastore is set to normal.

classes.description: The Permission structure contains spec to define permissions in vCenter Server.

attributes.description: True if principal is a group.

attributes.name: propagate
attributes.description: True if permission can be propagated to child entities.

attributes.name: role_id
attributes.description: Role associated with the permission.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_resourcepool_resource__allocation__info
classes.description: The ResourceAllocationInfo structure contains resource allocation information of a resource pool.

attributes.name: reservation
attributes.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to a resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are MB fo memory, and MHz for CPU.

attributes.name: expandable_reservation
attributes.description: In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation.

attributes.name: limit
attributes.description: The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Units are MB for memory, and MHz for CPU.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: Shares are used in case of resource contention.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_resourcepool_resource__pool
classes.description: The ResourcePool structure contains information about resource pools present in the cluster.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the vCenter Server resource pool.

attributes.name: parent_path
attributes.description: Parent name for the resource pool. If unset, then inventory object placed in root folder.

attributes.name: child_resource_pools
attributes.description: Identifiers of the child resource pools contained in this resource pool. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: vm
attributes.description: Identifiers of the virtual machines contained in this resource pool. If unset or empty, the value is skipped.

attributes.name: config
attributes.description: Summary of the Resource pools.

attributes.name: permissions
attributes.description: Permission on the resourcepool. If unset, then no permissions defined on this inventory object.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_resourcepool_resource__pool__summary
classes.description: The ResourcePoolSummary structure provides summary of ResourcePool.

attributes.name: cpu_allocation
attributes.description: Resource allocation information for CPU.

attributes.name: memory_allocation
attributes.description: Resource allocation information for memory.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_resourcepool_shares
classes.description: The Shares structure provides specification of shares. Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers. In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the resource, subject to certain other constraints.

attributes.name: level
attributes.description: The allocation level. It maps to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as CUSTOM.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: When Shares.level is set to CUSTOM, it is the number of shares allocated. Otherwise, this value is ignored. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools.

classes.name: com_vmware_appliance_vcenter_settings_v1_config_components_inventory_resourcepool_shares_level
classes.description: The Shares.Level enumerated type defines the possible values for the allocation level.

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: For CPU: Shares = 500 * number of virtual CPUs. For Memory: Shares = 5 * virtual machine memory size in MB.

attributes.name: NORMAL
attributes.description: For CPU: Shares = 1000 * number of virtual CPUs. For Memory: Shares = 10 * virtual machine memory size in MB.

attributes.name: HIGH
attributes.description: For CPU: Shares = 2000 * nmumber of virtual CPUs. For Memory: Shares = 20 * virtual machine memory size in MB.

attributes.name: CUSTOM
attributes.description: If set, in case there is resource contention the server uses the shares value to determine the resource allocation.

When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task.

attributes.name: target

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Status of the operation associated with the task.

attributes.name: cancelable
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED". If unset the description of why the operation failed will be included in the result of the operation (see Info.result).

attributes.name: start_time
attributes.description: Time when the operation is started. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of CommonInfo.status is one of RUNNING, BLOCKED, SUCCEEDED, or FAILED.

attributes.name: end_time
attributes.description: Time when the operation is completed. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of CommonInfo.status is one of SUCCEEDED or FAILED.

attributes.name: user
attributes.description: Name of the user who performed the operation. This field will be unset if the operation is performed by the system.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_session
classes.description: The {@name Session} {@term service} allows API clients to manage session tokens including creating, deleting and obtaining information about sessions.

methods.name: com_vmware_cis_session
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about the current session. This {@term operation} expects a valid session identifier to be supplied. A side effect of invoking this {@term operation} may be a change to the session's last accessed time to the current time if this is supported by the session implementation. Invoking any other {@term operation} in the API will also update the session's last accessed time. This API is meant to serve the needs of various front end projects that may want to display the name of the user. Examples of this include various web based user interfaces and logging facilities.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a session with the API. This is the equivalent of login. This {@term operation} exchanges user credentials supplied in the security context for a session identifier that is to be used for authenticating subsequent calls. To authenticate subsequent calls clients are expected to include the session key.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Terminates the validity of a session token. This is the equivalent of log out. A session identifier is expected as part of the request.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_session_info
classes.description: Represents data associated with an API session.

attributes.name: user
attributes.description: Fully qualified name of the end user that created the session, for example Administrator@vsphere.local. A typical use case for this information is in Graphical User Interfaces (GUI) or logging systems to visualize the identity of the current user.

attributes.name: created_time
attributes.description: Time when the session was created.

attributes.name: last_accessed_time
attributes.description: Last time this session was used by passing the session key for invoking an API.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_category
classes.description: The {@name Category} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to create, read, update, delete, and enumerate categories.

methods.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_category
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: add_to_used_by
methods.description: Adds the {@param.name usedByEntity} to the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set} for the specified category. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is already in the {@term set}, then this becomes an idempotent no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the modify {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} privilege on the category.

methods.name: list_used_categories
methods.description: Enumerates all categories for which the {@param.name usedByEntity} is part of the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the individual categories.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Fetches the category information for the given category identifier. In order to view the category information, you need the read privilege on the category.

methods.name: revoke_propagating_permissions
methods.description: Revokes all propagating permissions on the given category. You should then attach a direct permission with tagging privileges on the given category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need category related privileges (direct or propagating) on the concerned category.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the create category privilege.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates an existing category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the edit privilege on the category.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Enumerates the categories in the system. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the individual categories. The {@term list} will only contain those categories for which you have read privileges.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes an existing category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the delete privilege on the category.

methods.name: remove_from_used_by
methods.description: Removes the {@param.name usedByEntity} from the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is not using this category, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the modify {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} privilege on the category.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_category__model
classes.description: The {@name CategoryModel} {@term structure} defines a category that is used to group one or more tags.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The unique identifier of the category.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The display name of the category.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of the category.

attributes.name: cardinality
attributes.description: The associated cardinality ({@enum.values Cardinality}) of the category.

attributes.name: associable_types
attributes.description: The types of objects that the tags in this category can be attached to. If the {@term set} is empty, then tags can be attached to all types of objects. This field works only for objects that reside in Inventory Service (IS). For non IS objects, this check is not performed today and hence a tag can be attached to any non IS object.

attributes.name: used_by
attributes.description: The {@term set} of users that can use this category. To add users to this, you need to have the edit privilege on the category. Similarly, to unsubscribe from this category, you need the edit privilege on the category. You should not modify other users subscription from this {@term set}.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_category__model_cardinality
classes.description: The {@name Cardinality} {@term enumerated type} defines the number of tags in a category that can be assigned to an object.

attributes.name: SINGLE
attributes.description: An object can only be assigned one of the tags in this category. For example, if a category is "Operating System", then different tags of this category would be "Windows", "Linux", and so on. In this case a VM object can be assigned only one of these tags and hence the cardinality of the associated category here is single.

attributes.name: MULTIPLE
attributes.description: An object can be assigned several of the tags in this category. For example, if a category is "Server", then different tags of this category would be "AppServer", "DatabaseServer" and so on. In this case a VM object can be assigned more than one of the above tags and hence the cardinality of the associated category here is multiple.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_category_create__spec
classes.description: The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} is used to create a category.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The display name of the category.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of the category.

attributes.name: cardinality
attributes.description: The associated cardinality ({@enum.values Cardinality}) of the category.

attributes.name: associable_types
attributes.description: Object types to which this category's tags can be attached.

attributes.name: category_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the category. If specified, the category will be created with this identifier. This has to be of the category ManagedObject Id format urn:vmomi:InventoryServiceCategory::GLOBAL The cannot contain special character ':'

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_category_update__spec
classes.description: The {@name UpdateSpec} {@term structure} describes the updates to be made to an existing category.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The display name of the category.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of the category.

attributes.name: cardinality
attributes.description: The associated cardinality ({@enum.values Cardinality}) of the category.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag
classes.description: The {@name Tag} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to create, read, update, delete, and enumerate tags.

methods.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: add_to_used_by
methods.description: Adds the {@param.name usedByEntity} to the {@link TagModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is already in the {@term set}, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the modify {@link TagModel#usedBy} privilege on the tag.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Fetches the tag information for the given tag identifier. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the tag in order to view the tag info.

methods.name: revoke_propagating_permissions
methods.description: Revokes all propagating permissions on the given tag. You should then attach a direct permission with tagging privileges on the given tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need tag related privileges (direct or propagating) on the concerned tag.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the create tag privilege on the input category.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates an existing tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the edit privilege on the tag.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Enumerates the tags in the system. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need read privilege on the individual tags. The {@term list} will only contain tags for which you have read privileges.

methods.name: list_used_tags
methods.description: Enumerates all tags for which the {@param.name usedByEntity} is part of the {@link TagModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the individual tags.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes an existing tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the delete privilege on the tag.

methods.name: remove_from_used_by
methods.description: Removes the {@param.name usedByEntity} from the {@link TagModel#usedBy} subscribers set. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is not using this tag, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need modify {@link TagModel#usedBy} privilege on the tag.

methods.name: list_tags_for_category
methods.description: Enumerates all tags for the given category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the given category and the individual tags in that category.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag__association
classes.description: The {@name TagAssociation} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to attach, detach, and query tags.

methods.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag__association
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list_attached_tags_on_objects
methods.description: Fetches the {@term list} of {@link ObjectToTags} describing the input object identifiers and the tags attached to each object. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input object. The {@link ObjectToTags#tagIds} will only contain those tags for which you have the read privilege.

methods.name: list_attachable_tags
methods.description: Fetches the {@term list} of attachable tags for the given object, omitting the tags that have already been attached. Criteria for attachability is calculated based on tagging cardinality ({@link CategoryModel#cardinality}) and associability ({@link CategoryModel#associableTypes}) constructs. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the input object. The {@term list} will only contain those tags for which you have read privileges.

methods.name: detach
methods.description: Detaches the tag from the given object. If the tag is already removed from the object, then this {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be thrown. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on the object.

methods.name: list_attached_objects
methods.description: Fetches the {@term list} of attached objects for the given tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the input tag. Only those objects for which you have the read privilege will be returned.

methods.name: attach
methods.description: Attaches the given tag to the input object. The tag needs to meet the cardinality ({@link CategoryModel#cardinality}) and associability ({@link CategoryModel#associableTypes}) criteria in order to be eligible for attachment. If the tag is already attached to the object, then this {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be thrown. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on the object.

methods.name: list_attached_objects_on_tags
methods.description: Fetches the {@term list} of {@link TagToObjects} describing the input tag identifiers and the objects they are attached to. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input tag. The {@link TagToObjects#objectIds} will only contain those objects for which you have the read privilege.

methods.name: attach_multiple_tags_to_object
methods.description: Attaches the given tags to the input object. If a tag is already attached to the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the object and the attach tag privilege on each tag.

methods.name: attach_tag_to_multiple_objects
methods.description: Attaches the given tag to the input objects. If a tag is already attached to the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on each object.

methods.name: detach_tag_from_multiple_objects
methods.description: Detaches the given tag from the input objects. If a tag is already removed from the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on each object.

methods.name: list_attached_tags
methods.description: Fetches the {@term list} of tags attached to the given object. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the input object. The {@term list} will only contain those tags for which you have the read privileges.

methods.name: detach_multiple_tags_from_object
methods.description: Detaches the given tags from the input object. If a tag is already removed from the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the object and the attach tag privilege each tag.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag__association_batch__result
classes.description: The {@name BatchResult} {@term structure} describes the result of performing the same {@term operation} on several tags or objects in a single invocation.

attributes.name: success
attributes.description: This is true if the batch {@term operation} completed without any errors. Otherwise it is false and all or some {@term operations} have failed.

attributes.name: error_messages
attributes.description: The {@term list} of error messages.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag__association_object__to__tags
classes.description: The {@name ObjectToTags} {@term structure} describes an object and its related tags. Use the {@link #listAttachedTagsOnObjects} {@term operation} to retrieve a {@term list} with each element containing an object and the tags attached to it.

attributes.name: object_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the object.

attributes.name: tag_ids
attributes.description: The identifiers of the related tags.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag__association_tag__to__objects
classes.description: The {@name TagToObjects} {@term structure} describes a tag and its related objects. Use the {@link #listAttachedObjectsOnTags} {@term operation} to retrieve a {@term list} with each element containing a tag and the objects to which it is attached.

attributes.name: tag_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the tag.

attributes.name: object_ids
attributes.description: The identifiers of the related objects.

classes.name: com_vmware_cis_tagging_tag__model
classes.description: The {@name TagModel} {@term structure} defines a tag that can be attached to vSphere objects.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The unique identifier of the tag.

attributes.name: category_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the parent category in which this tag will be created.

methods.description: Updates the configuration. The update is incremental. Any {@term field} in the {@link ConfigurationModel} {@term structure} that is {@term unset} will not be modified. Note that this update {@term operation} doesn't guarantee an atomic change of all the properties. In the case of a system crash or failure, some of the properties could be left unchanged while others may be updated.

attributes.name: automatic_sync_stop_hour
attributes.description: The hour at which the automatic synchronization will stop. Any active synchronization operation will continue to run, however no new synchronization operations will be triggered after the stop hour. This value is between 0 (midnight) and 23 inclusive.

This will not, for example, update the {@link LibraryModel#publishInfo} of a local library, nor the {@link LibraryModel#subscriptionInfo} of a subscribed library. Specific properties are updated in {@link LocalLibrary#update} and {@link SubscribedLibrary#update}.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item
classes.description: The {@name Item} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for managing library items.

methods.name: com_vmware_content_library_item
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: find
methods.description: Returns identifiers of all the visible (as determined by authorization policy) library items matching the requested {@link Item.FindSpec}.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the {@link ItemModel} with the given identifier.

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publishes the library item to specified subscriptions of the library. If no subscriptions are specified, then publishes the library item to all subscriptions of the library.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new library item. A new library item is created without any content. After creation, content can be added through the {@link UpdateSession} and {@link File} {@term services}. A library item cannot be created in a subscribed library.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the specified properties of a library item. This is an incremental update to the library item. {@term Fields} that are {@term unset} in the update specification are left unchanged. This {@term operation} cannot update a library item that is a member of a subscribed library. Those items must be updated in the source published library and synchronized to the subscribed library.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copies a library item. Copying a library item allows a duplicate to be made within the same or different library. The copy occurs by first creating a new library item, whose identifier is returned. The content of the library item is then copied asynchronously. This copy can be tracked as a task. If the copy fails, Content Library Service will roll back the copy by deleting any content that was already copied, and removing the new library item. A failure during rollback may require manual cleanup by an administrator. A library item cannot be copied into a subscribed library.
methods.parameters: client_token: string, source_library_item_id: string, destination_create_spec: com_vmware_content_library_item__model

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns the identifiers of all items in the given library.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a library item. This {@term operation} will immediately remove the item from the library that owns it. The content of the item will be asynchronously removed from the storage backings. The content deletion can be tracked with a task. In the event that the task fails, an administrator may need to manually remove the files from the storage backing. This {@term operation} cannot be used to delete a library item that is a member of a subscribed library. Removing an item from a subscribed library requires deleting the item from the original published local library and syncing the subscribed library.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item__model
classes.description: The {@name ItemModel} {@term structure} represents a library item that has been stored in a library.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: A unique identifier for this library item.

attributes.name: library_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the {@link LibraryModel} to which this item belongs.

attributes.name: content_version
attributes.description: The version of the file content list of this library item.

attributes.name: creation_time
attributes.description: The date and time when this library item was created.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: A human-readable description for this library item.

attributes.name: cached
attributes.description: The status that indicates whether the library item is on disk or not. The library item is cached when all its files are on disk.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The library item size, in bytes. The size is the sum of the size used on the storage backing for all the files in the item. When the library item is not cached, the size is 0.

attributes.name: source_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the {@link ItemModel} to which this item is synchronized to if the item belongs to a subscribed library. The value is {@term unset} for a library item that belongs to a local library.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_cert__verification__status
classes.description: The {@name CertVerificationStatus} {@term enumerated type} defines the certificate verification status of a library item. Currently applicable only to ovf item type

attributes.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
attributes.description: Existing library item which can not be verified. Applying security policy to an existing library may result in this status for items.

attributes.name: VERIFIED
attributes.description: Item has been fully validated during importing or file syncing.

attributes.name: INTERNAL
attributes.description: The Item is cloned/created through vCenter.

attributes.name: VERIFICATION_FAILURE
attributes.description: Item's certificate or manifest validation failed.

attributes.name: VERIFICATION_IN_PROGRESS
attributes.description: Item certificate verification is in progress.

attributes.name: UNTRUSTED
attributes.description: Certificate used to sign the item is not trusted.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The certificate verification status of item.

attributes.name: cert_chain

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_download__session
classes.description: The {@name DownloadSession} {@term service} manipulates download sessions, which are used to download content from the Content Library Service.

methods.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_download__session
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Cancels the download session. This {@term operation} will abort any ongoing transfers and invalidate transfer urls that the client may be downloading from.

methods.name: fail
methods.description: Terminates the download session with a client specified error message. This is useful in transmitting client side failures (for example, not being able to download a file) to the server side.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the download session with the specified identifier, including the most up-to-date status information for the session.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new download session.

methods.name: keep_alive
methods.description: Keeps a download session alive. This operation is allowed only if the session is in the {@link DownloadSessionModel.State#ACTIVE} state. If there is no activity for a download session for a certain period of time, the download session will expire. The download session expiration timeout is configurable in the Content Library Service system configuration. The default is five minutes. Invoking this {@term operation} enables a client to specifically extend the lifetime of an active download session.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists the identifiers of the download sessions created by the calling user. Optionally may filter by library item.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a download session. This removes the session and all information associated with it. Removing a download session leaves any current transfers for that session in an indeterminate state (there is no guarantee that the transfers will be able to complete). However there will no longer be a means of inspecting the status of those downloads except by seeing the effect on the library item. Download sessions for which there is no download activity or which are complete will automatically be expired and then deleted after a period of time.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_download__session__model
classes.description: The {@name DownloadSessionModel} {@term structure} provides information on an active {@link DownloadSession} resource.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The identifier of this download session.

attributes.name: library_item_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the library item whose content is being downloaded.

attributes.name: library_item_content_version
attributes.description: The content version of the library item whose content is being downloaded. This value is the {@link ItemModel#contentVersion} at the time when the session is created for the library item.

attributes.name: error_message
attributes.description: If the session is in the {@link State#ERROR} status this property will have more details about the error.

attributes.name: client_progress
attributes.description: The progress that has been made with the download. This property is to be updated by the client during the download process to indicate the progress of its work in completing the download. The initial progress is 0 until updated by the client. The maximum value is 100, which indicates that the download is complete.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: The current state ({@enum.values State}) of the download session.

attributes.name: expiration_time
attributes.description: Indicates the time after which the session will expire. The session is guaranteed not to expire before this time.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_download__session__model_state
classes.description: The state of the download session.

attributes.name: ACTIVE
attributes.description: The session is active. Individual files may be in the process of being transferred and may become ready for download at different times.

attributes.name: CANCELED
attributes.description: The session has been canceled. On-going downloads may fail. The session will stay in this state until it is either deleted by the user or automatically cleaned up by the Content Library Service.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Indicates there was an error during the session lifecycle.

attributes.name: name

attributes.name: size

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The preparation status ({@enum.values PrepareStatus}) of the file.

attributes.name: download_endpoint

attributes.name: checksum_info
attributes.description: The checksum information of the file. When the download is complete, you can retrieve the checksum from the {@link File#get} {@term operation} to verify the checksum for the downloaded file.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_downloadsession_file_prepare__status
classes.description: The {@name PrepareStatus} {@term enumerated type} defines the state of the file in preparation for download.

attributes.name: UNPREPARED

attributes.name: PREPARE_REQUESTED
attributes.description: A prepare has been requested, however the server hasn't started the preparation yet.

attributes.name: PREPARING

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Prepare failed.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_storage
classes.description: {@name Storage} is a resource that represents a specific instance of a file stored on a storage backing. Unlike {@link File}, which is abstract, storage represents concrete files on the various storage backings. A file is only represented once in {@link File}, but will be represented multiple times (once for each storage backing) in {@name Storage}. The {@name Storage} {@term service} provides information on the storage backing and the specific location of the file in that backing to privileged users who want direct access to the file on the storage medium.

methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

classes.description: The {@name Storage.Info} {@term structure} is the expanded form of {@link File.Info} that includes details about the storage backing for a file in a library item.

attributes.name: storage_backing
attributes.description: The storage backing on which this object resides. This might not be the same as the default storage backing associated with the library.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The file size, in bytes. The file size is the storage used and not the uploaded or provisioned size. For example, when uploading a disk to a datastore, the amount of storage that the disk consumes may be different from the disk file size. When the file is not cached, the size is 0.

attributes.name: cached
attributes.description: Indicates whether the file is on disk or not.

attributes.name: version
attributes.description: The version of this file; incremented when a new copy of the file is uploaded.
