classes.description: The {@name TransferEndpoint} {@term structure} encapsulates a URI along with extra information about it.

attributes.name: ssl_certificate_thumbprint
attributes.description: Thumbprint of the expected SSL certificate for this endpoint. Only used for HTTPS connections. The thumbprint is the SHA-1 hash of the DER encoding of the remote endpoint's SSL certificate. If set, the remote endpoint's SSL certificate is only accepted if it matches this thumbprint, and no other certificate validation is performed.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_transfer__status
classes.description: The {@name TransferStatus} {@term enumerated type} defines the transfer state of a file.

attributes.name: WAITING_FOR_TRANSFER
attributes.description: Indicates that a file has been defined for a library item and its content needs to be uploaded.

attributes.name: TRANSFERRING
attributes.description: Indicates that data is being transferred to the file.

attributes.name: READY
attributes.description: Indicates that the file has been fully transferred and is ready to be used.

attributes.name: VALIDATING
attributes.description: Indicates that the file is being validated (checksum, type adapters).

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Indicates that there was an error transferring or validating the file.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_update__session
classes.description: The {@name UpdateSession} {@term service} manipulates sessions that are used to upload content into the Content Library Service, and/or to remove files from a library item.

methods.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_update__session
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Cancels the update session and sets its state to {@link UpdateSessionModel.State#CANCELED}. This {@term operation} will free up any temporary resources currently associated with the session. This {@term operation} is not allowed if the session has been already completed. Cancelling an update session will cancel any in progress transfers (either uploaded by the client or pulled by the server). Any content that has been already received will be scheduled for deletion.

methods.name: fail
methods.description: Terminates the update session with a client specified error message. This is useful in transmitting client side failures (for example, not being able to access a file) to the server side.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the update session with the specified identifier, including the most up-to-date status information for the session.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new update session. An update session is used to make modifications to a library item. Modifications are not visible to other clients unless the session is completed and all necessary files have been received. Content Library Service allows only one single update session to be active for a specific library item.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the properties of an update session. This is an incremental update to the update session. Any {@term field} in the {@link UpdateSessionModel} {@term structure} that is {@term unset} will not be modified. This {@term operation} will only update the property {@link UpdateSessionModel#warningBehavior} of the update session. This will not, for example, update the {@link UpdateSessionModel#libraryItemId} or {@link UpdateSessionModel#state} of an update session. This {@term operation} requires the session to be in the {@link UpdateSessionModel.State#ACTIVE} state.

methods.name: keep_alive
methods.description: Keeps an update session alive. If there is no activity for an update session after a period of time, the update session will expire, then be deleted. The update session expiration timeout is configurable in the Content Library Service system configuration. The default is five minutes. Invoking this {@term operation} enables a client to specifically extend the lifetime of the update session.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists the identifiers of the update session created by the calling user. Optionally may filter by library item.

methods.name: complete
methods.description: Completes the update session. This indicates that the client has finished making all the changes required to the underlying library item. If the client is pushing the content to the server, the library item will be updated once this call returns. If the server is pulling the content, the call may return before the changes become visible. In that case, the client can track the session to know when the server is done. This {@term operation} requires the session to be in the {@link UpdateSessionModel.State#ACTIVE} state. Depending on the type of the library item associated with this session, a type adapter may be invoked to verify the validity of the files uploaded. The user can explicitly validate the session before completing the session by using the {@link com.vmware.content.library.item.updatesession.File#validate} {@term operation}. Modifications are not visible to other clients unless the session is completed and all necessary files have been received.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes an update session. This removes the session and all information associated with it. Removing an update session leaves any current transfers for that session in an indeterminate state (there is no guarantee that the server will terminate the transfers, or that the transfers can be completed). However there will no longer be a means of inspecting the status of those uploads except by seeing the effect on the library item. Update sessions for which there is no upload activity or which are complete will automatically be deleted after a period of time.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_update__session__model
classes.description: The {@name UpdateSessionModel} {@term structure} provides information on an active {@link UpdateSession} resource.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The identifier of this update session.

attributes.name: library_item_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the library item to which content will be uploaded or removed.

attributes.name: library_item_content_version
attributes.description: The content version of the library item whose content is being modified. This value is the {@link ItemModel#contentVersion} at the time when the session is created for the library item.

attributes.name: error_message
attributes.description: If the session is in the {@link State#ERROR} status this property will have more details about the error.

attributes.name: client_progress
attributes.description: The progress that has been made with the upload. This property is to be updated by the client during the upload process to indicate the progress of its work in completing the upload. The initial progress is 0 until updated by the client. The maximum value is 100, which indicates that the update is complete.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: The current state ({@enum.values State}) of the update session.

attributes.name: expiration_time
attributes.description: Indicates the time after which the session will expire. The session is guaranteed not to expire earlier than this time.

attributes.name: preview_info
attributes.description: A preview of the files currently being uploaded in the session. This property will be set only when the session is in the {@link State#ACTIVE}.

attributes.name: warning_behavior
attributes.description: Indicates the update session behavior if warnings are raised in the session preview. Any warning which is raised by session preview but not ignored by the client will, by default, fail the update session.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_update__session__model_state

attributes.name: ACTIVE
attributes.description: The session is currently active. This is the initial state when the session is created. Files may be uploaded by the client or pulled by the Content Library Service at this stage.

attributes.name: DONE
attributes.description: The session is done and all its effects are now visible.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: There was an error during the session.

attributes.name: CANCELED
attributes.description: The session has been canceled.

attributes.name: subject
attributes.description: Certificate subject. For example: C=US/ST=Massachusetts/L=Hopkinton/O=EMC Corporation/OU=EMC Avamar/CN=EMC Corporation.

attributes.name: self_signed

attributes.name: x509

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_updatesession_file
classes.description: The {@name File} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for accessing files within an update session.

methods.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_updatesession_file
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: add
methods.description: Requests file content to be changed (either created, or updated). Depending on the source type of the file, this {@term operation} will either return an upload endpoint where the client can push the content, or the server will pull from the provided source endpoint. If a file with the same name already exists in this session, this {@term operation} will be used to update the content of the existing file. When importing a file directly from storage, where the source endpoint is a file or datastore URI, you will need to have the ContentLibrary.ReadStorage privilege on the library item. If the file is located in the same directory as the library storage backing folder, the server will move the file instead of copying it, thereby allowing instantaneous import of files for efficient backup and restore scenarios. In all other cases, a copy is performed rather than a move.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves information about a specific file in the snapshot of the library item at the time when the update session was created.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists all files in the library item associated with the update session.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Requests a file to be removed. The file will only be effectively removed when the update session is completed.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Validates the files in the update session with the referenced identifier and ensures all necessary files are received. In the case where a file is missing, this {@term operation} will return its name in the {@link ValidationResult#missingFiles} set. The user can add the missing files and try re-validating. For other type of errors, {@link ValidationResult#invalidFiles} will contain the list of invalid files.

The flag is true for most files, and false for metadata files such as manifest and certificate file of update session with library item type OVF. Any file with {@link Info#keepInStorage} set to false will not show up in the list of files returned from {@link com.vmware.content.library.item.File#list} upon update session completion.

attributes.description: Indicates the state of the preview of the update session.

attributes.name: certificate_info
attributes.description: The certificate information of the signed update session content.

attributes.description: The list of warnings raised for this update session. Any warning which is not ignored by the client will, by default, fail the update session during session complete operation.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_item_updatesession_preview__info_state
classes.description: The {@name State} {@term enumerated type} defines the state of the update session's preview.

attributes.name: UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: There are no files in the update session OR a preview is not possible for the files currently in the update session. However, preview may be possible after metadata files such as OVF descriptor are added to the session. In this case the state will transition to {@name PREPARING}.

attributes.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
attributes.description: Preview is not possible for this update session. This state is reached when there are no metadata files in the update session and user invokes a session complete operation.

attributes.name: PREPARING
attributes.description: A preview is being prepared for the files currently in the update session. This state is reached when the applicable metadata files are added to the update session but their content is not fully uploaded yet. For OVF item type, this state indicates that the OVF descriptor file is currently being uploaded.

attributes.name: AVAILABLE
attributes.description: Preview is available for this update session. It is possible to review certificate details and warnings, if any. This state is reached when the applicable metadata files in the session have been fully uploaded.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_subscribed__item
classes.description: The {@name SubscribedItem} {@term service} manages the unique features of library items that are members of a subscribed library.

methods.name: com_vmware_content_library_subscribed__item
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: sync
methods.description: Forces the synchronization of an individual library item in a subscribed library. Synchronizing an individual item will update that item's metadata from the remote source. If the source library item on the remote library has been deleted, this {@term operation} will delete the library item from the subscribed library as well. The default behavior of the synchronization is determined by the {@link SubscriptionInfo} of the library which owns the library item. If {@link SubscriptionInfo#onDemand} is true, then the file content is not synchronized by default. In this case, only the library item metadata is synchronized. The file content may still be forcefully synchronized by passing true for the {@param.name forceSyncContent} {@term parameter}. If {@link SubscriptionInfo#onDemand} is false, then this call will always synchronize the file content. The {@param.name forceSyncContent} {@term parameter} is ignored when the subscription is not on-demand. When the file content has been synchronized, the {@link ItemModel#cached} {@term field} will be true. This {@term operation} will return immediately and create an asynchronous task to perform the synchronization.

methods.name: evict
methods.description: Evicts the cached content of a library item in a subscribed library. This {@term operation} allows the cached content of a library item to be removed to free up storage capacity. This {@term operation} will only work when a library item is synchronized on-demand. When a library is not synchronized on-demand, it always attempts to keep its cache up-to-date with the published source. Evicting the library item will set {@link ItemModel#cached} to false.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_library_subscription__info
classes.description: The {@name SubscriptionInfo} {@term structure} defines the subscription behavior for a subscribed library.

attributes.name: authentication_method
attributes.description: Indicate how the subscribed library should authenticate ({@enum.values AuthenticationMethod}) with the published library endpoint.

attributes.name: automatic_sync_enabled
attributes.description: Whether the library should participate in automatic library synchronization. In order for automatic synchronization to happen, the global {@link ConfigurationModel#automaticSyncEnabled} option must also be true. The subscription is still active even when automatic synchronization is turned off, but synchronization is only activated with an explicit call to {@link SubscribedLibrary#sync} or {@link SubscribedItem#sync}. In other words, manual synchronization is still available even when automatic synchronization is disabled.

attributes.name: source_info
attributes.description: Information about the source published library. This {@term field} will be set for a subscribed library which is associated with a subscription of the published library.

methods.name: com_vmware_content_subscribed__library
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns a given subscribed library.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new subscribed library. Once created, the subscribed library will be empty. If the {@link LibraryModel#subscriptionInfo} property is set, the Content Library Service will attempt to synchronize to the remote source. This is an asynchronous operation so the content of the published library may not immediately appear.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the properties of a subscribed library. This is an incremental update to the subscribed library. {@term Fields} that are {@term unset} in the update specification will be left unchanged.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns the identifiers of all subscribed libraries in the Content Library.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the specified subscribed library. Deleting a subscribed library will remove the entry immediately and begin an asynchronous task to remove all cached content for the library. If the asynchronous task fails, file content may remain on the storage backing. This content will require manual removal.

methods.name: sync
methods.description: Forces the synchronization of the subscribed library. Synchronizing a subscribed library forcefully with this {@term operation} will perform the same synchronization behavior as would run periodically for the library. The {@link SubscriptionInfo#onDemand} setting is respected. Calling this {@term operation} on a library that is already in the process of synchronizing will have no effect.

methods.name: evict
methods.description: Evicts the cached content of an on-demand subscribed library. This {@term operation} allows the cached content of a subscribed library to be removed to free up storage capacity. This {@term operation} will only work when a subscribed library is synchronized on-demand.

methods.name: probe
methods.description: Probes remote library subscription information, including URL, SSL certificate and password. The resulting {@link ProbeResult} {@term structure} describes whether or not the subscription configuration is successful.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_subscribed__library_probe__result
classes.description: The {@name ProbeResult} {@term structure} defines the subscription information probe result. This describes whether using a given subscription URL is successful or if there are access problems, such as SSL errors.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The status of probe result. This will be one of {@enum.values Status}.

attributes.name: ssl_thumbprint
attributes.description: The SSL thumbprint for the remote endpoint.

attributes.name: error_messages
attributes.description: If the probe result is in an error status, this {@term field} will contain the detailed error messages.

classes.name: com_vmware_content_subscribed__library_probe__result_status
classes.description: The {@name Status} {@term enumerated type} defines the error status constants for the probe result.

attributes.name: SUCCESS
attributes.description: Indicates that the probe was successful.

attributes.name: INVALID_URL
attributes.description: Indicates that the supplied URL was not valid.

attributes.name: TIMED_OUT
attributes.description: Indicates that the probe timed out while attempting to connect to the URL.

attributes.name: HOST_NOT_FOUND
attributes.description: Indicates that the host in the URL could not be found.

attributes.name: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND
attributes.description: Indicates that the given resource at the URL was not found.

attributes.name: INVALID_CREDENTIALS
attributes.description: Indicates that the connection was rejected due to invalid credentials.

attributes.name: CERTIFICATE_ERROR
attributes.description: Indicates that the provided server certificate thumbprint in {@link SubscriptionInfo#sslThumbprint} is invalid. In this case, the returned {@link #sslThumbprint} should be set in {@link SubscriptionInfo#sslThumbprint}.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
attributes.description: Indicates an unspecified error different from the other error cases defined in {@link Status}.

classes.name: com_vmware_contentinternal_library_item_metadata
classes.description: A service for managing metadata on library items. A library item can have one or multiple metadata key/value pairs. These can be used to add extra information to the library item. Library item metadata will be replicated through the VCSP protocol. If a library item belongs to a published library, the subscribed library item will have the same metadata once a sync happens. Note that metadata cannot be set on library items that are part of a subscribed library.

methods.name: com_vmware_contentinternal_library_item_metadata
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the metadata info associated with this key on the library item. If no key is defined this {@term operation} will return null.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds the list of metadata key/value pairs to a library item. If the key on this item already exists, this {@term operation} will override the old value with the new one. Existing metadata of other keys on the item will remain unchanged.

methods.name: list_all
methods.description: Lists all metadata with the given key that are associated with the specified library items. If no metadata is found for the items and the key, the method will return an empty list. An entry will be added to the map only if there is a metadata matching the given metadata key for a library item in the given list.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists all metadata associated with the library item. If no metadata is found, the method will return an empty list.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Removes metadata from the library item. If the library item doesn't have such a key from the list, this call will be a no-op. If specific keys are not provided, all metadata for the item is removed.

methods.name: list_items
methods.description: Lists all library item IDs that have the given metadata key and value. If no library item can be found, empty list will be returned.

Note that metadata cannot be set on subscribed libraries.

attributes.name: COMPATIBLE
attributes.description: When given hardware is certified for the specified ESXi release but no validation of the software of this hardware is performed.

attributes.name: INCOMPATIBLE
attributes.description: When given hardware is not certified for the specified ESXi release.

attributes.name: UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: When there is no information about specified hardware.

attributes.name: CERTIFIED
attributes.description: When given hardware is certified for the specified ESXi release. Its software is also validated and it is also certified.

attributes.name: NOT_CERTIFIED
attributes.description: When given hardware is certified for the specified ESXi release. Its software is also validated and it is not certified.

attributes.description: Additional components which are part of the software specification. If value is not given for a particular component then version for that component will be picked from the constraints. These override the components present in {@link #addOn} and {@link #baseImage}.

attributes.description: Mapping from solution identifier to the solution specification. The key is the solution name and the value is the specification detailing components registered by that solution.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_hosts_software_connection__spec
classes.description: The {@name ConnectionSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the specification to be used for connecting to the host during the {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation}

attributes.name: auth_type
attributes.description: Specifies what type of authentication ({@enum.values AuthenticationType}) is to be used when connecting with the host. USERNAME_PASSWORD is intended to be used when connecting to a host that is not currently part of the vCenter inventory. EXISTING is intented for hosts that are in vCenter inventory, in which case, HostServiceTicket will be used to connect to the host.

attributes.name: host_credential
attributes.description: Specifies the host details to be used during the {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation}

attributes.name: host
attributes.description: Specifies the host Managed Object ID to be used during the {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation}

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_hosts_software_connection__spec_authentication__type
classes.description: The {@name AuthenticationType} {@term enumerated type} defines the possible types of authentication supported when connecting to the host.

attributes.name: USERNAME_PASSWORD
attributes.description: Connect to host using host's credentials {@name HostCredentials} {@term structure}.

attributes.name: EXISTING
attributes.description: Connect to the host using service ticket. Note: This is supported only for hosts present in the VC inventory.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_hosts_software_host__credentials
classes.description: The {@name HostCredentials} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the host's username, password, port number and ssl thumbprint to be used when connecting to the host using USERNAME_PASSWORD option in the {@name AuthenticationType} {@term structure}.

attributes.name: host_name
attributes.description: The IP address or DNS resolvable name of the host.

attributes.name: user_name
attributes.description: Specifies the username to be used during the {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation}

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: Specifies the password to be used during the {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation}

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Specifies the port number of the host to be used during {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation}

attributes.name: ssl_thumb_print
attributes.description: Specifies the sslThumbPrint of the host to be used during {@link com.vmware.esx.hosts.Software#get} {@term operation} SHA1 hash of the host's SSL certificate.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_array__compliance__value
classes.description: The {@name ArrayComplianceValue} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the drift in an array of primitive data type values. Depending on the primitive data type of the configuration only one of the members in this structure is populated.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the configuration in drift.

attributes.name: bool_arr
attributes.description: Describes the drift in a boolean array of configuration values.

attributes.name: long_arr
attributes.description: Describes the drift in an integer(16 bit or 32 bit or 64 bit) array of configuration values.

attributes.name: double_arr
attributes.description: Describes the drift in a floating point(float or double) array of configuration values.

attributes.name: str_arr
attributes.description: Describes the drift in a strings array of configuration values.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_boolean__compliance__value
classes.description: The {@name BooleanComplianceValue} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe a boolean value in drift. This struture captures the desired value and the host value for the drift.

attributes.name: host_value
attributes.description: Boolean value on ESXi host.

attributes.name: desired_value
attributes.description: Boolean value in desired document.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_boolean__compliance__value__array
classes.description: The {@name BooleanComplianceValueArray} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe an boolean array in drift. This struture captures the desired values and the host values for the drift.

attributes.name: host_arr
attributes.description: Boolean array on ESXi host.

attributes.name: desired_arr
attributes.description: Boolean array in desired document.

attributes.name: host_status

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_cluster__compliance
classes.description: This {@name ClusterCompliance} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the compliance result for each host in the cluster as well as overall cluster compliance status.

attributes.name: cluster_status
attributes.description: Consolidated status of all host compliance checks.

attributes.name: commit
attributes.description: This identifier refers to the commit action of importing the desired configuration document. It will not be set for a draft execution of check compliance.

attributes.name: software_commit
attributes.description: The current commit ID for the software associated with the cluster.

attributes.name: hosts
attributes.description: Map of host IDs to their compliance results.

attributes.name: compliant_hosts
attributes.description: Identifiers of compliant hosts

attributes.name: non_compliant_hosts
attributes.description: Identifiers of non-compliant hosts

attributes.name: not_computable_hosts
attributes.description: Identifiers of not computable hosts

attributes.name: unavailable_hosts
attributes.description: Identifiers of failed or unavailable hosts. There won't be any compliance details for these hosts in {@link hosts}

attributes.name: last_check_time
attributes.description: CheckCompliance completion time.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_cluster__compliance_status
classes.description: Consolidated compliance status of the cluster

attributes.name: OK
attributes.description: All hosts in the cluster are compliant.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_cluster__precheck__result
classes.description: The {@name PrecheckResult} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe precheck status of applying the desired document to a group of hosts.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Overall status of precheck on the cluster. Operation is sucessfull when precheck is run on all hosts successfully and no validation or precheck errors are detected.

attributes.name: commit
attributes.description: This identifier refers to the commit action of importing the desired configuration document. It will not be set for a precheck of a draft configuration.

attributes.name: software_commit
attributes.description: The current commit ID for the software associated with the cluster.

attributes.name: end_time
attributes.description: Precheck completion time.

attributes.name: precheck_summary
attributes.description: Summarizing precheck stating number of precheck errors on host and cluster.

attributes.name: remediation_summary
attributes.description: Summarizing remediation stating number of hosts needing reboot and maintenance mode during remediation and number of precheck errors on host and cluster.

attributes.name: remediation_notes
attributes.description: Static notes to the user describing steps that will be taken during remediation.

attributes.name: host_info
attributes.description: Map of host IDs to hostname

attributes.name: host_precheck
attributes.description: Map of host IDs to their precheck results. If {@link #status} is ERROR, This field will contain Validation errors or Host Impact and Health Check errors. If {@link #status} is OK, This field will contain Impact and Health Check information.

attributes.name: precheck_result
attributes.description: This field represents the precheck results on the cluster, if any one host in the cluster needs to be put in maintenance mode or to be rebooted.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_cluster__precheck__result_status
classes.description: The {@name Status} {@term enumerated type} contains the possible statuses of the Precheck API on the cluster.

attributes.name: OK
attributes.description: The operation completed successfully.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: The operation failed with errors.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_compliance__info
classes.description: The {@name ComplianceInfo} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the configuration drift between the desired document and the configurations on the ESXi host.

attributes.name: sets
attributes.description: List of configuration drifts represented by {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.configuration.SettingCompliance}. Each describing a configuration whose value on ESXi host is different to that in the desired document

attributes.name: adds
attributes.description: List of configuration drifts represented by {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.configuration.SettingCompliance}. Each describing a configuration that is present in the desired document but absent on the ESXi host.

attributes.name: deletes
attributes.description: List of configuration drifts represented by {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.configuration.SettingCompliance}. Each describing a configuration that is present on the ESXi host but absent in the desired document.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_compliance__status
classes.description: This {@name ComplianceStatus} {@term enumerated type} represents the compliance status of desired configuration on the ESXi host.

attributes.name: COMPLIANT
attributes.description: ESXi host is in compliance with Desired configuration.

attributes.name: NON_COMPLIANT
attributes.description: ESXi host is not in compliance with Desired configuration.

attributes.name: NOT_COMPUTABLE
attributes.description: Compliance status could not be computed on the ESXi host due to some errors.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_compliance__value
classes.description: The {@name ComplianceValue} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describes the drift in an ESXi host configuration from desired value. This structure is used to describe either a change in configuration value(set) or addition of configuration or deletion of a configuration. When used to describe addition or deletion of a configuration, only the path, type and isArray fields are set, and type is always expected to be USER_DATA. When used to describe a set operation, hostValue and desiredValue would only be set if drift is in a property that is of primitive type.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Full path to the configuration at drift within the desired document.

attributes.name: is_array
attributes.description: Indicates if the configuration in drift is an array.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Describes the drift in a primitive data type value.

attributes.name: array_value
attributes.description: Describes the drift in a array of primitive type values.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_configuration_compliance__value__type
classes.description: The {@name ComplianceValueType} {@term enumerated type} represents the type of configuration in drift.

attributes.name: BINARY
attributes.description: Indicates the value is a binary.

attributes.name: BOOLEAN
attributes.description: Indicates the value is a boolean.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_depot__overrides
classes.description: The {@name DepotOverrides} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage software depots overriden for a given cluster. In general ESX servers reach out to vCenter (VUM) to fetch the metadata and payloads required for lifecycle operations. But in ROBO environments ESX clusters can't (or because of bandwidth requirements shouldn't) reach out to vCenter to fetch payloads and metadata. This {@term service} allows setting cluster level overrides for depots. If any depots are provided for a cluster, then vCenter level depots are not used for that cluster's remediation. These are not synced periodically at vCenter and are only used by ESXs for lifecycle operations.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software
classes.description: The {@name Software} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage desired software specification of an ESX cluster.

methods.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the complete desired software specification.

methods.name: scan$task
methods.description: Scans all the hosts in the cluster against the cluster's desired state. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: check$task
methods.description: Runs checks on the cluster before applying the desired software document across all hosts in the cluster. Checks if all hosts in the cluster are in a good state to be updated with the desired software document. If {@basename CheckSpec#commit} {@term field} is {@term set} it implies the minimum commit that the check {@term operation} should use, however if subsequent commits have been made to the desired state document the check {@term operation} will use the most recent desired state document. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: export
methods.description: Exports the desired software specification document and/or image. This API will not export the solution section of the desired software specification.

methods.name: apply$task
methods.description: Applies the desired software document associated with the given cluster to hosts within the cluster. If {@basename ApplySpec#commit} {@term field} is {@term set}, it implies the minimum commit that the {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation} should use, however if subsequent commits have been made to the desired state document the apply {@term operation} will use the most recent desired state document. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

classes.description: The {@name ApplyResult} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the result of an {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation}.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Specifies the aggregated status of the {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation}.

attributes.name: commit
attributes.description: The identifier of the commit used to fetch the desired software document to be applied to all hosts within the cluster.

attributes.name: host_info
attributes.description: Information of the hosts in this cluster to which the desired software document specified by the {@link #commit} should be applied to.

attributes.name: host_status
attributes.description: Status of the hosts in this cluster to which the desired software document specified by the {@link #commit} was applied to. Hosts on which the {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation} was successful are specified by {@link #successfulHosts}. Hosts on which the apply {@term operation} failed are specified by {@link #failedHosts}. Hosts which were skipped by the {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation} are specified by {@link #skippedHosts}.

attributes.name: successful_hosts
attributes.description: Hosts in this cluster to which the desired software document specified by the {@link #commit} has been successfully applied to.

attributes.name: failed_hosts
attributes.description: Hosts in this cluster to which the desired software document specified by the {@link #commit} failed to be applied to.

attributes.name: skipped_hosts
attributes.description: Hosts in this cluster that were skipped by the {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation}.

attributes.name: notifications
attributes.description: Notifications providing additional information for {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.Software#apply} {@term operation}. These notifications are mutually exclusive with the notifications in {@name ApplyStatus}.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software_drafts
classes.description: The {@name Drafts} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage working copy of software documents.

methods.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software_drafts
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the information about given software draft.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new software draft from the desired document. It will be deleted, when the draft is committed successfully. If a desired document is missing, then this {@term operation} will create an empty draft.

methods.name: import_software_spec
methods.description: Imports the desired software specification as a new draft. If a desired document is missing, then this {@term operation} will create an empty draft except when the source type is of either {@link SourceType#LATEST_RECOMMENDATION} or {@link SourceType#CURRENT_SERIES_RECOMMENDATION}, then {@link NotFound} error is reported. In addition, the exisiting draft will be overwritten when the source type is of either {@name SourceType#LATEST_RECOMMENDATION} or {@name SourceType#CURRENT_SERIES_RECOMMENDATION}.

methods.name: validate$task
methods.description: Validates the software draft. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: scan$task
methods.description: Scans all the hosts in the cluster against the software draft. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about the software drafts for the specified cluster that match the {@link FilterSpec}.

methods.name: commit$task
methods.description: Commits the specified draft as the desired state document. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the software draft.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software_drafts_source__type
classes.description: The {@name SourceType} {@term enumerated type} defines possible values of sources to import software specification.

attributes.name: PULL
attributes.description: Content is pulled from the URL location. The URL scheme of the value in {@link #pullLocation) can be http, https or file.

attributes.name: PUSH
attributes.description: Content was previously uploaded using the file upload enpoint present on vCenter appliance. This endpoint is present at https://VCENTERFQDN:9087/vum-fileupload URL.

attributes.name: JSON_STRING
attributes.description: The string representing the content of the software specfication.

attributes.name: LATEST_RECOMMENDATION
attributes.description: Content is from recommended image specification based on latest base image version. Recommendations can be generated using {@link: com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.Recommendations#generate}.

attributes.name: CURRENT_SERIES_RECOMMENDATION
attributes.description: Content is from recommended image specification based on latest base image patch or update of the current series. For example, a cluster's current desired base image is 7.0. Recommendation engine will look into any recommendable image specification with 7.0 series base images available at depot manager and try to recommend the highest version within 7.0 series if possible. Let's say in this example, depot manager has 7.0 patch a and 7.0 update 1 base images. Recommendation engine would first validate all possible images based on 7.0 update 1. If it finds a valid one, it will store the recommended content with that series. This enum value will point to that stored recommended image content. Recommendations can be generated using {@link: com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.Recommendations#generate}.

attributes.name: SPECIFIED_BASE_IMAGE_RECOMMENDATION
attributes.description: Content is from recommended image specification based on a specified base image version. Recommendations can be generated using {@link: com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.software.Recommendations#generate}.

attributes.name: status

attributes.name: scan_time
attributes.description: HCL Validation check time.

attributes.name: updated_since_last_check
attributes.description: Flag to indicate if there were any hardware compatibility overrides were performed after the last check {@term operation}.

attributes.name: v_san_data_only
attributes.description: HCL Validation Computed only for vSAN Clusters.

attributes.name: commit
attributes.description: Spec Identifier of the desired configuration on which the HCL scan is performed to generate this result, populated by the HCL validation.

attributes.name: base_image_version
attributes.description: Target base image version E.g., version = BaseImageSpec->Version {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.BaseImageSpec#version} {@term structure}

attributes.name: pci_device_compliance
attributes.description: Compliance result for the Pci Devices that are present in all hosts of the cluster.

attributes.name: storage_device_compliance
attributes.description: Compliance result for storage devices in all the hosts of the cluster. Currently only includes SAS/SATA storage devices.

attributes.name: notifications
attributes.description: Notifications returned by the HCL Validation operation.

attributes.name: note
attributes.description: Localizable disclaimer notice to show on the UI detailing the type of checks are done by the HCL Validaiton. Example : HCL Validation is only done on storage and network controllers.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software_reports_compliance__status
classes.description: The {@name ComplianceStatus} {@term enumerated type} contains the possible different status of compliance with respect to target version.

attributes.name: COMPATIBLE
attributes.description: Target hardware is compliant with VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG)

attributes.name: INCOMPATIBLE
attributes.description: Target hardware is not (recognizably) compliant with VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG)

attributes.name: HCL_DATA_UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: HCL data can not be fetched to validate cluster hardware.

attributes.name: UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: Target hardware compliance with VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG) cannot be determined.

attributes.name: NO_FIRMWARE_PROVIDER
attributes.description: No Firmware HSM present in Software Spec to get Firmware Details {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.HardwareSupportPackageInfo} {@term structure}

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_clusters_software_reports_compliance__status__detail
classes.description: The {@name ComplianceStatusDetail} {@term enumerated type} contains the essential status values for compliance with respect to target VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG)

attributes.name: CERTIFIED
attributes.description: Hardware is specifically certified for target vSphere version according to the VCG/HCL

attributes.name: NOT_CERTIFIED
attributes.description: Hardware is specifically not certified for target vSphere version according to the VCG/HCL

attributes.name: HCL_DATA_UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: HCL data can not be fetched to validate cluster hardware.

attributes.name: HOSTS_UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: Hosts in cluster are not available to validate cluster hardware.

attributes.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_UNKNOWN
attributes.description: No firmware version information is available (for example no Hardware Support Manager, HSM, configured in the cluster's Software Spec to get Firmware Details {@link com.vmware.esx.settings.HardwareSupportPackageInfo} {@term structure} or the system failed to retrieve the current firmware version of a device using the specified HSM.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: When given hardware may be certified for a release but its status can't be definitively determined due to ambiguity in server model, CPU series, or BIOS version

attributes.name: VENDOR_UPDATE
attributes.description: When BIOS or firmware has been updated from a certified entry found in the VMware Compatibility Guide (VCG)

attributes.name: USER_VERIFIED
attributes.description: When a server or device's HCL compliance status has been overridden by the user to mark the system as compliant

attributes.name: USER_FLAGGED
attributes.description: When a server or device's HCL compliance status has been overridden by the user to mark the system as non-compliant

attributes.name: MUTED

methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns components registered for the given solution in the desired software specification.

methods.name: set$task
methods.description: Sets the components registered for the given solution in the desired software specification. The task will set only one solution specification at a time. Solution constraints would be validated with the current desired software specification before it is committed as new desired spec. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.
methods.parameters: cluster: string, solution: string, spec: com_vmware_esx_settings_solution__spec

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns all solutions in the desired software specification.

methods.name: delete$task
methods.description: Deletes the given solution from the desired software specification. The deletion will be validated along with the entire software specification before it is committed as new desired spec. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: sync$task
methods.description: Syncs the metadata from the currently configured online or umds depots. If any umds depot is set, then metadata is downloaded from that depot else metadata is downloaded from the online depots. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_offline
classes.description: The {@name Offline} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage offline software depots used during ESX lifecycle management.

methods.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_offline
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the information about an imported offline software depot.

methods.name: create_from_host$task
methods.description: Extract the current software specification applied to the host and import it into the depot. Returns details about the current software specification applied to the host. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: create$task
methods.description: Imports a new offline software depot. This will also import the metadata and payloads from this offline depot. The returned task will fail and no offline depot would be created if there are any issues during import. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} where the task-id is the response of this operation.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns currently imported offline software depots.

methods.name: delete$task
methods.description: The task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} removes content of an imported offline depot from vLCM completely. Note: The non task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} has been deprecated. It deletes only the record of depot from the list of imported offline software depots, instead of removing the depot's content from vLCM.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: The task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} removes content of an imported offline depot from vLCM completely. Note: The non task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} has been deprecated. It deletes only the record of depot from the list of imported offline software depots, instead of removing the depot's content from vLCM.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_offline_connection__spec
classes.description: The {@name ConnectionSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} that describe the specification to be used for connecting to the host during the {@link #createFromHost} {@term operation}.

attributes.name: auth_type
attributes.description: Specifies what type of authentication ({@enum.values AuthenticationType}) is to be used when connecting with the host. USERNAME_PASSWORD is intended to be used when connecting to a host that is not currently part of the vCenter inventory. EXISTING is intented for hosts that are in vCenter inventory, in which case, HostServiceTicket will be used to connect to the host.

attributes.name: host_credential
attributes.description: Specifies the host details to be used during the {@link Offline#createFromHost} {@term operation}.

attributes.name: host
attributes.description: Specifies the host Managed Object ID to be used during the {@link Offline#createFromHost} {@term operation}.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_offline_connection__spec_authentication__type
classes.description: The {@name AuthenticationType} {@term enumerated type} defines the possible types of authentication supported when connecting to the host.

attributes.name: USERNAME_PASSWORD
attributes.description: Connect to host using host's credentials {@link Offline#HostCredentials} {@term structure}.

attributes.name: EXISTING
attributes.description: Connect to the host using service ticket. Note: This is supported only for hosts present in the VC inventory.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_online
classes.description: The {@name Online} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage online software depots used during ESX lifecycle management.

methods.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_online
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: flush$task
methods.description: The task-based {@name #flush} {@term operation} removes content of a system-defined online depot from vLCM completely. As a result, the system-defined online depot will be disabled. Note: To remove content of user-imported online depots, use the task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation}.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the information about a currently configured online software depot.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a new online software depot to the list of currently configured online software depots.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the configuration of a currently configured online software depot.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns a list of currently configured online software depots.

methods.name: delete$task
methods.description: The task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} removes content of a user-imported online depot from vLCM completely. As a result, the URL of the user-imported online depot will also be removed. Note: 1. To remove content of system-defined online depots, use {@name #flush} {@term operation}. 2. The non task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} has been deprecated. It only deletes the record of depot from the list of imported online software depots, instead of removing the depot's content from the system.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: The task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} removes content of a user-imported online depot from vLCM completely. As a result, the URL of the user-imported online depot will also be removed. Note: 1. To remove content of system-defined online depots, use {@name #flush} {@term operation}. 2. The non task-based {@name #delete} {@term operation} has been deprecated. It only deletes the record of depot from the list of imported online software depots, instead of removing the depot's content from the system.

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_depots_sync__schedule_schedule
classes.description: The {@name Schedule} {@term structure} defines a schedule.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Frequency of the schedule.

attributes.name: skip
attributes.description: This determines the units of {@name Recurrence} to skip before the scheduled task runs again. For example, value of 1 for HOURLY type means the scheduled task runs every 2 hours. The value must be within the range 0 to 998.

attributes.name: minute
attributes.description: Minute at which schedule should be run. The value must be within the range 0 to 59.

attributes.name: hour
attributes.description: Hour at which schedule should be run. The value must be within the range 0 to 23.

attributes.name: day_of_month
attributes.description: Day at which schedule should be run. The value must be within the range 1 to 31. If the value exceeds the total number of days in the month, the schedule will run on the last day of the month.

attributes.name: day_of_week
attributes.description: Day of the week when schedule should be run

classes.name: com_vmware_esx_settings_hardware__support_managers_packages_filter__spec
classes.description: The {@name FilterSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} used to filter the results when listing OEM Hardware Support Packages (HSPs), see {@link #list}).

attributes.name: base_image_version
attributes.description: vSphere release version the Hardware Support Package (HSP) must support to match the filter. Only Hardware Support Packages (HSPs) compatible with the vSphere release version specified in 'baseImageVersion' will be returned. The 'baseImageVersion' parameter should be a full numeric base image version string (e.g. "7.1.0-2.3.436234"). Future implementations may support version specification by prefix (e.g. "7.1" to specify all updates and builds of 7.1) or other forms of specification (e.g. ">=7.0"). Hardware Support Pacakges (HSPs) may be advertised as supporting truncated version strings to indicate the remainder is wildcarded. Matching is on the specified substring only, so a bundle supporting "7.1.0-2" would match a 'release' parameter of "7.1.0-2.3.436234" as well as "7.1.0-2.1.4133564" and "7.1.0-1.0.355667" but not "7.1.0-3.0.63445" or any base image version starting with "7.2". Note that we require compatible base image versions be specified at least down to the update version (i.e. "7.0" is insufficiently constrained)

Future implementations may support version specification by prefix (e.g. "7.1" to specify all updates and builds of 7.1) or other forms of specification (e.g. ">=7.0"). Hardware Support Pacakges (HSPs) may be advertised as supporting truncated version strings to indicate the remainder is wildcarded. Matching is on the specified substring only, so a bundle supporting "7.1.0-2" would match a 'release' parameter of "7.1.0-2.3.436234" as well as "7.1.0-2.1.4133564" and "7.1.0-2.0.355667" but not "7.1.0-3.0.63445" or any base image version starting with "7.2". classes.name: com_vmware_oauth2_token__info
classes.description: The TokenInfo structure contains data that represents successful access-token response as defined in RFC 6749 and extended in RFC 8693.

attributes.name: access_token
attributes.description: The access token issued by the authorization server.

attributes.name: token_type
attributes.description: A case-insensitive value specifying the method of using the access token issued.

attributes.name: expires_in
attributes.description: The validity lifetime, in seconds, of the token issued by the server. unset if not applicable for issued token.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: Scope of the issued access token. The value of the scope parameter is expressed as a list of space- delimited, case-sensitive strings. The strings are defined by the authorization server. If the value contains multiple space-delimited strings, their order does not matter, and each string adds an additional access range to the requested scope. unset if the scope of the issued security token is identical to the scope requested by the client.

attributes.name: refresh_token
attributes.description: The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens. unset if not applicable to the specific request.

attributes.name: issued_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier which indicates the type of the access token in the TokenInfo.access-token field. unset if not the result of a token-exchange invocation; otherwise, required.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_authentication_authentication__info
classes.description: The {@name AuthenticationInfo} {@term structure} describes the authentication information. Authentication information could be specified for a package element, service elenent or an operation element.

attributes.name: scheme_type
attributes.description: The type of the authentication scheme.

attributes.name: session_manager
attributes.description: In a session aware authentication scheme, a session manager is required that supports {@code create}, {@code delete} and {@code keepAlive} {@term operations}. The fully qualified {@term service} name of the session manager is provided in {@link AuthenticationInfo#sessionManager} {@term field}. This {@term service} is responsible for handling sessions.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_authentication_authentication__info_scheme__type
classes.description: The {@name SchemeType} {@term enumerated type} provides {@term enumeration values} for the set of valid authentication scheme types.

attributes.name: SESSIONLESS
attributes.description: Indicates that the scheme is a session less authentication scheme, the user is authenticated on every {@term operation}. There is no explicit session establishment.

attributes.name: SESSION_AWARE
attributes.description: Indicates that the scheme is a session aware authentication scheme. It requires an explicit login before executing a {@term operation} and logout when a session terminates. A {@term service} might choose to have a session aware scheme if it wants to associate some state corresponding to the user until the user logs out or if it wants to mitigate the cost of authenticating the user on every {@term operation}.

methods.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_authentication_component
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves authentication information about the component element corresponding to {@param.name componentId}. The {@link ComponentData} contains the authentication information about the component element and it's fingerprint. It contains information about all the package elements that belong to this component element.

methods.name: fingerprint
methods.description: Retrieves the fingerprint computed from the authentication metadata of the component element corresponding to {@param.name componentId}. The fingerprint provides clients an efficient way to check if the metadata for a particular component has been modified on the server. The client can do this by comparing the result of this operation with the fingerprint returned in the result of {@link com.vmware.vapi.metadata.authentication.Component#get}.

methods.description: Returns the identifiers for the component elements that have authentication information.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command
classes.description: The {@name Command} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to get information about command line interface (CLI) commands.

methods.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command

methods.name: list

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_formatter__type

attributes.description: Displays command output as it is.

attributes.name: TABLE
attributes.description: Displays command output in table format.

attributes.name: JSON
attributes.description: Displays command output in JSON format.

attributes.name: XML
attributes.description: Displays command output in XML format.

attributes.name: CSV
attributes.description: Displays command output in CSV format.

attributes.name: HTML
attributes.description: Displays command output in HTML format.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_generic__type

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: Default case.

attributes.name: OPTIONAL
attributes.description: Input parameter is an optional.

attributes.name: LIST
attributes.description: Input parameter is a list.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_identity
classes.description: The {@name Identity} {@term structure} uniquely identifies a command in the CLI commands tree.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The dot-separated path of the namespace containing the command in the CLI command tree.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the command.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_info
classes.description: The {@name Info} {@term structure} contains information about a command. It includes the identity of the command, a description, information about the {@term service} and {@term operation} that implement the command, and CLI-specific information for the command.

attributes.name: identity
attributes.description: Basic command identity.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The text description displayed to the user in help output.

attributes.name: service_id
attributes.description: The service identifier that contains the operations for this CLI command.

attributes.name: operation_id
attributes.description: The operation identifier corresponding to this CLI command.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: The input for this command.

attributes.name: formatter
attributes.description: The formatter to use when displaying the output of this command.

attributes.name: output_field_list
attributes.description: List of output structure name and output field info.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_option__info
classes.description: The {@name OptionInfo} {@term structure} describes information about a specific input option of a command.

attributes.name: long_option
attributes.description: The long option name of the parameter as used by the user.

attributes.name: short_option
attributes.description: The single character value option name.

attributes.name: field_name
attributes.description: The fully qualified name of the option referred to by the operation element in {@link Info#operationId}.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of the option to be displayed to the user when they request usage information for a CLI command.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of option. This is used to display information about what kind of data is expected (string, number, boolean, etc.) for the option when they request usage information for a CLI command. For {@term enumerated type} this stores the fully qualified {@term enumerated type} id.

attributes.name: generic
attributes.description: This is used to tell the user whether the option is required or optional, or whether they can specify the option multiple times.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_output__field__info
classes.description: The {@name OutputFieldInfo} {@term structure} describes the name used by the CLI to display a single {@term field} of a {@term structure} element in the interface definition language.

attributes.name: field_name
attributes.description: Name of the {@term field}.

attributes.name: display_name
attributes.description: Name used by the CLI to display the {@term field}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_command_output__info
classes.description: The {@name OutputInfo} {@term structure} describes the names used by the CLI to display the {@term fields} of a {@term structure} element in the interface definition language as well as the order in which the {@term fields} will be displayed.

attributes.name: structure_id
attributes.description: Name of the {@term structure}.

attributes.name: output_fields
attributes.description: The order in which the {@term fields} of the {@term structure} will be displayed by the CLI as well as the names used to display the {@term fields}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_cli_namespace_identity
classes.description: The {@name Identity} {@term structure} uniquely identifies a namespace in the CLI namespace tree.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The text description displayed to the user in help output.

attributes.name: children

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_component
classes.description: The {@name Component} {@term service} providers {@term operations} to retrieve metamodel information of a component element.

methods.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_component
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves metamodel information about the component element corresponding to {@param.name componentId}. The {@link ComponentData} contains the metamodel information about the component and it's fingerprint. It contains information about all the package elements that are contained in this component element.

methods.name: fingerprint
methods.description: Retrieves the fingerprint computed from the metamodel metadata of the component element corresponding to {@param.name componentId}. The fingerprint provides clients an efficient way to check if the metadata for a particular component element has been modified on the server. The client can do this by comparing the result of this operation with the fingerprint returned in the result of {@link com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.Component#get}.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns the identifiers for the component elements that are registered with the infrastructure.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_component__data
classes.description: The {@name ComponentData} {@term structure} contains the metamodel metadata information of a component element along with its fingerprint.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_component__info
classes.description: The {@name ComponentInfo} {@term structure} contains metamodel metadata information about a component element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Dot separated name of the component element. The segments in the name reflect the organization of the APIs. The format of each segment is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

attributes.name: packages
attributes.description: Metamodel metadata information of all the package elements contained in the component element. The key in the {@term map} is the identifier of the package element and the value in the {@term map} is the metamodel information of the package element.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for a component. It can contain HTML markup and documentation tags (similar to Javadoc tags). The first sentence of the package documentation is a complete sentence that identifies the component by name and summarizes the purpose of the component.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_constant__info
classes.description: The {@name ConstantInfo} {@term structure} contains metamodel information of the constant elements.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the constant element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the constant element.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for the constant element. It can contain HTML markup and documentation tags (similar to Javadoc tags).

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_constant__value
classes.description: The {@name ConstantValue} {@term structure} contains the metamodel information of the constant element.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: Category of the type of constant value.

attributes.name: primitive_value
attributes.description: Primitive value of the constant element.

attributes.name: list_value
attributes.description: List value of the constant element.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_constant__value_category

attributes.name: PRIMITIVE
attributes.description: Indicates the type of constant value is primitive.

attributes.name: LIST
attributes.description: Indicates the type of constant value is a list.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_element__map
classes.description: The {@name ElementMap} {@term structure} contains the metadata elements.

attributes.name: elements
attributes.description: Metamodel information of the metadata elements. The key parameter of the {@term map} is the identifier for the element and the value corresponds to the element value.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_element__value
classes.description: The {@name ElementValue} {@term structure} describes the value of the metadata element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the value.

attributes.name: long_value
attributes.description: Long value of the metadata element.

attributes.name: string_value
attributes.description: String value of the metadata element.

attributes.name: list_value
attributes.description: List of strings value of the metadata element.

attributes.name: structure_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the structure element.

attributes.name: structure_ids
attributes.description: List of identifiers of the structure elements.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_element__value_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the valid types for values in metadata elements.

attributes.name: LONG
attributes.description: Indicates the type of the value is a long (64 bit signed integer).

attributes.name: STRING
attributes.description: Indicates the type of the value is a string (a variable length sequence of characters). The encoding is UTF-8.

attributes.name: STRING_LIST
attributes.description: Indicates the type of the value is a list of strings.

attributes.name: STRUCTURE_REFERENCE
attributes.description: Indicates the type of the value is an identifier for a structure element.

attributes.name: STRUCTURE_REFERENCE_LIST
attributes.description: Indicates the type of the value is a list of identifiers for a structure element.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_enumeration
classes.description: The {@name Enumeration} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to retrieve metamodel information about an enumeration element in the interface definition language.

methods.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_enumeration
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.description: Retrieves information about the enumeration element corresponding to {@param.name enumerationId}. The {@link EnumerationInfo} contains the metamodel information about the enumeration value element contained in the enumeration element.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_enumeration__info
classes.description: The {@name EnumerationInfo} {@term structure} contains the metamodel information of an enumeration element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Dot separated name of the enumeration element. The segments in the name reflect the organization of the APIs. The format of each segment is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

attributes.name: values
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the enumeration value elements contained in this enumeration element. The order of the enumeration value elements in the list is same as the order in which they are defined in the interface definition file.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_enumeration__value__info
classes.description: The {@name EnumerationValueInfo} {@term structure} describes the {@term enumeration value} in the {@term enumerated type}.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value in the enumerated type. All the characters in the string are capitalized.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for an enumeration value. It can contain HTML markup and documentation tags (similar to Javadoc tags). The first statement will be a noun or verb phrase that describes the purpose of the enumeration value.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_error__info
classes.description: The {@name ErrorInfo} {@term structure} contains the metadata information about the error elements contained in an operation element.

attributes.name: structure_id
attributes.description: Identifier for the structure element corresponding to the error that is being reported by the operation.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: The English language documentation for the service element. It can contain HTML markup and Javadoc tags.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_field__info
