attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the field element in a canonical format. The format is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type information.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for the service element. It can contain HTML markup and Javadoc tags.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_generic__instantiation
classes.description: The {@name GenericInstantiation} {@term structure} describes the type information of a typed element when the type is an instantiation of one of the generic types provided by the infrastructure.

attributes.name: generic_type
attributes.description: The generic type that is being instantiated.

attributes.name: element_type
attributes.description: Type of the element parameter if the generic type instantiation is a {@link GenericType#LIST}, {@link GenericType#OPTIONAL} or {@link GenericType#SET}.

attributes.name: map_key_type
attributes.description: Type of the key parameter of the map generic type instantiation. The map generic type has a key parameter and value parameter. The type of the value parameter is described by {@link GenericInstantiation#mapValueType}..

attributes.name: map_value_type
attributes.description: Type of the value parameter of the map generic type instantiation. The map generic type has a key parameter and value parameter. The type of the key parameter is described by {@link GenericInstantiation#mapKeyType}..

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_generic__instantiation_generic__type
classes.description: The {@name GenericType} {@term enumerated type} provides {@term enumeration values} for each of the generic types provided by the infrastructure.

attributes.name: LIST
attributes.description: Indicates the generic type is a list.

attributes.name: MAP
attributes.description: Indicates the generic type is a map.

attributes.name: OPTIONAL
attributes.description: Indicates the generic type is an optional.

attributes.name: SET
attributes.description: Indicates the generic type is a set.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_operation__info
classes.description: The {@name OperationInfo} {@term structure} contains metamodel information of an operation element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the operation element in a canonical format. The format is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

attributes.name: params
attributes.description: Metamodel information for the parameter elements. The order of the parameters elements in the list is same as the order of the parameters declared in the interface definition file.

attributes.name: output
attributes.description: Metamodel type for the output element.

attributes.name: errors
attributes.description: List of error elements that might be reported by the operation element. If the operation reports the same error for more than one reason, the list contains the error element associated with the error more than once with different documentation elements.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for the service element. It can contain HTML markup and Javadoc tags.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_operation__result__info
classes.description: The {@name OperationResultInfo} {@term structure} contains the metamodel information of an operation result element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type information of the operation result element.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for the operation result element. It can contain HTML markup and Javadoc tags.

classes.description: The {@name PackageInfo} {@term structure} contains the metamodel information of all the service elements, structure elements and enumeration elements contained in the package element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Dot separated name of the package element. The segments in the name reflect the organization of the APIs. The format of each segment is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

classes.description: The {@name PrimitiveValue} {@term structure} contains value of the constant element.

attributes.name: DOUBLE
attributes.description: Indicates the value is a double (64 bit floating number).

attributes.name: LONG

The {@link com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.Structure} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to retrieve more details about the structure elements corresponding to the identifiers returned by this {@term operation}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_service
classes.description: The {@name Service} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to retrieve metamodel information about a service element in the interface definition language.

methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.description: Retrieves information about the service element corresponding to {@param.name serviceId}. The {@link ServiceInfo} contains the metamodel information for the operation elements, structure elements and enumeration elements contained in the service element.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns the identifiers for the service elements that are currently registered with the infrastructure. The list of service elements is an aggregate list of all the service elements contained in all the package elements.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_service__info
classes.description: The {@name ServiceInfo} {@term structure} contains the metamodel information of all the operation elements, structure elements and enumeration elements containted in a service element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Dot separated name of the service element. The segments in the name reflect the organization of the APIs. The format of each segment is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

attributes.name: operations
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the operation elements contained in the service element. The key in the {@term map} is the identifier of the operation element and the value in the {@term map} is the metamodel information for the operation element.

attributes.name: structures
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the structure elements contained in the service element. The key in the {@term map} is the identifier of the structure element and the value in the {@term map} is the metamodel information for the structure element.

attributes.name: enumerations
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the enumeration elements contained in the service element. The key in the {@term map} is the identifier of the enumeration element and the value in the {@term map} is the metamodel information for the enumeration element.

attributes.name: constants
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the constant elements contained in the service element. The key in the {@term map} is the name of the constant element and the value in the {@term map} is the metamodel information for the contant element.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: English language documentation for the service element. It can contain HTML markup and Javadoc tags. The first sentence of the service documentation is a complete sentence that identifies the service by name and summarizes the purpose of the service. The remaining part of the documentation provides a summary of how to use the operations defined in the service.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_service_operation
classes.description: The {@name Operation} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to retrieve metamodel information of an operation element in the interface definition language.

methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

The {@link StructureInfo} contains the metamodel information about the structure element. It contains information about all the field elements and enumeration elements contained in this structure element.

methods.description: Returns the identifiers for the structure elements that are contained in all the package elements and service elements.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_structure__info
classes.description: The {@name StructureInfo} {@term structure} contains the metamodel information of all the field elements, constant elements and enumeration elements contained in the structure element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Dot separated name of the structure element. The segments in the name reflect the organization of the APIs. The format of each segment is lower case with underscores. Each underscore represents a word boundary. If there are acronyms in the word, the capitalization is preserved. This format makes it easy to translate the segment into a different naming convention.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the structure.

attributes.name: enumerations
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the enumeration elements contained in the structure element. The key in the {@term map} is the identifier of the enumeration element and the value is the metamodel information of the enumeration element.

attributes.name: constants
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the constant elements contained in the structure element. The key in the {@term map} is the name of the constant element and the value in the {@term map} is the metamodel information for the constant element.

attributes.name: fields
attributes.description: Metamodel information of all the field elements. The order of the field elements in the list matches the order in which the fields are defined in the service.

attributes.description: English language documentation for a structure element. It can contain HTML markup and Javadoc tags. The first sentence of the structure documentation is a complete sentence that identifies the structure by name and summarizes the purpose of the structure.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_structure__info_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the kind of this structure element. In the interface definition language, structure element and error element have similar characteristics. The difference is that only error elements can be used to describe the {@term errors} of an operation element.

attributes.name: STRUCTURE
attributes.description: If the type is a structure element.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: If the type is an error element.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term structure} describes the type information of a typed element in the interface definiton language. The following elements in the metamodel are typed:

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: Category of this type.

attributes.name: builtin_type
attributes.description: Category of the built-in type.

attributes.name: user_defined_type
attributes.description: Identifier and type of the user defined type.

attributes.name: generic_instantiation
attributes.description: Instantiation of one of the generic types available in the interface definition language.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_type_builtin__type
classes.description: The {@name BuiltinType} {@term enumerated type} provides {@term enumeration value} for each of the built-in types present in the interface definition language type system.

attributes.name: VOID
attributes.description: The built-in type is a void. The value is {@term unset}.

attributes.name: BOOLEAN
attributes.description: The built-in type is a boolean. The value is true or false.

attributes.name: LONG
attributes.description: The built-in type is a long. The value is a 64 bit signed integer.

attributes.name: DOUBLE
attributes.description: The built-in type is a double. The value is a 64 bit floating point number.

attributes.name: STRING
attributes.description: The built-in type is a string. The value is a variable-length sequence of zero or more unicode characters.

attributes.name: BINARY
attributes.description: The built-in type is a binary. The value is a variable-length sequence of zero or more bytes.

attributes.name: SECRET
attributes.description: The built-in type is a secret. The value is a variable-length sequence of zero or more unicode characters. The value contains sensitive data that should not be printed or displayed anywhere.

attributes.name: DATE_TIME
attributes.description: The built-in type is a datetime. The value should be in the UTC timezone and the precision is milliseconds.

attributes.name: ID
attributes.description: The built-in type is an ID. The value represents an identifier for a resource.

attributes.name: URI
attributes.description: The built-in type is an URI. The value follows the IRI specification in RFC 3987.

attributes.name: ANY_ERROR
attributes.description: The built-in type is an arbitrary {@term error} type. This is used if the value of a typed element can be one of any user defined named type which is an {@term error}.

attributes.name: DYNAMIC_STRUCTURE
attributes.description: The built-in type is a dynamic structure. This is used if the value of a typed element can be one of any user defined named type.

attributes.name: OPAQUE
attributes.description: The built-in type is an opaque. This is used if the value of a typed element could be of any type and the actual type will be known only during the execution of the API. This is mostly used in infrastructure {@term services}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_type_category

attributes.name: BUILTIN
attributes.description: The type is one of the built-in types specified in {@link BuiltinType}

attributes.name: USER_DEFINED
attributes.description: The type is one of the user defined named types.

attributes.name: GENERIC
attributes.description: The type is an instantiation of one of the generic types.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_metamodel_user__defined__type
classes.description: The {@name UserDefinedType} {@term structure} contains the metamodel type information of a typed element whose type is a user defined named type.

attributes.name: resource_id

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_privilege_component
classes.description: The {@name Component} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to retrieve privilege information of a component element.

methods.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_privilege_component
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves privilege information about the component element corresponding to {@param.name componentId}. The {@link ComponentData} contains the privilege information about the component element and its fingerprint. It contains information about all the package elements that belong to this component element.

methods.name: fingerprint
methods.description: Retrieves the fingerprint computed from the privilege metadata of the component element corresponding to {@param.name componentId}. The fingerprint provides clients an efficient way to check if the metadata for a particular component has been modified on the server. The client can do this by comparing the result of this operation with the fingerprint returned in the result of {@link com.vmware.vapi.metadata.privilege.Component#get}.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns the identifiers for the component elements that have privilege information.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_privilege_component__data
classes.description: The {@name ComponentData} {@term structure} contains the privilege information of the component along with its fingerprint.

attributes.name: info
attributes.description: Privilege information of the component. This includes information about all the {@term packages} in the component.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_privilege_component__info
classes.description: The {@name ComponentInfo} {@term structure} contains the privilege information of a component element.

attributes.name: privilege_info
attributes.description: Privilege information of all the parameter elements of the operation element. For an explanation of containment of privilege information within parameter elements, see {@link com.vmware.vapi.metadata.privilege.PrivilegeInfo}.

classes.description: The {@name PackageInfo} {@term structure} contains the privilege information of a package element.

attributes.name: privileges
attributes.description: List of default privileges to be used for all the operations present in this package. If a particular operation element has no explicit privileges defined in the privilege definition file, these privileges are used for enforcing authorization.

attributes.name: services
attributes.description: Information about all service elements contained in this package element that contain privilege information. The key in the {@term map} is the identifier of the service element and the value in the {@term map} is the privilege information for the service element. For an explanation of privilege information containment within service elements, see {@link com.vmware.vapi.metadata.privilege.Service}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_metadata_privilege_privilege__info
classes.description: The {@name PrivilegeInfo} {@term structure} contains the privilege information for a parameter element in an operation element.

attributes.name: privileges

classes.description: The {@name Component} {@term service} provides functionality that allows clients to retrieve information about a vAPI REST {@link Component}. You can get detailed information about a specific {@link Component}, its {@link Service}s or obtain the list with {@link Component}s.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_rest_navigation_link
classes.description: The {@name Link} {@term structure} contains information necessary to call a vAPI REST {@term operation}. Use {@link #method} with {@link #href} to make the call. Use {@link #metadata} to get detailed information about {@term operation} parameters, result and possible error conditions.

classes.description: The {@name Operation} {@term structure} contains information describing a vAPI Rest {@term operation}. Use {@link #name} and {@link #service} to uniquely identify the {@term operation}. Use {@link #metadata} to get detailed information about {@term operation} parameters, result and possible error conditions. Use {@link #links} to get a list of {@link Reference}s to execute it.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the operation.

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: Name of the service where the operations belongs to.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.description: Documentation of the operation.

attributes.name: links
attributes.description: {@link List} of {@link Reference}s to execute the operation.

attributes.name: metadata
attributes.description: {@link Reference} to meta data about the operation.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_authentication__scheme
classes.description: The {@link AuthenticationScheme} class defines constants for authentication scheme identifiers for authentication mechanisms present in the vAPI infrastructure shipped by VMware.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_dynamic__ID
classes.description: The {@name DynamicID} {@term structure} represents an identifier for a resource of an arbitrary type.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The identifier for a resource whose type is specified by {@link #type}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_already__exists
classes.description: The {@name AlreadyExists} {@term error} indicates that an attempt was made to create an entity but the entity already exists. Typically the entity has a name or identifier that is required to be unique in some context, but there is already an entity with that name or identifier in that context.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_already__in__desired__state
classes.description: The {@name AlreadyInDesiredState} {@term error} indicates that an attempt to change the state of a resource or service had no effect because the resource or service is already in the desired state.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_argument__locations
classes.description: The {@name ArgumentLocations} {@term structure} describes which part(s) of the input to the {@term operation} caused the {@term error}.

attributes.name: primary
attributes.description: String describing the location of the input that triggered the {@term error}.

attributes.name: secondary
attributes.description: {@term List} (possibly empty) of strings describing the locations of other inputs that caused the the primary input to trigger the {@term error}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_canceled
classes.description: The {@name Canceled} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} canceled itself in response to an explicit request to do so. {@term Operations} being "canceled" for other reasons (for example the client connection was closed, a time out occured, or due to excessive resource consumption) should not report this {@term error}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_concurrent__change
classes.description: The {@name ConcurrentChange} {@term error} indicates that a data structure, entity, or resource has been modified since some earlier point in time. Typically this happens when the client is doing the write portion of a read-modify-write sequence and indicates that it wants the server to notify it if the data in the server has changed after it did the read, so that it can avoid overwriting that change inadvertantly.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_error
classes.description: The {@name Error} {@term error} describes the{@term fields} common to all standard {@term errors}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_error_type
classes.description: Enumeration of all standard errors. Used as discriminator in protocols that have no standard means for transporting the error type, e.g. REST.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Discriminator for the Error type.

attributes.name: ALREADY_EXISTS
attributes.description: Discriminator for the AlreadyExists type.

attributes.name: ALREADY_IN_DESIRED_STATE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the AlreadyInDesiredState type.

attributes.name: CANCELED
attributes.description: Discriminator for the Canceled type.

attributes.name: CONCURRENT_CHANGE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the ConcurrentChange type.

attributes.name: FEATURE_IN_USE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the FeatureInUse type.

attributes.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
attributes.description: Discriminator for the InternalServerError type.

attributes.name: INVALID_ARGUMENT
attributes.description: Discriminator for the InvalidArgument type.

attributes.name: INVALID_ELEMENT_CONFIGURATION
attributes.description: Discriminator for the InvalidElementConfiguration type.

attributes.name: INVALID_ELEMENT_TYPE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the InvalidElementType type.

attributes.name: INVALID_REQUEST
attributes.description: Discriminator for the InvalidRequest type.

attributes.name: NOT_ALLOWED_IN_CURRENT_STATE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the NotAllowedInCurrentState type.

attributes.name: NOT_FOUND
attributes.description: Discriminator for the NotFound type.

attributes.name: OPERATION_NOT_FOUND
attributes.description: Discriminator for the OperationNotFound type.

attributes.name: RESOURCE_BUSY
attributes.description: Discriminator for the ResourceBusy type.

attributes.name: RESOURCE_IN_USE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the ResourceInUse type.

attributes.name: RESOURCE_INACCESSIBLE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the ResourceInaccessible type.

attributes.name: SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the ServiceUnavailable type.

attributes.name: TIMED_OUT
attributes.description: Discriminator for the TimedOut type.

attributes.name: UNABLE_TO_ALLOCATE_RESOURCE
attributes.description: Discriminator for the UnableToAllocateResource type.

attributes.name: UNAUTHENTICATED
attributes.description: Discriminator for the Unauthenticated type.

attributes.name: UNAUTHORIZED
attributes.description: Discriminator for the Unauthorized type.

attributes.name: UNEXPECTED_INPUT
attributes.description: Discriminator for the UnexpectedInput type.

attributes.name: UNSUPPORTED
attributes.description: Discriminator for the Unsupported type.

attributes.name: UNVERIFIED_PEER
attributes.description: Discriminator for the UnverifiedPeer type.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_feature__in__use
classes.description: The {@name FeatureInUse} {@term error} indicates that an action cannot be completed because a feature is in use.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_file__locations
classes.description: The {@name FileLocations} {@term structure} identifies the file(s) that caused the {@term operation} to report the {@term error}.

attributes.name: primary
attributes.description: String identifying the file that triggered the {@term error}.

attributes.name: secondary
attributes.description: {@term List} (possibly empty) of strings identifying other files that caused the primary file to trigger the {@term error}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_internal__server__error
classes.description: The {@name InternalServerError} {@term error} indicates that the server encounters an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_invalid__argument
classes.description: The {@name InvalidArgument} {@term error} indicates that the values received for one or more {@term parameters} are not acceptable.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_invalid__element__configuration
classes.description: The {@name InvalidElementConfiguration} {@term error} indicates that an attempt to modify the configuration of an element or a group containing the element failed due to the configuraton of the element. A typical case is when the {@term operation} is am attempt to change the group membership of the element fails, in which case a configuration change on the element may allow the group membership change to succeed.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_invalid__element__type
classes.description: The {@name InvalidElementType} {@term error} indicates that the server was unable to fulfil the request because an element of a specific type cannot be a member of particular group.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_invalid__request
classes.description: The {@name InvalidRequest} {@term error} indicates that the request is malformed in such a way that the server is unable to process it.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_not__allowed__in__current__state
classes.description: The {@name NotAllowedInCurrentState} {@term error} indicates that the requested {@term operation} is not allowed with a resource or service in its current state. This could be because the {@term operation} is performing a configuration change that is not allowed in the current state or because {@term operation} itself is not allowed in the current state.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_not__found
classes.description: The {@name NotFound} {@term error} indicates that a specified element could not be found.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_operation__not__found
classes.description: The {@name OperationNotFound} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} specified in the request could not be found.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_resource__busy
classes.description: The {@name ResourceBusy} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} could not be completed because a resource it needs is busy.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_resource__in__use
classes.description: The {@name ResourceInUse} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} could not be completed because a resource is in use.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_resource__inaccessible
classes.description: The {@name ResourceInaccessible} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} could not be completed because an entity is not accessible.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_service__unavailable
classes.description: The {@name ServiceUnavailable} {@term error} indicates that the {@term service} is unavailable.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_timed__out
classes.description: The {@name TimedOut} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} did not complete within the allowed amount of time. The allowed amount of time might be:

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_transient__indication
classes.description: The {@name TransientIndication} {@term structure} indicates whether or not the {@term error} is transient.

attributes.name: is_transient
attributes.description: Indicates that the {@term error} this {@term structure} is attached to is transient.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_unable__to__allocate__resource
classes.description: The {@name UnableToAllocateResource} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} failed because it was unable to allocate or acquire a required resource.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_unauthenticated
classes.description: The {@name Unauthenticated} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} requires authentication and the user is not authenticated.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_unauthorized
classes.description: The {@name Unauthorized} {@term error} indicates that the user is not authorized to perform the {@term operation}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_unexpected__input
classes.description: The {@name UnexpectedInput} {@term error} indicates that the request contained a {@term parameter} or {@term field} whose name is not known by the server.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_unsupported
classes.description: The {@name Unsupported} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} is not supported by the {@term service}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_errors_unverified__peer
classes.description: The {@name UnverifiedPeer} {@term error} indicates that an attempt to connect to an unknown or not-yet-trusted endpoint failed because the system was unable to verify the identity of the endpoint.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_interposition_invocation__request
classes.description: Information about an interposed request for operation invocation. All interposers would receive an instance of this structure as an input parameter.

attributes.name: service_id
attributes.description: Fully qualified name of the service which contains the interposed operation. In canonical format. For example org.example.hello.

attributes.name: operation_id
attributes.description: Name of the interposed operation. In canonical format. For example say_hello.

attributes.name: operation_input
attributes.description: Input of the interposed operation.

attributes.name: user
attributes.description: User which started the interposed operation. There could be no authentication information. For example when methods are invoked anonymously.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: Groups of the user who started the interposed operation. Would be empty if there is no authentication information.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_interposition_invocation__result
classes.description: Information about the result from an interposed operation invocation. All POST interposers will receive an instance of this structure.

attributes.name: result_type
attributes.description: Type of the invocation result.

attributes.name: output
attributes.description: Normal result value. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of InvocationResult.result-type is NORMAL_RESULT.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Error result value. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of InvocationResult.result-type is ERROR_RESULT.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_interposition_invocation__result_result__type
classes.description: Type of the invocation result.

attributes.name: NORMAL_RESULT
attributes.description: Normal invocation result.

attributes.name: ERROR_RESULT
attributes.description: Error invocation result.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_interposition_security__principal
classes.description: VMODL equivalent of com.vmware.vapi.security.PrincipalId.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Principal name.

attributes.name: domain
attributes.description: Principal domain. Domain is optional in com.vmware.vapi.security.PrincipalId

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_localizable__message
classes.description: The {@name LocalizableMessage} {@term structure} represents a localizable string or message template. {@term Services} include one or more localizable message templates in the {@term errors} they report so that clients can display diagnostic messages in the native language of the user. {@term Services} can include localizable strings in the data returned from {@term operations} to allow clients to display localized status information in the native language of the user.

attributes.name: default_message
attributes.description: The value of this localizable string or message template in the {@code en_US} (English) locale. If {@link #id} refers to a message template, the default message will contain the substituted arguments. This value can be used by clients that do not need to display strings and messages in the native language of the user. It could also be used as a fallback if a client is unable to access the appropriate message catalog.

attributes.name: args
attributes.description: Arguments to be substituted into a message template.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_localization__param
classes.description: This structure holds a single message parameter and formatting settings for it. The structure has fields for string, long, double, date time and nested messages. Only one will be used depending on the type of data sent. For date, double and long it is possible to set additional formatting details.

attributes.name: s
attributes.description: String value associated with the parameter. this field will be set when string value is used.

attributes.name: dt
attributes.description: Date and time value associated with the parameter. Use the LocalizationParam.format field to specify date and time display style. this field will be set when date and time value is used.

attributes.name: i
attributes.description: long value associated with the parameter. this field will be set when long value is used.

attributes.name: d
attributes.description: The double value associated with the parameter. The number of displayed fractional digits is changed via LocalizationParam.precision field. this field will be set when double value is used.

attributes.name: l
attributes.description: Nested localizable value associated with the parameter. This is useful construct to convert to human readable localized form enumerated type and boolean values. It can also be used for proper handling of pluralization and gender forms in localization. Recursive NestedLocalizableMessage instances can be used for localizing short lists of items. this field will be set when nested localization message value is used.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: Format associated with the date and time value in LocalizationParam.dt field. The enumeration value SHORT_DATETIME will be used as default. this may not be set if enumeration value SHORT_DATETIME default format is appropriate

attributes.name: precision
attributes.description: Number of fractional digits to include in formatted double value. this will be set when exact precision is required for rendering double numbers.

classes.name: com_vmware_vapi_std_localization__param_date__time__format
classes.description: The LocalizationParam.DateTimeFormat enumerated type lists possible date and time formatting options. It combines the Unicode CLDR format types - full, long, medium and short with 3 different presentations - date only, time only and combined date and time presentation.

attributes.name: SHORT_DATE
attributes.description: The date and time value will be formatted as short date, for example 2019-01-28

attributes.name: MED_DATE
attributes.description: The date and time value will be formatted as medium date, for example 2019 Jan 28

attributes.name: LONG_DATE
attributes.description: The date and time value will be formatted as long date, for example 2019 Jan 28

attributes.name: FULL_DATE

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_authentication_token
classes.description: The Token interface provides operations for obtaining an access token.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_authentication_token
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: issue
methods.description: Provides a token endpoint as defined in RFC 6749. Supported grant types: - urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange - Exchanges incoming token based on the spec and current client authorization data. This operation supercedes com.vmware.vcenter.tokenservice.TokenExchange#exchange. The REST rendering of the newer operation matches RFC8693's definition for both input and output of the operation.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_authentication_token_issue__spec
classes.description: The Token.IssueSpec structure contains arguments required for token exchange.

attributes.name: grant_type
attributes.description: The value of urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange indicates that a token exchange is being performed. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be one of urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be one of urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange.

attributes.name: resource
attributes.description: Indicates the location of the target service or resource where the client intends to use the requested security token. If unset, it is inferred from other arguments.

attributes.name: audience
attributes.description: The logical name of the target service where the client intends to use the requested security token. This serves a purpose similar to the Token.IssueSpec.resource field, but with the client providing a logical name rather than a location. If unset, it is inferred from other arguments.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: A list of space-delimited, case-sensitive strings, that allow the client to specify the desired scope of the requested security token in the context of the service or resource where the token will be used. If unset, it is inferred from other arguments.

attributes.name: requested_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier for the type of the requested security token. If the requested type is unspecified, the issued token type is at the discretion of the server and may be dictated by knowledge of the requirements of the service or resource indicated by the Token.IssueSpec.resource or Token.IssueSpec.audience field. If unset, it is inferred from other arguments.

attributes.name: subject_token
attributes.description: A security token that represents the identity of the party on behalf of whom exchange is being made. Typically, the subject of this token will be the subject of the security token issued. Token is base64-encoded. The field is required when the value of the Token.IssueSpec.grant-type field is urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange. This field is currently required. In the future, the structure may support grant-types other than urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange for which the value may be unset.

attributes.name: subject_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier, that indicates the type of the security token in the Token.IssueSpec.subject-token field. The field is required when the value of the Token.IssueSpec.grant-type field is urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange. This field is currently required. In the future, the structure may support grant-types other than urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange for which the value may be unset.

attributes.name: actor_token
attributes.description: A security token that represents the identity of the acting party. Typically, this will be the party that is authorized to use the requested security token and act on behalf of the subject. unset if not needed for the specific case of exchange.

attributes.name: actor_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier, that indicates the type of the security token in the Token.IssueSpec.actor-token field. unset if Token.IssueSpec.actor-token field is not present.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_certificate__management_vcenter_signing__certificate
classes.description: The SigningCertificate interface provides operations to view and manage vCenter signing certificates which are used to sign and verify tokens issued by vCenter token service. Versioning is the same as for the com.vmware.vcenter package. 1.23 - vSphere 7.0 U3

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_certificate__management_vcenter_signing__certificate
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Set the active signing certificate for vCenter. The certificate will immediately be used to sign tokens issued by vCenter token service. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires CertificateManagement.Administer.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieve the signing certificate chains for validating vCenter-issued tokens. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

methods.name: refresh
methods.description: Refresh the vCenter signing certificate chain. The new signing certificate will be issued in accordance with vCenter CA policy and set as the active signing certificate for the vCenter token service. The certificate will immediately be used to sign tokens issued by vCenter token service. If a third-party/custom certificate has been configured as the signing certificate for compliance reasons, refresh may take vCenter out of compliance. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires CertificateManagement.Administer.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_certificate__management_vcenter_signing__certificate_info
classes.description: The SigningCertificate.Info structure contains data that represents vCenter signing certificates.

attributes.name: active_cert_chain
attributes.description: The certificate chain that is actively being use by vCenter token service to sign tokens.

attributes.name: signing_cert_chains
attributes.description: List of signing certificate chains for validating vCenter-issued tokens. The list contains X509 certificate chains, each of which is ordered and contains the leaf, intermediate and root certs needed for the complete chain of trust. The leaf certificate is first in the chain and should be used for verifying vCenter-issued tokens.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_certificate__management_vcenter_signing__certificate_set__spec
classes.description: The SigningCertificate.SetSpec structure contains data to set the active vCenter signing certificate.

attributes.name: signing_cert_chain
attributes.description: Signing certificate chain that the vCenter token service will actively use to sign tokens. The chain must include a valid certificate chain with the leaf cert marked for digital signature key usage.

attributes.name: private_key
attributes.description: The corresponding unencrypted PKCS#8 private key in base64-encoded PEM format.

classes.description: The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} contains information used to create a new policy to ignore virtual machine capabilities when scaling-in a cluster, see {@link com.vmware.vcenter.compute.Policies#create}. When considering scaling-in a cluster, policies that have been created with one of the listed {@link #vmCapabilities} are ignored for virtual machines that have the tag indicated by {@link #vmTag} in VMware Cloud on AWS. Usage beyond VMware Cloud on AWS is not supported. *Warning:* This structure is available as Technology Preview. These are early access APIs provided to test, automate and provide feedback on the feature. Since this can change based on feedback, VMware does not guarantee backwards compatibility and recommends against using them in production environments. Some Technology Preview APIs might only be applicable to specific environments.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_compute_policies_capabilities_vm_evacuation_vmotion_create__spec
classes.description: The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} contains information used to create a new vMotion policy that applies when a host is evacuated, see {@link com.vmware.vcenter.compute.Policies#create}, in VMware Cloud on AWS. Usage beyond VMware Cloud on AWS is not supported. All virtual machines that share the tag indicated by {@link #vmTag} will be vMotioned from a host whenever the host is evacuated by vCenter. If vCenter cannot migrate a virtual machine, then it will remain running on its current host. *Warning:* This structure is available as Technology Preview. These are early access APIs provided to test, automate and provide feedback on the feature. Since this can change based on feedback, VMware does not guarantee backwards compatibility and recommends against using them in production environments. Some Technology Preview APIs might only be applicable to specific environments.

attributes.name: vm_tag
attributes.description: Identifier of a tag that can be associated with a virtual machine. Virtual machines with this tag will be vMotioned from a host if vCenter requires to evacuate the host. If vMotion is not feasible, then the virtual machine will remain running on its current host. *Warning:* This attribute is available as Technology Preview. These are early access APIs provided to test, automate and provide feedback on the feature. Since this can change based on feedback, VMware does not guarantee backwards compatibility and recommends against using them in production environments. methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.description: Get detailed information of the Harbor registry.

methods.description: Returns basic information of all Harbor registries.

attributes.description: Day of the week when garbage collection should run.

attributes.name: hour
attributes.description: Hour at which garbage collection should run.

attributes.name: minute

attributes.description: Garbage collection information for the registry.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_content_registries_harbor_projects
classes.description: The {@name Projects} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for managing the lifecycle of Harbor project that stores and distributes container repositories and images.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_content_registries_harbor_projects
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns detailed information about the specified Harbor project.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a project in a Harbor registry using the supplied specification. In vSphere 7.0, a Harbor registry is deployed in a vSphere cluster with vSphere namespaces enabled. When a namespace is created, a project with same name as the namespace is created in the Harbor registry, so this {@term operation} should not be called.

methods.name: purge
methods.description: Remove all repositories, images and members in the project. Storage space of deleted images in the project will be reclaimed through next scheduled Harbor registry garbage collection.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns basic information of all projects in a Harbor registry.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the specified project from Harbor registry. Repositories and images in the project will be removed upon project deletion. Storage space of deleted images in the project will be reclaimed through next scheduled Harbor registry garbage collection. In vSphere 7.0, a Harbor registry is deployed in a vSphere cluster with vSphere namespaces enabled. When a namespace is deleted, a project with same name as the namespace is deleted from the Harbor registry, so this {@term operation} should not be called.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_content_registries_harbor_projects_config__status
classes.description: The {@name ConfigStatus} {@term enumerated type} describes the status of reaching the desired configuration state for the Harbor project.

attributes.name: PENDING
attributes.description: Harbor project is being created or the configuration is being applied to the project.

attributes.name: REMOVING
attributes.description: The configuration is being removed and Harbor project is being deleted.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Failed to create Harbor project or apply the configuration to the project, user intervention needed.

attributes.name: READY
attributes.description: Harbor project is created or configured correctly.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_content_registries_harbor_projects_create__spec
classes.description: The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} defines the information required to create a Harbor project.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the Harbor project. Should be between 1-63 characters long alphanumeric string and may contain the following characters: a-z,0-9, and '-'. Must be starting with characters or numbers, with the '-' character allowed anywhere except the first or last character.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: Access type of a Harbor project.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_content_registries_harbor_projects_info
classes.description: The {@name Info} {@term structure} contains detailed information about a Harbor project.

attributes.name: name

attributes.name: config_status
attributes.description: The status of the Harbor project.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: The access type of a Harbor project.

attributes.name: creation_time
attributes.description: The date and time when the harbor project creation API was triggered and project identifier generated.

attributes.name: update_time
attributes.description: The date and time when the harbor project purge API was triggered. In case no purge was triggered, {@name #updateTime} is same as {@name #creationTime}.

attributes.name: access_url
attributes.description: URL to access the harbor project through docker client.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: Details about the ERROR project status.

attributes.description: The time estimated to export data from the source vCenter Server.

attributes.name: estimated_import_time
attributes.description: The time estimated to import data to the upgraded vCenter Server.

attributes.description: The extra free space required on source vCenter Server.

classes.description: The DataMigrationInfo {structure contains the disk space requirements and time estimates for the different choices available to migrate the vCenter Server data.

attributes.name: core
attributes.description: Migrate only core data and configuration from vCenter Server. Events, tasks, and stats will not be migrated.

attributes.name: core_events_tasks
attributes.description: Migrate core, events, and tasks from vCenter Server. Stats will not be migrated.

attributes.name: all
attributes.description: Migrate all data from vCenter Server.

attributes.name: core_events_tasks_with_deferred
attributes.description: Migrate core, events, and tasks from vCenter Server. Events and tasks will be migrated after the upgrade. Stats will not be migrated. This field will be available only if the source database is using an external database.

classes.description: The {@name FilterSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} used to filter the results when listing folders (see {@link #list}). If multiple {@term fields} are specified, only folders matching all of the {@term fields} match the filter.

attributes.name: folders
attributes.description: Identifiers of folders that can match the filter.

attributes.name: names
attributes.description: Names that folders must have to match the filter (see {@link Summary#name}).

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type that folders must have to match the filter (see {@link Summary#type}).

attributes.name: parent_folders
attributes.description: Folders that must contain the folder for the folder to match the filter.

attributes.name: datacenters
attributes.description: Datacenters that must contain the folder for the folder to match the filter.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_folder_summary
classes.description: The {@name Summary} {@term structure} contains commonly used information about a folder.

attributes.name: folder
attributes.description: Identifier of the folder.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the vCenter Server folder.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type ({@enum.values Type}) of the vCenter Server folder.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_folder_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of a vCenter Server folder. The type of a folder determines what what kinds of children can be contained in the folder.

attributes.name: DATACENTER
attributes.description: A folder that can contain datacenters.

attributes.name: DATASTORE
attributes.description: A folder that can contain datastores.

attributes.name: HOST
attributes.description: A folder that can contain compute resources (hosts and clusters).

attributes.name: NETWORK
attributes.description: A folder that can contain networkds.

attributes.name: VIRTUAL_MACHINE
attributes.description: A folder that can contain virtual machines.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_adapter__mapping
classes.description: The AdapterMapping structure specifies the association between a virtual network adapter and its IP settings.

attributes.name: mac_address
attributes.description: The MAC address of a network adapter being customized. If unset, the customization process maps the the settings from the list of AdapterMappings.IPSettings in the CustomizationSpec.interfaces to the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order. The first virtual network adapter on the PCI bus is assigned interfaces[0].IPSettings, the second adapter is assigned interfaces[1].IPSettings, and so on.

attributes.name: adapter
attributes.description: The IP settings for the associated virtual network adapter.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_cloud__configuration
classes.description: Guest customization settings to customize a guest operating system with cloud configuration. The CloudConfiguration structure contains the type of cloud configuration and the settings of that cloud configuration.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the cloud configuration.

attributes.name: cloudinit
attributes.description: cloud-init configuration This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of CloudConfiguration.type is CLOUDINIT.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_cloud__configuration_type
classes.description: The CloudConfiguration.Type enumerated type specifies different types of the cloud configuration.

attributes.name: CLOUDINIT
attributes.description: cloud-init configuration

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_cloudinit__configuration
classes.description: Guest customization settings to customize a Linux guest operating system with raw cloud-init data. The CloudinitConfiguration structure contains settings that configure a Linux machine with raw cloud-init data. See https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest about cloud-init.

attributes.name: metadata
attributes.description: Metadata includes the network, instance id and hostname that cloud-init processes to configure the virtual machine. It is in json or yaml format. The max size of the metadata is 524288 bytes. See https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/ovf.html about supported meta data formats.

attributes.name: userdata
attributes.description: Userdata is the user customized content that cloud-init processes to configure the virtual machine. See https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/format.html about user data formats. See https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/modules.html# about user data modules. The max size of the userdata is 524288 bytes. If unset, no cloud-init user data will be used as part of the cloud-init configuration.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_configuration__spec
classes.description: The ConfigurationSpec structure specifies the settings for customizing a guest operating system.

attributes.name: windows_config
attributes.description: Guest customization specification for a Windows guest operating system If unset, ConfigurationSpec.linux-config or ConfigurationSpec.cloud-config must be set. Otherwise, an appropriate fault will be thrown.

attributes.name: linux_config
attributes.description: Guest customization specification for a linux guest operating system If unset, ConfigurationSpec.windows-config or ConfigurationSpec.cloud-config must be set. Otherwise, an appropriate fault will be thrown.

attributes.name: cloud_config
attributes.description: Guest customization specification with cloud configuration. If unset, ConfigurationSpec.windows-config or ConfigurationSpec.linux-config must be set. Otherwise, an appropriate fault will be thrown.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_customization__spec
classes.description: The CustomizationSpec structure contains information required to customize a virtual machine when deploying it or migrating it to a new host.

attributes.name: configuration_spec
attributes.description: Settings to be applied to the guest during the customization.

attributes.name: global_DNS_settings
attributes.description: Global DNS settings constitute the DNS settings that are not specific to a particular virtual network adapter.

attributes.name: interfaces
attributes.description: IP settings that are specific to a particular virtual network adapter. The AdapterMapping structure maps a network adapter's MAC address to its IPSettings. May be empty if there are no network adapters, else should match number of network adapters configured for the VM.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_customization__specs
classes.description: The {@name CustomizationSpecs} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage guest customization specifications in the vCenter Server.

If multiple {@term fields} are specified, only guest customization specifications matching all of the {@term fields} match the filter.

attributes.name: OS_type

classes.description: The CustomizationSpecs.Format enumerated type specifies the formats the customization specification can be exported to.

attributes.name: XML

classes.description: The CustomizationSpecs.Info structure describes a guest customization specification and the timestamp when it was last modified. This is returned by the CustomizationSpecs.get operation.

attributes.name: last_modified
attributes.description: Time when the specification was last modified.

attributes.name: spec
attributes.description: The Spec object including specification and metadata information.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_customization__specs_metadata
classes.description: The CustomizationSpecs.Metadata structure contains metadata i.e. name and description related to a customization specification.

attributes.name: description

attributes.name: name
