classes.description: The {@name OsType} {@term enumerated type} defines the types of guest operating systems for which guest customization is supported.

attributes.name: WINDOWS
attributes.description: A customization specification for a Windows guest operating system

attributes.name: LINUX
attributes.description: A customization specification for a Linux guest operating system

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_customization__specs_spec
classes.description: The CustomizationSpecs.Spec structure contains the specification information and specification object. This is passed to the CustomizationSpecs.set operation.

attributes.name: fingerprint
attributes.description: The fingerprint is a unique identifier for a given version of the configuration. Each change to the configuration will update this value. A client cannot change this value. If specified when updating a specification, the changes will only be applied if the current fingerprint matches the specified fingerprint. This field can be used to guard against updates that has happened between the specification content was read and until it is applied.

attributes.name: spec
attributes.description: The specification object.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of the specification.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the specification.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_customization__specs_summary
classes.description: The {@name Summary} {@term structure} contains commonly used information about a guest customization specification.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the guest customization specification.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of the guest customization specification.

attributes.name: OS_type
attributes.description: Guest operating system type for which that this guest customization specification applies.

attributes.name: last_modified
attributes.description: Date and tme when this guest customization specification was last modified.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_domain
classes.description: The Domain structure specifies the information needed to join a workgroup or domain. This structure maps to the Identification key in the sysprep.xml answer file. These values are transferred into the sysprep.xml file that VirtualCenter stores on the target virtual disk. For more information about performing unattended installation, check https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc771830(v=ws.10).aspx

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of network to join after the customization.

attributes.name: workgroup
attributes.description: The workgroup that the virtual machine should join. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Domain.type is WORKGROUP.

attributes.name: domain
attributes.description: The domain to which the virtual machine should be joined. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Domain.type is DOMAIN.

attributes.name: domain_username
attributes.description: The domain user that has permission to join the domain after virtual machine is joined. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Domain.type is DOMAIN.

attributes.name: domain_password
attributes.description: The domain user password that has permission to join the Domain.domain-username after customization. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Domain.type is DOMAIN.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_domain_type
classes.description: The Domain.Type enumerated type defines the types of network the virtual machine should join to after the customization is completed.

attributes.name: WORKGROUP
attributes.description: The virtual machine should be be joined to a workgroup.

attributes.name: DOMAIN
attributes.description: The virtual machine should be be joined to a domain.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_global__DNS__settings
classes.description: The GlobalDNSSettings structure specifies a collection of global IP settings in the guest operating system. In Linux, DNS server settings are global. The settings can either be statically set or supplied by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: dns_suffix_list
attributes.description: List of name resolution suffixes for the virtual network adapter. This list applies to both Windows and Linux guest customization. For Linux, this setting is global, whereas in Windows, this setting is listed on a per-adapter basis. If unset, no DNS suffixes are set.

attributes.name: dns_servers
attributes.description: List of DNS servers, for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address. If this list is empty, then the guest operating system is expected to use a DHCP server to get its DNS server settings. These settings configure the virtual machine to use the specified DNS servers. These DNS server settings are listed in the order of preference. If unset, no DNS servers are set.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_gui__unattended
classes.description: The GuiUnattended structure maps to the GuiUnattended key in the sysprep.xml answer file. These values are plugged directly into the sysprep.xml file that VirtualCenter stores on the target virtual disk. For more detailed information about performing unattended installations, check https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc771830(v=ws.10).aspx

attributes.name: auto_logon
attributes.description: Flag to determine whether or not the machine automatically logs on as Administrator. See the GuiUnattended.password property. If GuiUnattended.auto-logon flag is set, then GuiUnattended.password must not be unset or the guest customization will fail.

attributes.name: auto_logon_count
attributes.description: If the GuiUnattended.auto-logon flag is set, then this property specifies the number of times the machine should automatically log on as Administrator. Generally it should be 1, but if the setup requires a number of reboots, you may want to increase it. This number may be determined by the list of commands.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: The new administrator password for the machine. To specify that the password should be set to blank (that is, no password), leave it unset. If unset, blank password will be used.

attributes.name: time_zone
attributes.description: The time zone index for the virtual machine. Numbers correspond to time zones at https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/973627/microsoft-time-zone-index-values

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_hostname__generator
classes.description: The HostnameGenerator structure specifies various mechanisms of generating the hostname for the guest inside the virtual machine while customization.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the Name Generator

attributes.name: fixed_name
attributes.description: The virtual machine name specified by the client. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of HostnameGenerator.type is FIXED.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: Base prefix, to which a unique number is appended. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of HostnameGenerator.type is PREFIX.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_hostname__generator_type
classes.description: The HostnameGenerator.Type enumerated type specifies different types of Name Generators.

attributes.name: FIXED
attributes.description: Specifies that a fixed name should be used for the hostname for the virtual machine during the customization.

attributes.name: PREFIX
attributes.description: Specifies that a unique name should be generated by concatenating the base string with a number including the network name of the guest. Virtual machine names are unique across the set of hosts and virtual machines known to the VirtualCenter instance. VirtualCenter tracks the network names of virtual machines as well as hosts. VMware Tools runs in a guest operating system and reports information to VirtualCenter.

attributes.name: VIRTUAL_MACHINE
attributes.description: Specifies that the VirtualCenter should generate a virtual machine name. The name is generated from a base prefix comprising the virtual machine entity name. A number is appended, if necessary, to make it unique. Virtual machine names are unique across the set of hosts and virtual machines known to the VirtualCenter instance. VirtualCenter tracks the network names of the virtual machines as well as hosts. VMware Tools runs in a guest operating system and reports information to VirtualCenter, including the network name of the guest.

attributes.name: USER_INPUT_REQUIRED
attributes.description: Indicates that the host name is not specified in advance. The user must provide a valid value when the actual customization spec is applied to a virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_IP__settings
classes.description: The IPSettings structure specifies the IP settings for a virtual network adapter.

attributes.name: ipv4
attributes.description: Specification to configure IPv4 address, subnet mask and gateway info for this virtual network adapter. If unset, no IPv4 addresses are set.

attributes.name: ipv6
attributes.description: Specification to configure IPv6 address, subnet mask and gateway info for this virtual network adapter. If unset, no IPv6 addresses are set.

attributes.name: windows
attributes.description: Windows settings to be configured for this specific virtual Network adapter. This is valid only for Windows guest operating systems. If unset, no specific Windows settings are set.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_ipv4
classes.description: The Ipv4 structure specifies the IPv4 settings that need to be applied to a virtual network adapter.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the IPv4 configuration.

attributes.name: ip_address
attributes.description: The static IPv4 address This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ipv4.type is STATIC.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: The IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example, 24. See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ipv4.type is STATIC.

attributes.name: gateways
attributes.description: Gateways for the IPv4 address. If unset, no gateways are set.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_ipv4_type
classes.description: The Ipv4.Type enumerated type specifies different types of the IPv4 configuration.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: DHCP configuration

attributes.name: STATIC
attributes.description: Static configuration

attributes.name: USER_INPUT_REQUIRED
attributes.description: Indicates that the IPv4 settings are not specified in advance. The user must provide a valid value when the actual customization spec is applied to a virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_ipv6
classes.description: The Ipv6 structure specifies the IPv6 settings that need to be applied to a virtual network adapter.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The IPv6 configuration type

attributes.name: ipv6
attributes.description: IPv6 address This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Ipv6.type is STATIC.

attributes.name: gateways
attributes.description: gateways for the IPv6 address. If unset, no gateways are set.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_ipv6__address
classes.description: The Ipv6Address structure specifies the the settings for a Static IPv6 configuration.

attributes.name: ip_address
attributes.description: Static IPv6 Address.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: The CIDR prefix for the interface.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_ipv6_type
classes.description: The Ipv6.Type enumerated type specifies different types of the IPv6 configuration.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: DHCP IPv6 configuration.

attributes.name: STATIC
attributes.description: Static IPv6 configuration.

attributes.name: USER_INPUT_REQUIRED
attributes.description: Indicates that the IPv6 settings are not specified in advance. The user must provide a valid value when the actual customization spec is applied to a virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_linux__configuration
classes.description: Guest customization Settings to customize a Linux guest operating system. The LinuxConfiguration structure contains settings that identify a Linux machine in the same way that the WindowsConfiguration structure identifies a Windows machine.

attributes.name: hostname
attributes.description: The network host name of the Linux virtual machine.

attributes.name: domain
attributes.description: The fully qualified domain name.

attributes.name: time_zone
attributes.description: The case-sensitive time zone, such as Europe/Sofia. Valid time zone values are based on the tz (time zone) database used by Linux. The values are strings (string) in the form "Area/Location," in which Area is a continent or ocean name, and Location is the city, island, or other regional designation. See the https://kb.vmware.com/kb/2145518 for a list of supported time zones for different versions in Linux. If unset, time zone is not modified inside guest operating system.

attributes.name: script_text
attributes.description: The script to run before and after Linux guest customization. The max size of the script is 1500 bytes. As long as the script (shell, perl, python...) has the right "#!" in the header, it is supported. The caller should not assume any environment variables when the script is run. The script is invoked by the customization engine using the command line: 1) with argument "precustomization" before customization, 2) with argument "postcustomization" after customization. The script should parse this argument and implement pre-customization or post-customization task code details in the corresponding block. A Linux shell script example: #!/bin/sh if [ x$1 == x"precustomization" ]; then echo "Do Precustomization tasks" #code for pre-customization actions... elif [ x$1 == x"postcustomization" ]; then echo "Do Postcustomization tasks" #code for post-customization actions... fi If unset, no script will be executed.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_user__data
classes.description: The UserData structure specifies the personal data pertaining to the user of the Windows guest operating system. This structure maps to the UserData key in the sysprep.xml answer file. These values are transferred directly into the sysprep.xml file that VirtualCenter stores on the target virtual disk. For more detailed information about performing unattended installation, check https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc771830(v=ws.10).aspx

attributes.name: computer_name
attributes.description: The computer name of the (Windows) virtual machine. A computer name may contain letters (A-Z), numbers(0-9) and hyphens (-) but no spaces or periods (.). The name may not consist entirely of digits. A computer name is restricted to 15 characters in length. If the computer name is longer than 15 characters, it will be truncated to 15 characters. Check HostnameGenerator for various options.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: Full name of the end user. Note that this is not the username but full name specified in "Firstname Lastname" format.

attributes.name: organization
attributes.description: Name of the organization that owns the computer.

attributes.name: product_key
attributes.description: The product Key to use for activating Windows guest operating system.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_windows__configuration
classes.description: The WindowsConfiguration structure specifies the settings for customizing a windows guest operating system.

attributes.name: reboot
attributes.description: A value specifying the action that should be taken after customization. If unset, the REBOOT option will be chosen.

attributes.name: sysprep
attributes.description: Customization settings like user details, administrator details, etc for the windows guest operating system. Exactly one of WindowsConfiguration.sysprep or WindowsConfiguration.sysprep-xml must be specified. If unset, sysprep settings will not be applied to the windows guest operating system.

attributes.name: sysprep_xml
attributes.description: All settings specified in a XML format. This is the content of a typical answer.xml file that is used by System administrators during the Windows image customization. Check https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/update-windows-settings-and-scripts-create-your-own-answer-file-sxs Exactly one of WindowsConfiguration.sysprep or WindowsConfiguration.sysprep-xml must be specified. If unset, sysprep settings will not be applied to the windows guest operating system.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_windows__configuration_reboot__option
classes.description: The WindowsConfiguration.RebootOption enumerated type specifies what should be done to the guest after the customization.

attributes.name: REBOOT
attributes.description: Reboot the guest after customization.

attributes.name: NO_REBOOT
attributes.description: Take no action. Leave the guest OS running after customization. This option can be used to look at values for debugging purposes.

attributes.name: SHUTDOWN
attributes.description: Shutdown the guest after customization.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_windows__network__adapter__settings
classes.description: The WindowsNetworkAdapterSettings structure specifies Windows specific Network settings for a virtual network adapter.

attributes.name: dns_servers
attributes.description: A list of server IP addresses to use for DNS lookup in a Windows guest operating system. These servers should be specified in the order of preference. If this list is not empty, and if a DHCP IP address is used, then these settings override the DHCP settings. If unset, no DNS servers are set.

attributes.name: dns_domain
attributes.description: A DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com. If unset, no DNS domain is set.

attributes.name: wins_servers
attributes.description: List of WINS Servers to set for the Windows guest operating system. A Maximum of two IP addresses can be specified in this list. The first IP address will be set as the primary WINS server. The second IP address will be set as the secondary WINS server. If unset, no WINS Servers are set.

attributes.name: net_BIOS_mode
attributes.description: NetBIOS setting for Windows. If unset, existing NetBIOS mode will be retained.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_windows__network__adapter__settings_net__BIOS__mode
classes.description: The WindowsNetworkAdapterSettings.NetBIOSMode enumerated type specifies different NetBIOS settings for Windows guest operating systems.

attributes.name: USE_DHCP
attributes.description: DHCP server decides whether or not to use NetBIOS.

attributes.name: ENABLE
attributes.description: Always use NetBIOS.

attributes.name: DISABLE
attributes.description: Never use NetBIOS.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_guest_windows__sysprep
classes.description: The WindowsSysprep structure provides all the settings like user details, administrator details, etc that need to applied for a windows guest operating system during customization.

attributes.name: gui_run_once_commands
attributes.description: A list of commands to run at first user logon, after customizing the guest. These commands are directly mapped to the GuiRunOnce key in the sysprep.xml answer file. These commands are transferred into the sysprep.xml file that VirtualCenter stores on the target virtual disk. For more information about performing unattended installation, check https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc771830(v=ws.10).aspx The commands listed here ar executed when a user logs on the first time after customization completes. The logon may be driven by GuiUnattended.auto-logon setting. These commands are directly mapped to the GuiRunOnce key in the If unset, no commands are run.

attributes.name: user_data
attributes.description: Personal data pertaining to the owner of the virtual machine.

attributes.name: domain
attributes.description: Information needed to join a workgroup or domain. If unset, the guest will not be joined to any workgroup or a domain.

attributes.name: gui_unattended
attributes.description: Information related to unattended installation.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host
classes.description: The {@name Host} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage hosts in the vCenter Server.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnect the host corresponding to {@param.name host} from the vCenter server

methods.name: create
methods.description: Add a new standalone host in the vCenter inventory. The newly connected host will be in connected state. The vCenter Server will verify the SSL certificate before adding the host to its inventory. In the case where the SSL certificate cannot be verified because the Certificate Authority is not recognized or the certificate is self signed, the vCenter Server will fall back to thumbprint verification mode as defined by {@link CreateSpec.ThumbprintVerification}.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) hosts in vCenter matching the {@link FilterSpec}.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Remove a standalone host from the vCenter Server.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connect to the host corresponding to {@param.name host} previously added to the vCenter server.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host_connection__state
classes.description: The {@name ConnectionState} {@term enumerated type} defines the connection status of a host.

attributes.name: CONNECTED
attributes.description: Host is connected to the vCenter Server

attributes.name: DISCONNECTED
attributes.description: Host is disconnected from the vCenter Server

attributes.name: NOT_RESPONDING
attributes.description: VirtualCenter is not receiving heartbeats from the server. The state automatically changes to connected once heartbeats are received again.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host_create__spec
classes.description: The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} defines the information used to create a host.

attributes.name: hostname
attributes.description: The IP address or DNS resolvable name of the host.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: The port of the host.

attributes.name: user_name
attributes.description: The administrator account on the host.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: The password for the administrator account on the host.

attributes.name: folder
attributes.description: Host and cluster folder in which the new standalone host should be created.

attributes.name: thumbprint_verification
attributes.description: Type of host's SSL certificate verification to be done.

attributes.name: thumbprint
attributes.description: The thumbprint of the SSL certificate, which the host is expected to have. The thumbprint is always computed using the SHA1 hash and is the string representation of that hash in the format: xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx where, 'x' represents a hexadecimal digit.

attributes.name: force_add
attributes.description: Whether host should be added to the vCenter Server even if it is being managed by another vCenter Server. The original vCenterServer loses connection to the host.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host_create__spec_thumbprint__verification
classes.description: The {@name ThumbprintVerification} {@term enumerated type} defines the thumbprint verification schemes for a host's SSL certificate.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: Accept the host's thumbprint without verifying it.

attributes.name: THUMBPRINT
attributes.description: Host's SSL certificate verified by checking its thumbprint against the specified thumbprint.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host_filter__spec
classes.description: The {@name FilterSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} used to filter the results when listing hosts (see {@link #list}). If multiple {@term fields} are specified, only hosts matching all of the {@term fields} match the filter.

attributes.name: hosts
attributes.description: Identifiers of hosts that can match the filter.

attributes.name: names
attributes.description: Names that hosts must have to match the filter (see {@link Summary#name}).

attributes.name: folders
attributes.description: Folders that must contain the hosts for the hosts to match the filter.

attributes.name: datacenters
attributes.description: Datacenters that must contain the hosts for the hosts to match the filter.

attributes.name: standalone
attributes.description: If true, only hosts that are not part of a cluster can match the filter, and if false, only hosts that are are part of a cluster can match the filter.

attributes.name: clusters
attributes.description: Clusters that must contain the hosts for the hosts to match the filter.

attributes.name: connection_states
attributes.description: Connection states that a host must be in to match the filter (see {@link Summary#connectionState}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_host_power__state
classes.description: The {@name PowerState} {@term enumerated type} defines the power states of a host.

attributes.name: POWERED_ON
attributes.description: The host is powered on. A host that is entering standby mode is also in this state.

attributes.name: POWERED_OFF
attributes.description: The host was specifically powered off by the user through vCenter server. This state is not a cetain state, because after vCenter server issues the command to power off the host, the host might crash, or kill all the processes but fail to power off.

attributes.name: STANDBY
attributes.description: The host was specifically put in standby mode, either explicitly by the user, or automatically by DPM. This state is not a cetain state, because after VirtualCenter issues the command to put the host in standby state, the host might crash, or kill all the processes but fail to enter standby mode. A host that is exiting standby mode is also in this state.

attributes.name: host
attributes.description: Identifier of the host.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the host.

attributes.name: connection_state
attributes.description: Connection status of the host

attributes.name: power_state
attributes.description: Power state of the host

attributes.name: config_tag
attributes.description: The config type of the identity provider

attributes.name: oauth2
attributes.description: OAuth2 CreateSpec This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.CreateSpec.config-tag is Oauth2.

attributes.name: oidc
attributes.description: OIDC CreateSpec This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.CreateSpec.config-tag is Oidc.

attributes.name: org_ids
attributes.description: The set of orgIds as part of SDDC creation which provides the basis for tenancy If unset, the set will be empty.

attributes.name: is_default
attributes.description: Specifies whether the provider is the default provider. Setting Providers.CreateSpec.is-default of current provider to True makes all other providers non-default. If no other providers created in this vCenter Server before, this parameter will be disregarded, and the provider will always be set to the default. If unset the provider will be the default provider if it is the first provider that is created, and will not be the default provider otherwise.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The user friendly name for the provider. This name can be used for human-readable identification purposes, but it does not have to be unique, as the system will use internal UUIDs to differentiate providers. If unset, the name will be the empty string

attributes.name: domain_names
attributes.description: Set of fully qualified domain names to trust when federating with this identity provider. Tokens from this identity provider will only be validated if the user belongs to one of these domains, and any domain-qualified groups in the tokens will be filtered to include only those groups that belong to one of these domains. If unset, domainNames will be the empty set and the domain validation behavior at login with this identity provider will be as follows: the user's domain will be parsed from the User Principal Name (UPN) value that is found in the tokens returned by the identity provider. This domain will then be implicitly trusted and used to filter any groups that are also provided in the tokens.

attributes.name: auth_query_params
attributes.description: key/value pairs that are to be appended to the authEndpoint request. How to append to authEndpoint request: If the map is not empty, a "?" is added to the endpoint URL, and combination of each k and each string in the v is added with an "&" delimiter. Details: - If the value contains only one string, then the key is added with "k=v". - If the value is an empty list, then the key is added without a "=v". - If the value contains multiple strings, then the key is repeated in the query-string for each string in the value. If unset, the map will be empty.

attributes.name: idm_protocol
attributes.description: Communication protocol to the identity management endpoints. If unset, no communication protocol will be configured for the identity provider.

attributes.name: idm_endpoints
attributes.description: Identity management endpoints. When specified, at least one endpoint must be provided. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.CreateSpec.idm-protocol is one of REST, SCIM, or SCIM2_0.

attributes.name: active_directory_over_ldap
attributes.description: Identity management configuration. If the protocol is LDAP, the configuration must be set, else InvalidArgument is thrown. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.CreateSpec.idm-protocol is LDAP.

attributes.name: upn_claim
attributes.description: Specifies which claim provides the user principal name (UPN) for the user. If unset, the claim named 'acct' will be used to provide backwards compatibility with CSP.

attributes.name: groups_claim
attributes.description: Specifies which claim provides the group membership for the token subject. These groups will be used for mapping to local groups per the claim map. If unset, the default behavior will be CSP backwards compatiblility. The groups for the subject will be comprised of the groups in 'group_names' and 'group_ids' claims.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_identity_providers_idm__protocol
classes.description: The Providers.IdmProtocol structure contains the possible types of communication protocols to the identity management endpoints.

attributes.name: REST
attributes.description: REST protocol based identity management endpoints

attributes.name: SCIM
attributes.description: SCIM V1.1 protocol based identity management endpoints

attributes.name: SCIM2_0
attributes.description: SCIM V2.0 protocol based identity management endpoints

attributes.name: LDAP
attributes.description: LDAP protocol based identity management endpoints

attributes.name: auth_query_params
attributes.description: key/value pairs that are to be appended to the authEndpoint request. Details: - If the value contains only one string, then the key is added with "k=v". - If the value is an empty list, then the key is added without a "=v". - If the value contains multiple strings, then the key is repeated in the query-string for each string in the value. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

attributes.name: idm_protocol

attributes.name: active_directory_over_ldap
attributes.description: Identity management configuration. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.Info.idm-protocol is LDAP.

attributes.name: upn_claim

attributes.name: groups_claim
attributes.description: Specifies which claim provides the group membership for the token subject. If empty, the default behavior for CSP is used. In this case, the groups for the subject will be comprised of the groups in 'group_names' and 'group_ids' claims. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_identity_providers_oauth2__authentication__method
classes.description: The Providers.Oauth2AuthenticationMethod structure contains the possible types of OAuth2 authentication methods.

attributes.name: CLIENT_SECRET_BASIC
attributes.description: Clients that have received a client_secret value from the Authorization Server, authenticate with the Authorization Server in accordance with Section 3.2.1 of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749] using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

attributes.name: CLIENT_SECRET_POST
attributes.description: Clients that have received a client_secret value from the Authorization Server, authenticate with the Authorization Server in accordance with Section 3.2.1 of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749] by including the Client Credentials in the request body.

attributes.name: CLIENT_SECRET_JWT
attributes.description: Clients that have received a client_secret value from the Authorization Server, create a JWT using an HMAC SHA algorithm, such as HMAC SHA-256. The HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) is calculated using the octets of the UTF-8 representation of the client_secret as the shared key.

attributes.name: PRIVATE_KEY_JWT
attributes.description: Clients that have registered a public key sign a JWT using that key. The client authenticates in accordance with JSON Web Token (JWT) Profile for OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication and Authorization Grants [OAuth.JWT] and Assertion Framework for OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication and Authorization Grants [OAuth.Assertions].

The key "perms" is used for mapping the "perms" claim of incoming JWT. The value is another map with an external group as the key and a vCenter Server group as value.

attributes.name: authentication_method

If unset, the map will be empty.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_identity_providers_update__spec
classes.description: The Providers.UpdateSpec structure contains the information used to update the identity provider.

attributes.name: config_tag
attributes.description: The config type of the identity provider

attributes.name: oauth2
attributes.description: OAuth2 UpdateSpec This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.UpdateSpec.config-tag is Oauth2.

attributes.name: oidc
attributes.description: OIDC UpdateSpec This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.UpdateSpec.config-tag is Oidc.

attributes.name: org_ids
attributes.description: The set orgIds as part of SDDC creation which provides the basis for tenancy If unset, leaves value unchanged.

attributes.name: make_default
attributes.description: Specifies whether to make this the default provider. If Providers.UpdateSpec.make-default is set to true, this provider will be flagged as the default provider and any other providers that had previously been flagged as the default will be made non-default. If Providers.UpdateSpec.make-default is set to false, this provider's default flag will not be modified. If unset, leaves value unchanged.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The user friendly name for the provider. This name can be used for human-readable identification purposes, but it does not have to be unique, as the system will use internal UUIDs to differentiate providers. If unset, leaves value unchanged.

attributes.name: domain_names
attributes.description: Set of fully qualified domain names to trust when federating with this identity provider. Tokens from this identity provider will only be validated if the user belongs to one of these domains, and any domain-qualified groups in the tokens will be filtered to include only those groups that belong to one of these domains. If unset, leaves value unchanged. If domainNames is an empty set, domain validation behavior at login with this identity provider will be as follows: the user's domain will be parsed from the User Principal Name (UPN) value that is found in the tokens returned by the identity provider. This domain will then be implicitly trusted and used to filter any groups that are also provided in the tokens.

attributes.name: auth_query_params
attributes.description: key/value pairs that are to be appended to the authEndpoint request. How to append to authEndpoint request: If the map is not empty, a "?" is added to the endpoint URL, and combination of each k and each string in the v is added with an "&" delimiter. Details: If the value contains only one string, then the key is added with "k=v". If the value is an empty list, then the key is added without a "=v". If the value contains multiple strings, then the key is repeated in the query-string for each string in the value. If the map is empty, deletes all params. If unset, leaves value unchanged.

attributes.name: idm_protocol
attributes.description: The protocol to communicate to the identity management endpoints If unset, leave value unchanged.

attributes.name: idm_endpoints
attributes.description: Identity management endpoints. When specified, at least one endpoint must be provided. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.UpdateSpec.idm-protocol is one of REST, SCIM, or SCIM2_0.

attributes.name: active_directory_over_ldap
attributes.description: Identity management configuration. If the protocol is LDAP, the configuration must be set, else InvalidArgument is thrown This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Providers.UpdateSpec.idm-protocol is LDAP.

attributes.name: upn_claim
attributes.description: Specifies which claim provides the user principal name (UPN) for the subject of the token. If unset, leaves value unchanged.

attributes.name: reset_upn_claim
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether the user principal name (UPN) claim should be set back to its default value. If this field is set to true, the user principal name (UPN) claim will be set to 'acct', which is used for backwards compatibility with CSP. If this field is set to false, the existing user principal name (UPN) claim will be changed to the value specified in Providers.UpdateSpec.upn-claim, if any. If unset, the existing user principal name (UPN) claim will be changed to the value specified in Providers.UpdateSpec.upn-claim, if any.

attributes.name: groups_claim
attributes.description: Specifies which claim provides the group membership for the token subject. If unset, leaves value unchanged.

attributes.name: reset_groups_claim
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether any existing groups claim value should be removed. If this field is set to true, the existing groups claim value is removed which defaults to backwards compatibility with CSP. In this case, the groups for the subject will be comprised of the groups in 'group_names' and 'group_ids' claims. If this field is set to false, the existing groups claim will be changed to the value specified in Providers.UpdateSpec.groups-claim, if any. If unset, the existing groups claim will be changed to the value specified in Providers.UpdateSpec.groups-claim, if any.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_common_V__center
classes.description: The VCenter structure contains configuration of the VC that hosts/will host an appliance.

attributes.name: connection
attributes.description: The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

attributes.name: placement_config
attributes.description: The location of the new version of the vCSA on the desired vCenter. All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use 'cluster_path'. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use 'host_path'. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use 'resource_pool_path'. 4. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the 'host_path' key, and the 'datastore_name', e.g. 'host_path': '/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40', 'datastore_name': 'Your Datastore'. 5. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the 'resource_pool_path', and the 'datastore_name', e.g. 'resource_pool_path': '/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool', 'datastore_name': 'Your Datastore'. 6. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the 'vm_folder_path', e.g. vm_folder_path': 'VM Folder 0/VM Folder1'.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_common_vc__placement__config

attributes.name: vm_folder_path

attributes.name: resource_pool_path
attributes.description: Absolute path to resource pool. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{host name}/{cluster_name}/Resources/{resource pool}. e.g: Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool Mutually exclusive between {@vm_folder_path}, #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

attributes.name: cluster_path
attributes.description: Absolute path to the cluster. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{cluster_name}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster Mutually exclusive between {@vm_folder_path}, #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

attributes.name: host_path
attributes.description: Absolute path of the ESX host (FQDN/IP) in the vCenter inventory tree. Mutually exclusive between {@vm_folder_path}, #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

attributes.name: datastore_name
attributes.description: The datastore on which to store the files of the appliance. This value has to be either a specific datastore name, or a specific datastore in a datastore cluster. The datastore must have the space defined as appliance storage size. Mutually exclusive between #datastore_name and #datastore_cluster_name

attributes.name: datastore_cluster_name
attributes.description: The datastore cluster on which to store the files of the appliance. The datastore cluster must have the space defined as appliance storage size. Mutually exclusive between #datastore_name and #datastore_cluster_name

attributes.name: network_name
attributes.description: Name of the network. e.g. VM Network

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_discovery_associated__products
classes.description: The AssociatedProducts service provides options to list, add, modify, and delete VMware products associated with vCenter Server. Some products can be auto-detected by the system while others can be added manually.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_discovery_associated__products
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the detailed information of a product associated with vCenter Server. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires VcLifecycle.View.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Associates a VMware product with vCenter Server manually. The product must be taken from the product catalog API. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires VcLifecycle.View.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Modifies a VMware product associated with vCenter Server which was added manually. Automatically discovered VMware products cannot be modified. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires VcLifecycle.View.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieves a list of all associated VMware product deployments with vCenter Server in the environment. The list contains both product deployments discovered automatically and deployments registered manually through the API. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires VcLifecycle.View.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes or dissociates a VMware product associated with vCenter Server which was added manually. Automatically discovered VMware products cannot be deleted or dissociated. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires VcLifecycle.View.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_reports
classes.description: The Report service provides an operation to download the report generated by the interop and precheck operations. To download a report, you must use the Reports.get operation. A Report.Location structure represents the location of the file which has Report.Token structure which represents the token ID (@name String) and the expiration time of the token Report.Token.expiry DateTime. Report.Location structure also has the URI for the file which needs to be downloaded.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_reports
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the location Reports.Location information for downloading the report for the specified file name. Retrieving a report involves two steps: - Step 1: Invoke the Reports.get operation to provision a token and a URI. - Step 2: Make an HTTP GET request by using the URI and the token returned in step 1 to retrieve the report. The HTTP GET request will: - Return 401 (Not Authorized) if the download URI is recognized, but the token is invalid, 404 if the URL is not recognized otherwise return 200 (OK) - Provide the CSV contents as the output of the request. The API accepts the file name as input, reads the contents of that CSV file, and returns this text as the result of the API. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires VcLifecycle.View.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_reports_location
classes.description: The Reports.Location structure contains the URI location to download the report from, as well as a token required (as a header on the HTTP request) to get the bundle. The validity of the token is 5 minutes as best attempt. After the token expires, any attempt to call the URI with said token will fail.

attributes.name: uri
attributes.description: Report Download URI.

attributes.name: download_file_token
attributes.description: Information about the token required in the HTTP GET request to retrieve the report

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_lcm_reports_token
classes.description: The Reports.Token structure contains information about the token required in the HTTP GET request to generate the report.

attributes.name: token
attributes.description: A one-time, short-lived token required in the HTTP header of the request to the url. This token needs to be passed in as a header with the name "session-id".

attributes.name: expiry
attributes.description: Expiry time of the token

classes.description: Level of severity for applying a given patch or update.

attributes.name: CRITICAL
attributes.description: Vulnerabilities that can be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker from the Internet or those that break the guest/host Operating System isolation.

attributes.name: IMPORTANT
attributes.description: Vulnerabilities that are not rated critical but whose exploitation results in the complete compromise of confidentiality and/or integrity of user data and/or processing resources through user assistance or by authenticated attackers.

attributes.name: MODERATE
attributes.description: Vulnerabilities where the ability to exploit is mitigated to a significant degree by configuration or difficulty of exploitation, but in certain deployment scenarios could still lead to the compromise of confidentiality, integrity, or availability of user data and/or processing resources.

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: All other issues that may or maynot have a security impact. Vulnerabilities where exploitation is believed to be extremely difficult, or where successful exploitation would have minimal impact.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_cluster__compatibility

methods.description: Returns Namespaces compatibility information for all clusters in vCenter matching the ClusterCompatibility.FilterSpec. classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_cluster__compatibility_filter__spec
classes.description: The ClusterCompatibility.FilterSpec structure contains fields used to filter the results when listing clusters (see ClusterCompatibility.list) and their compatibility information.

attributes.name: compatible
attributes.description: Compatibility criteria for matching the filter. If true, only clusters which are compatible for Namespaces match the filter. If false, all clusters match the filter. If unset, both compatible and incompatible clusters match the filter.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The network provider whose networks will be considered. If unset, this will default to NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

attributes.name: compatible

attributes.name: incompatibility_reasons
