classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters
classes.description: The Clusters service provides operations to enable and disable vSphere Namespaces on a vSphere cluster.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Set a new configuration on the cluster object. The specified configuration is applied in entirety and will replace the current configuration fully. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Enable vSphere Namespaces on the cluster. This operation sets up Kubernetes instance for the cluster along with worker nodes. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Disable vSphere Namespaces on the cluster. This operation tears down the Kubernetes instance and the worker nodes associated with vSphere Namespaces enabled cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about a specific cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

methods.name: rotate_password
methods.description: Request a new root password for all control plane nodes in the cluster. This operation generates a new root password and configures every control plane node in the cluster to accept it for authentication. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update configuration on the cluster object. The specified configuration is applied partially and unset fields in spec will leave those parts of configuration as-is. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about all clusters on which vSphere Namespaces are enabled on this vCenter. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Anonymous.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_config__status
classes.description: The Clusters.ConfigStatus enumerated type describes the status of reaching the desired state configuration for the cluster.

attributes.name: CONFIGURING
attributes.description: The Namespace configuration is being applied to the cluster.

attributes.name: REMOVING
attributes.description: The Namespace configuration is being removed from the cluster.

attributes.name: RUNNING
attributes.description: The cluster is configured correctly with the Namespace configuration.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Failed to apply the Namespace configuration to the cluster, user intervention needed.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_enable__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.EnableSpec structure contains the specification required to enable vSphere Namespaces on a cluster.

attributes.name: size_hint
attributes.description: This affects the size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server. It also affects the suggested default serviceCidr and podCidrs.

attributes.name: service_cidr
attributes.description: CIDR block from which Kubernetes allocates service cluster IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec#podCidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec#ingressCidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec#egressCidrs, or other services running in the datacenter.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The provider of cluster networking for this vSphere Namespaces cluster.

attributes.name: ncp_cluster_network_spec
attributes.description: Specification for the NSX Container Plugin cluster network. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.EnableSpec.network-provider is NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN.

attributes.name: workload_networks_spec
attributes.description: Specification for the workload networks to be associated with the cluster. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.EnableSpec.network-provider is VSPHERE_NETWORK.

attributes.name: workload_ntp_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use for workloads such as Tanzu Kubernetes Grid VMs, specified in order of preference. If unset, NTP server for Kubernetes API servers will be used.

attributes.name: load_balancer_config_spec
attributes.description: A LoadBalancer dictates configuration derived from a user-provisioned load balancer that will be used to operate a load balancer that fronts vSphere Namespaces cluster servers, Tanzu Kubernetes Grid API servers, and other servers upon request. This configuration is required for network providers that do not have a default load balancer included. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.EnableSpec.network-provider is VSPHERE_NETWORK.

attributes.name: master_management_network
attributes.description: Specification for the management network on Kubernetes API server. Clusters.NetworkSpec.mode must be STATICRANGE as we require Kubernetes API server to have a stable address.

attributes.name: master_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, no default DNS servers are set.

attributes.name: worker_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on the worker nodes, specified in order of preference. If unset, no default DNS servers are set.

attributes.name: master_DNS_search_domains
attributes.description: List of domains (for example "vmware.com") to be searched when trying to lookup a host name on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, no default DNS search domains are set.

attributes.name: master_NTP_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, VMware Tools based time synchronization is enabled.

attributes.name: master_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with Kubernetes API server. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: ephemeral_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: cns_file_config
attributes.description: Specification for configuring Cloud Native Storage file volume support on Supervisor Cluster. This feature provides support for provisioning ReadWriteMany persistent volumes on this cluster and/or external clusters. If unset, file volume support will not be enabled on this Supervisor Cluster.

attributes.name: login_banner
attributes.description: Disclaimer to be displayed prior to login via the Kubectl plugin. If unset, just skip it.

attributes.name: Master_DNS_names
attributes.description: List of additional DNS names to associate with the Kubernetes API server. These DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate presented by the API server. If unset, no additional DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate.

attributes.name: image_storage
attributes.description: Specification for storage to be used for container images.

attributes.name: default_image_registry
attributes.description: Default image registry to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, defaults to Docker Hub.

attributes.name: default_image_repository
attributes.description: Default image repository to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, defaults to Docker Hub official repository in case of Docker Hub image registry, otherwise defaults to empty string.

attributes.name: default_kubernetes_service_content_library
attributes.description: Identifier of the Content Library which holds the VM Images for vSphere Kubernetes Service. This Content Library should be subscribed to VMware's hosted vSphere Kubernetes Service Repository. If unset, the Content Library identifier will not be set. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_image__registry
classes.description: The Clusters.ImageRegistry structure contains the specification required to configure container image registry endpoint.

attributes.name: hostname
attributes.description: IP address or the hostname of container image registry.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Port number of the container image registry. If unset, defaults to 443.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_image__storage__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.ImageStorageSpec structure contains the specification required to configure storage used for container images.

attributes.name: storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of the storage policy. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_info
classes.description: The Clusters.Info structure contains detailed information about the cluster statistics and status related to vSphere Namespaces.

attributes.name: size_hint
attributes.description: Current setting for SizingHint. This affects the size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

attributes.name: stat_summary
attributes.description: Basic runtime statistics for the cluster.

attributes.name: config_status
attributes.description: Current setting for Clusters.ConfigStatus.

attributes.name: messages
attributes.description: Current set of messages associated with the object.

attributes.name: kubernetes_status
attributes.description: Current setting for Clusters.KubernetesStatus.

attributes.name: kubernetes_status_messages
attributes.description: Current set of messages associated with the object.

attributes.name: api_server_management_endpoint
attributes.description: Kubernetes API Server IP address on the management network. This is a floating IP and assigned to one of the control plane VMs on the management network. This endpoint is used by vSphere components.

attributes.name: api_server_cluster_endpoint
attributes.description: Kubernetes API Server IP address via cluster network. This is the IP address of the Kubernetes LoadBalancer type service fronting the apiservers. This endpoint is the one configured in kubeconfig after login, and used for most human and application interaction with Kubernetes.

attributes.name: api_servers
attributes.description: Identifier of the Kubernetes API servers. These are the IP addresses of the VM instances for the Kubernetes control plane on the management network.

attributes.name: tls_management_endpoint_certificate
attributes.description: PEM-encoded x509 certificate used by TLS endpoint on Kubernetes API servers when accessed from the management network, e.g. from ESX servers or VCSA. This certificate is only valid for use with the apiServerManagementEndpoint.

attributes.name: tls_endpoint_certificate
attributes.description: PEM-encoded x509 certificate used by TLS endpoint on Kubernetes API servers when accessed via the load balancer, e.g. devops user on corporate network. This certificate is only valid for use with the apiServerClusterEndpoint.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The provider of cluster networking for this vSphere Namespaces cluster.

attributes.name: ncp_cluster_network_info
attributes.description: Specification for the NSX Container Plugin cluster network. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.Info.network-provider is NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN.

attributes.name: workload_networks
attributes.description: Information about workload networks associated with the cluster. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.Info.network-provider is VSPHERE_NETWORK.

attributes.name: workload_ntp_servers
attributes.description: Information about NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use for workloads such as Tanzu Kubernetes Grid VMs, specified in order of preference. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

attributes.name: load_balancers
attributes.description: Information related to the Load balancer used for provisioning virtual servers in the namespace. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.Info.network-provider is VSPHERE_NETWORK.

attributes.name: service_cidr
attributes.description: CIDR block from which Kubernetes allocates service cluster IP addresses.

attributes.name: master_management_network
attributes.description: Specification for the management network on Kubernetes API server. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

attributes.name: master_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference.

attributes.name: worker_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use for pods that execute on the worker nodes (which are native pods on ESXi hosts in the vSphere Namespaces Supervisor).

attributes.name: master_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with Kubernetes API server. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: ephemeral_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: cns_file_config
attributes.description: Specification for configuring Cloud Native Storage file volume support on Supervisor Cluster. This feature provides support for provisioning ReadWriteMany persistent volumes on this cluster and/or external clusters. If unset, it means the file volume support is not enabled on this Supervisor Cluster.

attributes.name: login_banner
attributes.description: Disclaimer to be displayed prior to login via the Kubectl plugin. If unset, just skip it.

attributes.name: Master_DNS_names
attributes.description: List of additional DNS names to associate with the Kubernetes API server. These DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate presented by the API server. If unset, no additional DNS names are embedded in the TLS certificate.

attributes.name: image_storage
attributes.description: Specification for storage to be used for container images. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

attributes.name: default_image_registry
attributes.description: Default image registry to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, defaults to Docker Hub.

attributes.name: default_image_repository
attributes.description: Default image repository to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, defaults to Docker Hub official repository in case of Docker Hub image registry, otherwise defaults to empty string.

attributes.name: master_DNS_search_domains
attributes.description: List of domains (for example "vmware.com") to be searched when trying to lookup a host name on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference.

attributes.name: master_NTP_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, VMware Tools based time synchronization is enabled.

attributes.name: default_kubernetes_service_content_library
attributes.description: Identifier of the Content Library which holds the VM Images for vSphere Kubernetes Service. This Content Library should be subscribed to VMware's hosted vSphere Kubernetes Service Repository. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_ipv4__range
classes.description: The Clusters.Ipv4Range contains specification to configure multiple interfaces in IPv4. The range of IPv4 addresses is derived by incrementing the startingAddress to the specified addressCount. To use the object for a single IPv4 address specification, set addressCount to 1.

attributes.name: starting_address
attributes.description: The IPv4 address denoting the start of the range.

attributes.name: address_count
attributes.description: The number of IP addresses in the range. Addresses are derived by incrementing Clusters.Ipv4Range.starting-address.

attributes.name: subnet_mask
attributes.description: Subnet mask to be set.

attributes.name: gateway
attributes.description: The IPv4 address of the gateway associated with the range indicated by Clusters.Ipv4Range.starting-address and Clusters.Ipv4Range.address-count.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_kubernetes__status
classes.description: The Clusters.KubernetesStatus enumerated type describes the cluster's ability to deploy pods.

attributes.name: READY
attributes.description: The cluster is able to accept pods.

attributes.name: WARNING
attributes.description: The cluster may be able to accept pods, but has warning messages.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: The cluster may not be able to accept pods and has error messages.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_message
classes.description: The Clusters.Message structure contains the information about the object configuration.

attributes.name: severity
attributes.description: Type of the message.

attributes.name: details
attributes.description: Details about the message. If unset, message details are not required for taking actions.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_message_severity
classes.description: The Clusters.Message.Severity enumerated type represents the severity of the message.

attributes.name: INFO
attributes.description: Informational message. This may be accompanied by vCenter event.

attributes.name: WARNING
attributes.description: Warning message. This may be accompanied by vCenter event.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Error message. This is accompanied by vCenter event and/or alarm.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_NCP__cluster__network__enable__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec structure encapsulates the NSX Container Plugin-specific cluster networking configuration parameters for the vSphere Namespaces Cluster Enable operation.

attributes.name: pod_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec.ingress-cidrs, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec.pod-cidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec.pod-cidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkEnableSpec.ingress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter.

attributes.name: cluster_distributed_switch
attributes.description: vSphere Distributed Switch used to connect this cluster. This field is required when configuring a cluster that uses NSX-T. If unset and using NSXe, the system will choose a suitable vSphere Distributed Switch. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: vSphereDistributedSwitch. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: vSphereDistributedSwitch.

attributes.name: nsx_edge_cluster
attributes.description: NSX Edge Cluster to be used for Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer, Kubernetes Ingresses, and NSX SNAT. This field is required when configuring a cluster that uses NSX-T. If unset and using NSXe, the system will choose a suitable NSX Edge Cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: NSXEdgeCluster. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: NSXEdgeCluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_NCP__cluster__network__info
classes.description: The Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo structure contains the NSX Container Plugin-specific cluster networking configuration.

attributes.name: pod_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs.

attributes.name: cluster_distributed_switch
attributes.description: vSphere Distributed Switch used to connect this cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: vSphereDistributedSwitch. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: vSphereDistributedSwitch.

attributes.name: nsx_edge_cluster
attributes.description: NSX Edge Cluster to be used for Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer, Kubernetes Ingresses, and NSX SNAT. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: NSXEdgeCluster. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: NSXEdgeCluster.

attributes.name: default_ingress_tls_certificate
attributes.description: PEM-encoded x509 certificate used by NSX as a default fallback certificate for Kubernetes Ingress services.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_NCP__cluster__network__set__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec structure encapsulates the NSX Container Plugin-specific cluster networking configuration parameters for the vSphere Namespaces Cluster Set operation.

attributes.name: pod_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec.ingress-cidrs, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. A set operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec.pod-cidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. A set operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec.pod-cidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkSetSpec.ingress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. A set operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: default_ingress_tls_certificate
attributes.description: PEM-encoded x509 certificate used by NSX as a default fallback certificate for Kubernetes Ingress services.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_NCP__cluster__network__update__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec structure encapsulates the NSX Container Plugin-specific cluster networking configuration parameters for the vSphere Namespaces Cluster Update operation.

attributes.name: pod_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses. This range should not overlap with those in com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec.ingress-cidrs, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list. All Pod CIDR blocks must be of at least subnet size /23. If unset, CIDRs from which Kubernetes allocates pod IP addresses will not be modified.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec.pod-cidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list. If unset, CIDRs from which Kubernetes allocates ingress IP addresses will not be modified.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec.pod-cidrs, com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.EnableSpec#serviceCidr, Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkUpdateSpec.ingress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list. If unset, CIDR from which Kubernetes allocates egress IP addresses will not be modified.

attributes.name: default_ingress_tls_certificate
attributes.description: PEM-encoded x509 certificate used by NSX as a default fallback certificate for Kubernetes Ingress services.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_network__provider
classes.description: Identifies the network plugin that cluster networking functionalities for this vSphere Namespaces Cluster.

attributes.name: NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN
attributes.description: NSX-T Container Plugin.

attributes.name: VSPHERE_NETWORK
attributes.description: vSphere Networking.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_network__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.NetworkSpec contains information related to network configuration for one or more interfaces.

attributes.name: floating_IP
attributes.description: Optionally specify the Floating IP used by the HA master cluster in the DHCP case. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.NetworkSpec.mode is DHCP.

attributes.name: network
attributes.description: Identifier for the network. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Network. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Network.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The address assignment mode.

attributes.name: address_range
attributes.description: Settings for the interfaces on the network. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.NetworkSpec.mode is STATICRANGE.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_network__spec_ipv4__mode
classes.description: The Clusters.NetworkSpec.Ipv4Mode enumerated type defines various IPv4 address assignment modes.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: The address is automatically assigned by a DHCP server.

attributes.name: STATICRANGE
attributes.description: The address is static.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_set__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.SetSpec structure contains the specification required to set a new configuration on the Cluster. This structure is applied in entirety, replacing the current specification fully.

attributes.name: size_hint
attributes.description: This affects the size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The provider of cluster networking for this vSphere Namespaces cluster.

attributes.name: ncp_cluster_network_spec
attributes.description: Specification for the NSX Container Plugin cluster network. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Clusters.SetSpec.network-provider is NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN.

attributes.name: master_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, DNS servers set on Kubernetes API server will be cleared.

attributes.name: worker_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on the worker nodes, specified in order of preference. If unset, DNS servers set on worker nodes will be cleared.

attributes.name: master_DNS_search_domains
attributes.description: List of domains (for example "vmware.com") to be searched when trying to lookup a host name on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, DNS search domains set on Kubernetes API server will be cleared.

attributes.name: master_NTP_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If unset, VMware Tools based time synchronization is enabled and any set NTP servers are cleared.

attributes.name: master_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with Kubernetes API server. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: ephemeral_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: cns_file_config
attributes.description: Specification for configuring Cloud Native Storage file volume support on Supervisor Cluster. This feature provides support for provisioning ReadWriteMany persistent volumes on this cluster and/or external clusters. If unset, file volume support will not be enabled on this Supervisor Cluster.

attributes.name: login_banner
attributes.description: Disclaimer to be displayed prior to login via the Kubectl plugin. If unset, disclaimer to be displayed prior to login via the Kubectl plugin will be cleared.

attributes.name: image_storage
attributes.description: Specification for storage to be used for container images.

attributes.name: default_image_registry
attributes.description: Default image registry to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, default image registry will be set to Docker Hub.

attributes.name: default_image_repository
attributes.description: Default image repository to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, default image repository will be set to Docker Hub official repository in case of Docker Hub image registry, otherwise will be set to empty string.

attributes.name: default_kubernetes_service_content_library
attributes.description: Identifier of the Content Library which holds the VM Images for vSphere Kubernetes Service. This Content Library should be subscribed to VMware's hosted vSphere Kubernetes Service Repository. Modifying or clearing the Content Library identifier will not affect existing vSphere Kubernetes Service clusters. However, upgrades or scale-out of existing clusters may be affected if the new Content Library doesn't have the necessary VM Images. If unset, the Content Library identifier will be cleared. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library.

attributes.name: workload_ntp_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use for workloads such as Tanzu Kubernetes Grid VMs, specified in order of preference. If unset, NTP for Kubernetes API servers will be used.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_stats
classes.description: The Clusters.Stats structure contains the basic runtime statistics about a vSphere Namespaces-enabled cluster.

attributes.name: cpu_used
attributes.description: Overall CPU usage of the cluster, in MHz. This is the sum of CPU usage across all worker nodes in the cluster.

attributes.name: cpu_capacity
attributes.description: Total CPU capacity in the cluster available for vSphere Namespaces, in MHz. This is the sum of CPU capacities from all worker nodes in the cluster.

attributes.name: memory_used
attributes.description: Overall memory usage of the cluster, in mebibytes. This is the sum of memory usage across all worker nodes in the cluster.

attributes.name: memory_capacity
attributes.description: Total memory capacity of the cluster available for vSphere Namespaces, in mebibytes. This is the sum of memory capacities from all worker nodesin the cluster.

attributes.name: storage_used
attributes.description: Overall storage used by the cluster, in mebibytes. This is the sum of storage used across all worker nodes in the cluster.

attributes.name: storage_capacity
attributes.description: Overall storage capacity of the cluster available for vSphere Namespaces, in mebibytes. This is the sum of total storage available from all worker nodes in the cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_summary
classes.description: The Clusters.Summary structure contains the basic information about the cluster statistics and status related to vSphere Namespaces.

attributes.name: cluster
attributes.description: Identifier for the cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

attributes.name: cluster_name
attributes.description: Name of the cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.name. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.name.

attributes.name: stats
attributes.description: Basic runtime statistics for the cluster.

attributes.name: config_status
attributes.description: Current setting for Clusters.ConfigStatus.

attributes.name: kubernetes_status
attributes.description: Current setting for Clusters.KubernetesStatus.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_update__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.UpdateSpec structure contains the specification required to update the configuration on the Cluster. This structure is applied partially, and only the specified fields will replace or modify their existing counterparts.

attributes.name: size_hint
attributes.description: This affects the size and resources allocated to the Kubernetes API server. If unset, size and resources allocated to Kubernetes API server will not be modified.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The provider of cluster networking for this vSphere Namespaces cluster. If unset, the existing effective cluster network specification will not be modified.

attributes.name: ncp_cluster_network_spec
attributes.description: Updated specification for the cluster network configuration. If unset, existing effective value will not be modified If unset, the existing effective cluster network specification will not be modified.

attributes.name: master_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If set, DNS servers set on Kubernetes API server will be replaced. Otherwise, they will not be modified.

attributes.name: worker_DNS
attributes.description: List of DNS server IP addresses to use on the worker nodes, specified in order of preference. If set, DNS servers set on worker nodes will be replaced. Otherwise, they will not be modified.

attributes.name: master_DNS_search_domains
attributes.description: List of domains (for example "vmware.com") to be searched when trying to lookup a host name on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If set, DNS search domains on Kubernetes API server will be replaced. Otherwise, they will not be modified.

attributes.name: master_NTP_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use on Kubernetes API server, specified in order of preference. If set, NTP servers on Kubernetes API server will be replaced. Otherwise, they will not be modified.

attributes.name: master_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with Kubernetes API server. If unset, storage policy associated with Kubernetes API server will not be modified. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: ephemeral_storage_policy
attributes.description: Identifier of storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods in the cluster. If unset, storage policy associated with ephemeral disks of all the Kubernetes Pods will not be modified. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: SpsStorageProfile.

attributes.name: cns_file_config
attributes.description: Specification for configuring Cloud Native Storage file volume support on Supervisor Cluster. This feature provides support for provisioning ReadWriteMany persistent volumes on this cluster and/or external clusters. If unset, configuration for file volumes will remain unchanged.

attributes.name: login_banner
attributes.description: Disclaimer to be displayed prior to login via the Kubectl plugin. If unset, disclaimer to be displayed prior to login via the Kubectl plugin will not be modified.

attributes.name: image_storage
attributes.description: Specification for storage to be used for container images. If unset, configuration of storage used for container images is not modified.

attributes.name: default_image_registry
attributes.description: Default image registry to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, default image registry will not be modified.

attributes.name: default_image_repository
attributes.description: Default image repository to use when Kubernetes Pod container specification does not specify it as part of the container image name. If unset, default image repository will not be modified.

attributes.name: tls_endpoint_certificate
attributes.description: Certificate issued for Kubernetes API Server. Certificate used must be created by signing the Certificate Signing Request obtained from com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.certificates.Request.create Because a CertificateSigningRequest is created on an existing Namespaces-enabled Cluster, you must use the Clusters.UpdateSpec to specify this tlsEndpointCertificate on an existing Cluster rather than during initially enabling Namespaces on a Cluster. If unset, Kubernetes API Server certificate will not be modified.

attributes.name: default_kubernetes_service_content_library
attributes.description: Identifier of the Content Library which holds the VM Images for vSphere Kubernetes Service. This Content Library should be subscribed to VMware's hosted vSphere Kubernetes Service Repository. Modifying or clearing the Content Library identifier will not affect existing vSphere Kubernetes Service clusters. However, upgrades or scale-out of existing clusters may be affected if the new Content Library doesn't have the necessary VM Images. If unset, the Content Library identifier will not be modified. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.content.Library.

attributes.name: workload_ntp_servers
attributes.description: List of NTP server DNS names or IP addresses to use for workloads such as Tanzu Kubernetes Grid VMs, specified in order of preference. If unset, NTP servers for workloads will be unmodified.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_workload__networks__enable__spec
classes.description: The Clusters.WorkloadNetworksEnableSpec contains the specification required to configure workload networks for a vSphere Namespaces Cluster during Enable operation. These workload networks will be used as backing network for Tanzu Kubernetes Cluster VMs and Kubernetes control plane VMs.

attributes.name: supervisor_primary_workload_network
attributes.description: The CreateSpec of the vSphere Namespaces network that will be used by Kubernetes control plane VMs to expose Kubernetes API server to devops users and other workloads. It can also used as backing network for Tanzu Kubernetes Cluster VMs.

attributes.name: network_list
attributes.description: CreateSpecs structurees for additional list of vSphere Namespaces networks to be associated with this cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_clusters_workload__networks__info
classes.description: The Clusters.WorkloadNetworksInfo contains information related to configuration of vSphere Namespaces Network objects.

attributes.name: supervisor_primary_workload_network
attributes.description: vSphere Namespaces network used by Kubernetes control plane VMs to access load-balanced services on the various workload networks.

attributes.name: network_list
attributes.description: List of vSphere Namespaces networks associated with this cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_CNS__file__config
classes.description: The CNSFileConfig structure contains the specification required to set the configuration for Cloud Native Storage file volume support on Supervisor Cluster.

attributes.name: vsan_clusters
attributes.description: CNSFileConfig.vsan-clusters is a list of clusters to be used for provisioning file volumes. As a prerequisite these clusters must have vSAN and vSAN file services enabled, and must be in the same vCenter as the Supervisor Cluster. Currently this list must have a single entry which is the cluster identifier of the current cluster. This cluster must be a vSAN cluster and must have vSAN File Service enabled. If a cluster in the list is not a vSAN cluster or does not have vSAN File Service enabled, an InvalidArgument error will be thrown from Clusters.enable, Clusters.update and Clusters.set APIs. For disabling file volume support on Supervisor Cluster, an empty list is expected. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_cns_maintenance__action__type
classes.description: The MaintenanceActionType structure contains actions to be taken when an entity enters maintenance mode.

attributes.name: PermanentRemoval
attributes.description: The entity is getting permanently removed. Move applications, rebuild storage on other entities before allowing to proceed.

attributes.name: EnsureAccessibility
attributes.description: The entity is going down temporarily for maintenance. Still need to ensure application availability and storage accessibility at least in a degraded level.

attributes.name: NoAction
attributes.description: Admin override to not delay or stop the entity from entering maintenance mode.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_distributed__switch__compatibility
classes.description: The DistributedSwitchCompatibility service provides operations to get Namespaces compatibility information of Distributed Switches in this vCenter.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_distributed__switch__compatibility
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns Namespaces compatibility information of Distributed Switches in vCenter associated with the vCenter cluster, matching the DistributedSwitchCompatibility.FilterSpec. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_distributed__switch__compatibility_filter__spec
classes.description: The DistributedSwitchCompatibility.FilterSpec structure contains fields used to filter the results when listing Distributed Switches (see DistributedSwitchCompatibility.list) and their compatibility information.

attributes.name: compatible
attributes.description: Compatibility criteria for matching the filter. If true, only Distributed Switches which are compatible with vSphere Namespaces match the filter. If false, only Distributed Switches which are incompatible with vSphere Namespaces match the filter. If unset, both compatible and incompatible Distributed Switches match the filter.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The network provider whose networks will be considered. If unset, this will default to NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_distributed__switch__compatibility_summary
classes.description: The DistributedSwitchCompatibility.Summary structure contains information about the compatibility of a vSphere Distributed Switch with the Namespaces feature.

attributes.name: distributed_switch
attributes.description: Identifier of the switch. If networkProvider is either unset or is set to NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN, the value of this field will refer to the UUID of a vim.DistributedVirtualSwitch. Otherwise, the value of the field will refer to the ID of a vim.DistributedVirtualSwitch. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: vSphereDistributedSwitch. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: vSphereDistributedSwitch.

attributes.name: compatible
attributes.description: Compatibility of this switch with vSphere Namespaces.

attributes.name: incompatibility_reasons
attributes.description: List of reasons for incompatibility. If unset, this Distributed Switch is compatible.

attributes.name: network_provider
attributes.description: The network provider whose networks were considered. If unset, clients clients should assume the value to be NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN.

attributes.name: compatible_networks
attributes.description: List of compatible (PortGroup) Networks under the distributed switch. This field is optional because it was added in a newer version than its parent node. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: Network. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: Network.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_edge__cluster__compatibility
classes.description: The EdgeClusterCompatibility service provides operations to get Namespaces compatibility information of NSX Edge Clusters.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_edge__cluster__compatibility
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns Namespaces compatibility information of NSX-T Edge Clusters matching the EdgeClusterCompatibility.FilterSpec. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_edge__cluster__compatibility_filter__spec
classes.description: The EdgeClusterCompatibility.FilterSpec structure contains fields used to filter the results when listing Edge Clusters (see EdgeClusterCompatibility.list) and their compatibility information.

attributes.name: compatible
attributes.description: Compatibility criteria for matching the filter. If true, only Edge Clusters which are compatible with vSphere Namespaces match the filter. If false, only Edge Clusters which are incompatible with vSphere Namespaces match the filter. If unset, both compatible and incompatible Edge Clusters match the filter.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_edge__cluster__compatibility_summary
classes.description: The EdgeClusterCompatibility.Summary structure contains information about an NSX-T Edge Cluster, including its compatibility with the vCenter Namespaces feature.

attributes.name: edge_cluster
attributes.description: Identifier of the Edge Cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: NSXEdgeCluster. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: NSXEdgeCluster.

attributes.name: display_name
attributes.description: Display name of the Edge Cluster.

attributes.name: compatible
attributes.description: Compatibility of this Edge Cluster with Namespaces feature.

attributes.name: incompatibility_reasons
attributes.description: List of reasons for incompatibility. If unset, this Edge Cluster is compatible.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_hosts__config
classes.description: The Compatibility service provides operations to retrieve information about vSphere Namespaces support and licensing.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_hosts__config
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns support and licensing information about hosts under a VC. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_hosts__config_info
classes.description: The Compatibility structure contains information about vSphere Namespaces support and licensing.

attributes.name: namespaces_supported
attributes.description: True if vSphere Namespace feature is supported in this VC.

attributes.name: namespaces_licensed
attributes.description: True if vSphere Namespace feature is licensed on any hosts in this VC.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_IP__range
classes.description: The IPRange structure is used to express a range of IP addresses. The formats supported by this structure will depend on the IP addressing scheme that is being used by vSphere Namespaces. Currently, vSphere Namespaces only supports IPv4.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: The starting address of the range.

attributes.name: count
attributes.description: The number of IP addresses in the range.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_ipv4__cidr
classes.description: The Ipv4Cidr structure contains the specification for representing CIDR notation of IP range. For example, this can be used to represent 256 IP addresses using 10.10.10.0/24.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: The IPv4 address.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: The CIDR prefix.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_load__balancers
classes.description: LoadBalancers represent the user provisioned load balancers. The load balancers provided may be used to front the API servers in both, vSphere Namespaces Cluster and Tanzu Kubernetes Grid clusters. Note: The lifecycle of these load balancers is not managed by vSphere.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_load__balancers
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Applies the entire load balancer spec to an existing load balancer configuration. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information LoadBalancers.Info about the load balancer associated with the given cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the load balancer configuration. The specified configuration is applied partially and unset fields in spec will leave those parts of configuration as-is. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Manage.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about all load balancers associated with the given cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_load__balancers_avi__config__create__spec

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_load__balancers_avi__info
classes.description: The LoadBalancers.AviInfo contains information related to the Avi software load balancer in the namespace.

attributes.name: server
attributes.description: Server is the address for the Avi Controller, used to configure Virtual Servers.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: An administrator user name for accessing the Avi Controller.

attributes.name: certificate_authority_chain

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_load__balancers_config__spec
classes.description: The LoadBalancers.ConfigSpec encapsulates load balancer configuration on vSphere Namespaces.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: An identifier that identifies a load balancer and can be used to query or configure load balancer properties via these resources. The identifier has DNS_LABEL restrictions as specified in . This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string, with a maximum length of 63 characters and with the '-' character allowed anywhere except the first or last character. This name is unique across all Namespaces in this vCenter server. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.LoadBalancerConfig. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.LoadBalancerConfig.

attributes.name: address_ranges
attributes.description: List of address ranges that will be used to derive frontend IP addresses for L4 virtual servers. At least one range must be provided.

attributes.name: provider
attributes.description: The LoadBalancers.ConfigSpec.provider selects a provider from the list of available providers to be used with vSphere Namespaces.

attributes.name: ha_proxy_config_create_spec
attributes.description: The LoadBalancers.HAProxyConfigCreateSpec is a conditional configuration made available upon selecting the HA_PROXY load balancer provider. It is used to configure the load balancer at run time. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of LoadBalancers.ConfigSpec.provider is HA_PROXY.

attributes.name: avi_config_create_spec
attributes.description: The LoadBalancers.AviConfigCreateSpec is a conditional configuration made available upon selecting the AVI load balancer provider. It is used to configure the load balancer at run time. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of LoadBalancers.ConfigSpec.provider is AVI.

attributes.name: network
attributes.description: Identifier of the network. This has DNS_LABEL restrictions as specified in . This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string and with maximum length of 63 characters and with the '-' character allowed anywhere except the first or last character. This name must be unique within a cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.Network. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.Network.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_networks_nsx__network__create__spec
classes.description: The Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec structure describes the configuration specification of a NSXT-backed Namespaces Network configuration.

attributes.name: namespace_network_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates IP addresss for all workloads that attach to the namespace, including PodVMs, TKGS and VM Service VMs. This range should not overlap with those in Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. This field is required when Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.nsx-tier0-gateway or any of Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs are specified. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. This field is required when Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.nsx-tier0-gateway or any of Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs is specified. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. This field is required when Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.routed-mode is set to False and Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.nsx-tier0-gateway or any of Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs is specified. When Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.routed-mode is set to True, this field is not allowed. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: nsx_tier0_gateway
attributes.description: NSX Tier0 Gateway used for the namespace. This field does not allow update once applied. This field is required when configuring a cluster that uses NSX-T. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: NSXTier0Gateway. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: NSXTier0Gateway.

attributes.name: subnet_prefix_length
attributes.description: Size of the subnet reserved for namespace segments. If unset, defaults to 28. This field does not allow update once applied.

attributes.name: routed_mode
attributes.description: Routed mode for thw namespace. When set to True, the traffic in the namespace is not NATed. If unset, defaults to False. When this field is set to True, Networks.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs is not allowed. This field does not allow update once applied.

attributes.name: load_balancer_size
attributes.description: The size of the NSX Load Balancer used by the namespace. This field does not allow update once applied. If unset, defaults to SMALL.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_networks_nsx__network__info
classes.description: The Networks.NsxNetworkInfo structure describes the configuration specification of a NSXT-backed Namespaces Network configuration.

attributes.name: namespace_network_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates IP addresses for all workloads that attach to the namespace, including PodVMs, TKGS and VM Service VMs. If unset, cluster level settings specified in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo.pod-cidrs will be applied.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. If unset, cluster level settings specified in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo.ingress-cidrs will be applied.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. If unset, cluster level settings specified in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo.egress-cidrs will be applied.

attributes.name: nsx_tier0_gateway
attributes.description: NSX Tier0 Gateway used for this namespace. If unset, cluster level settings specified in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo.nsx-tier0-gateway will be applied. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: NSXTier0Gateway. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: NSXTier0Gateway.

attributes.name: subnet_prefix_length
attributes.description: Size of the subnet reserved for namespace segments If unset, cluster level settings specified in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo.namespace-subnet-prefix will be applied.

attributes.name: routed_mode
attributes.description: Routed mode for this namespace. When set to True, the traffic in the namespace is not NATed. If unset, cluster level settings specified in Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo.routed-mode will be applied.

attributes.name: load_balancer_size
attributes.description: The size of the NSX Load Balancer used by the namespace. If unset, then SMALL is used.

attributes.name: namespace_network_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates IP addresses for all workloads that attach to the namespace, including PodVMs, TKGS and VM Service VMs. Only appending additional Cidr is allowed. Modification to existing Cidr ranges will result in the operation failing with a ResourceInUse error. Appending invalid Cidr e.g. overlapping or broadcast or reserved Cidr will result in the operation failing with a InvalidArgument error. If unset, the current value will be retained.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs

Modification to existing Cidr ranges will result in the operation failing with a ResourceInUse error. Appending invalid Cidr e.g. overlapping or broadcast or reserved Cidr will result in the operation failing with a InvalidArgument error. If unset, the current value will be retained.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. Only appending additional Cidr is allowed. Modification to existing Cidr ranges will result in the operation failing with a ResourceInUse error. Appending invalid Cidr e.g. overlapping or broadcast or reserved Cidr will result in the operation failing with a InvalidArgument error. If unset, the current value will be retained.

To add new address ranges to the list, existing address ranges have to be passed in without modifications.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_proxy__configuration
classes.description: The ProxyConfiguration structure defines proxy configuration to be used by the Supervisor.

attributes.name: proxy_settings_source
attributes.description: The source of the proxy settings. If VC_INHERITED or NONE is specified, then the other configuration in ProxyConfiguration will be ignored.

attributes.name: https_proxy_config
attributes.description: HTTPS proxy configuration. Examples: - http://username:password@proxy.vmware.com:8080 - https://proxy.vmware.com:4443 This will be used if CLUSTER_CONFIGURED is used for the source, otherwise this will be ignored. If unset no HTTPS proxy will be used.

attributes.name: http_proxy_config
attributes.description: HTTP proxy configuration. Examples: - http://username:password@proxy.vmware.com:8080 - https://proxy.vmware.com:4443 This will be used if CLUSTER_CONFIGURED is used for the source, otherwise this will be ignored. If unset no HTTP proxy will be used.

attributes.name: no_proxy_config
attributes.description: List of addresses that should be accessed directly. This will be used if CLUSTER_CONFIGURED is used for the source, otherwise this will be ignored. If unset there won't be any excluded addresses.

attributes.name: tls_root_ca_bundle
attributes.description: Proxy TLS root CA bundle which will be used to verify the proxies certificates. Every certificate in the bundle is expected to be in PEM format. This will be used if CLUSTER_CONFIGURED is used for the source, otherwise this will be ignored. If unset only the vCenter certificates applied in VECS (VMware Endpoint Certificate Store) will be used.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_proxy__settings__source
classes.description: The settings can be inherited from the vCenter settings, so the cluster settings will be synced. The settings can be applied directly on the cluster level, or the cluster can be configured not to use a proxy.

attributes.name: VC_INHERITED
attributes.description: Proxy settings will be inherited from the vCenter settings. vCenter and cluster settings will be kept in sync.

attributes.name: CLUSTER_CONFIGURED
attributes.description: Proxy settings will be configured at the cluster level.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: No proxy settings will be applied to the cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_software_clusters
classes.description: The Clusters service provides operations to upgrade the vSphere clusters.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_software_clusters
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: upgrade
methods.description: Upgrade the cluster to a specific version. This operation upgrades the components on control plane VMs and worker plane hosts based on the selected version. Before upgrading, this operation performs pre-checks and sets the evaluation response in Info.UpgradeStatus.messages with various Message.Severity levels. Depending on the severity, the upgrade may or may not proceed beyond prechecks. Here is a list of severities and corresponding behavior: - ERROR: Upgrade does not proceed beyond precheck operation - WARNING: Upgrade proceeds beyond precheck operation only if UpgradeSpec.ignorePrecheckWarnings is set to true - INFO: Upgrade proceeds beyond precheck operation uninterrupted if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.Upgrade.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns upgrade related information of a specific cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

methods.name: upgrade_multiple
methods.description: Upgrade a set of clusters to its corresponding specific version. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Anonymous.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns upgrade related information about all WCP enabled clusters. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Anonymous.

attributes.name: READY
attributes.description: Cluster is ready when there is no upgrade or upgrade is completed.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Upgrade failed and need user intervention.

When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.name.

attributes.name: current_version

classes.description: The Clusters.UpgradeProgress structure contains detailed information about the cluster upgrade progess.

attributes.description: Total amount of the work for the operation. The work here represents the number of master nodes in the cluster need to be upgraded.

attributes.description: If true, the upgrade workflow will ignore any pre-check warnings and proceed with the upgrade. If unset, the upgrade workflow will not ignore pre-check warnings and fail the upgrade. It is equivalent to setting the value to false. The workflow adopts a conservative approach of failing the upgrade if unset to solely let the user decide whether to force the upgrade despite the warnings.
