classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services
classes.description: The SupervisorServices service provides operations to manage a Supervisor Service object. Supervisor services can be extensions to the vSphere Supervisor clusters and provide services to applications running in vSphere Supervisor clusters. They are often provided by 3rd party vendors.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Return the information for the specified Supervisor Service. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

methods.name: activate
methods.description: Activate a Supervisor Service. This operation will change the SupervisorServices.State of the supervisor service to in ACTIVATED state, and activate all versions of the supervisor service. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a Supervisor Service. If version specs are provided in the spec, new Supervisor Service versions will be created as part of the operation. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update a Supervisor Service. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: check_content
methods.description: Perform validation checks on the content of a Supervisor Service version defined in the spec. The operation returns the validation status and relevant Supervisor Service version information that are available in the content. A custom format will always return a VALID status. Only vSphere applications validation can return multiple status. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Return the information about all Supervisor Services on this vCenter. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a Supervisor Service. This operation only deletes the Supervisor Service from vCenter if the Supervisor Service is in DEACTIVATED state, and all versions of the Supervisor Service are removed from vCenter. Note that the SupervisorService#deactivate operation should be called to deactivate the Supervisor Service before the Supervisor Service can be deleted. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: deactivate
methods.description: Deactivate a Supervisor Service. This operation will change the SupervisorServices.State of the supervisor service to DEACTIVATED state, and deactivate all versions of the supervisor service. Note that this operation should be called before deleting the Supervisor Service. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services_check__result
classes.description: The SupervisorServices.CheckResult structure defines the result of the validation checks on the content of a Supervisor Service version.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Indicates if the provided content is valid.

attributes.name: content_type
attributes.description: The type of the provided content. When this SupervisorServices.CheckResult.content-type is ContentType#CUSTOM_YAML, the SupervisorServices.CheckResult.status is always VALID because a custom format is not validated. If unset, the content type cannot be determined from the provided content.

attributes.name: vsphere_apps_check_result
attributes.description: The information about the Supervisor Service version retrieved from the provided content as a result of validation checks if the content is in the vSphere application service format. If unset, the content is not in the vSphere application service format or the SupervisorServices.CheckResult.status is INVALID.

attributes.name: warning_messages
attributes.description: A list of messages indicating why the content was considered valid but contains information that should be reviewed closely. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of SupervisorServices.CheckResult.status is VALID_WITH_WARNINGS.

attributes.name: error_messages
attributes.description: A list of messages indicating why the content was considered invalid. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of SupervisorServices.CheckResult.status is INVALID.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services_cluster__supervisor__services
classes.description: The ClusterSupervisorServices service provides operations to manage a Supervisor Service on the vSphere Supervisor clusters.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services_cluster__supervisor__services
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Set a new configuration to the specified Supervisor Service on the specified vSphere Supervisor cluster. This operation will apply the new Supervisor Service version's service definition to the existing Supervisor Service on the cluster. This operation requires that the specified Supervisor Service is already installed in the specified vSphere Supervisor cluster. Note that this operation doesn't interfere with the application instances that are created by the associated operator(s). So users should make sure the new version is still compatible with the existing application instances. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Return information about the specific Supervisor Service on the specified vSphere Supervisor cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a Supervisor Service on the specified vSphere Supervisor cluster. This operation will apply the Supervisor Service version's service definition on the cluster. This operation is possible only when the Supervisor Service and Supervisor Service version are in the State#ACTIVATED state. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Return the summaries about all Supervisor Services on the specified vSphere Supervisor cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a Supervisor Service on the specified vSphere Supervisor cluster. This operation will remove the Supervisor Service with the specified identifier from the cluster, by removing the corresponding namespace and deleting the operator(s) associated with the Supervisor Service. Note that this operation doesn't deal with the application instances that are created by the associated operator(s), so existing application instances could be orphaned if users don't clean or migrate them. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

attributes.name: CONFIGURED

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Failed to install the Supervisor Service, user intervention needed.

This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string and with maximum length of 63 characters and with the '-' character allowed anywhere except the first or last character. This identifier must be unique across all Namespaces in this vCenter server. Additionally, the ID 'namespaces' is reserved and must not be used. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.SupervisorService. classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services_versions
classes.description: The Versions service provides operations to manage a version object of a Supervisor Service. A Supervisor Service version can be enabled on the vSphere Supervisor clusters.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_supervisor__services_versions
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Return the information for the specified Supervisor Service version. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

methods.name: activate
methods.description: Activate a Supervisor Service version. This operation will change the Versions.State of the version to ACTIVATED state. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a Supervisor Service version based on the provided service definition information for the version. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Return the information about all versions of the Supervisor Service. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Read.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a Supervisor Service version. This operation only deletes the Supervisor Service version from vCenter if the version is in DEACTIVATED state and all instances of the version are removed from all vSphere Supervisor clusters. Note that the Version#deactivate operation should be called to deactivate the version before the version can be deleted. Note that deleting the last version of the supervisorService does not delete the supervisorService instance automatically. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

methods.name: deactivate
methods.description: Deactivate a Supervisor Service version. This operation will change the Versions.State of the version to DEACTIVATED state, which will make sure the version cannot be created on any Supervisor cluster. Note that this operation should be called before deleting the version. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires SupervisorServices.Manage.

When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.supervisor_services.Version. attributes.description: Inline content that contains all service definition of the version, which shall be base64 encoded. The service definition here doesn't follow the vSphere application service format.

attributes.description: Whether or not the Supervisor Service version is from a trusted provider, this field must be set to false if the service version is not from a trusted provider. If it is set to be true, but the Versions.CustomCreateSpec.content is not signed or the signature is invalid, an InvalidArgument will be thrown. If unset, the default value is true. In this case, the Versions.CustomCreateSpec.content must be signed and will be verified.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_support__bundle
classes.description: The SupportBundle service provides operations to retrieve the cluster's Namespaces-related support bundle download location.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_support__bundle
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: create
methods.description: Returns the location SupportBundle.Location information for downloading the Namespaces-related support bundle for the specified cluster. Retrieving a support bundle involves two steps: - Step 1: Invoke operation to provision a token and a URI. - Step 2: Make an HTTP GET request using URI and one time used token returned in step 1 to generate the support bundle and return it. There can only be one valid token per cluster at any given time. If this operation is invoked again for the same cluster identifier while a token still valid, the API will return the same SupportBundle.Location response. The HTTP GET request will: - return 401 (Not Authorized) if the download URL is recognized, but the token is invalid. - otherwise return 200 (OK), mark the token used (invalidating it for any future use), open a application/tar download stream for the client, and start the bundle process. As part of its work, the API will orchestrate support bundling on the worker nodes of a cluster. If a failure occurs during the collection of support bundle from worker node, the API will not abort the request, but will log a warning and move on to processing other worker nodes' bundles. The API will only abort its operation if the content of the stream has been corrupted. When the API has to abort its operation (and the response stream), it will not provide any indication of failures to the client. The client will need to verify validity of the resultant file based on the format specified in the response's Content-Disposition header. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires Global.Diagnostics.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespace__management_support__bundle_location
classes.description: The SupportBundle.Location structure contains the URI location to download the per-cluster support bundle from, as well as a token required (as a header on the HTTP request) to get the bundle. The validity of the token is 5 minutes. After the token expires, any attempt to call the URI with said token will fail.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: Support Bundle Download URL.

attributes.name: wcp_support_bundle_token
attributes.description: Information about the token required in the HTTP GET request to generate the support bundle.

classes.description: The SupportBundle.Token structure contains information about the token required in the HTTP GET request to generate the support bundle.

attributes.name: token

attributes.name: expiry
attributes.description: Expiry time of the token

methods.name: set

The specified configuration is applied partially and unset fields in spec will leave those parts of configuration as-is. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance referenced by the parameter namespace requires Namespaces.Configure.

methods.name: list

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete the namespace object in the cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance referenced by the parameter namespace requires Namespaces.Configure.

attributes.name: namespace
attributes.description: Identifier of the namespace. This has DNS_LABEL restrictions as specified in . This must be an alphanumeric (a-z and 0-9) string and with maximum length of 63 characters and with the '-' character allowed anywhere except the first or last character. This name is unique across all Namespaces in this vCenter server. In this version, this maps to the name of a Kubernetes namespace. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.

attributes.name: cluster
attributes.description: Identifier of the cluster on which the namespace is being created. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description for the namespace. If unset, no description is added to the namespace.

attributes.name: resource_spec
attributes.description: Resource quota on the namespace. Refer to com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NamespaceResourceOptions.Info#createResourceQuotaType and use com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NamespaceResourceOptions#get for retrieving the type for the value for this field. For an example of this, see ResourceQuotaOptionsV1. If unset, no resource limits will be set on the namespace.

attributes.name: access_list
attributes.description: Access controls associated with the namespace. If unset, only users with Administrator role can access the namespace.

attributes.name: storage_specs
attributes.description: Storage associated with the namespace. If unset, storage policies will not be associated with the namespace which will prevent users from being able to provision pods with persistent storage on the namespace. Users will be able to provision pods which use local storage.

attributes.name: networks
attributes.description: vSphere Namespaces network objects to be associated with the namespace. The values of this list need to reference names of pre-existing Networks.Info structures. The field must be left unset if the cluster hosting the namespace uses NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN as the network provider, since the network(s) for this namespace will be managed by NSX-T Container Plugin. If field is unset when the cluster hosting the namespace uses VSPHERE_NETWORK as its network provider, the namespace will automatically be associated with the cluster's Supervisor Primary Workload Network. The field currently accepts at most only 1 vSphere Namespaces network object reference. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.

classes.description: The Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec structure describes the configuration specification of a NSXT-backed Namespaces Network configuration.

attributes.name: namespace_network_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which Kubernetes allocates IP addresss for all workloads that attach to the namespace, including PodVMs, TKGS and VM Service VMs. This range should not overlap with those in Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. This field is required when Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.nsx-tier0-gateway or any of Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs are specified. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: ingress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses for Kubernetes Ingresses and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer. These ranges should not overlap with those in Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. This field is required when Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.nsx-tier0-gateway or any of Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs are specified. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: egress_cidrs
attributes.description: CIDR blocks from which NSX assigns IP addresses used for performing SNAT from container IPs to external IPs. These ranges should not overlap with those in Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs, or other services running in the datacenter. This field is required when Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.routed-mode is set to False and Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.nsx-tier0-gateway or any of Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.namespace-network-cidrs, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.ingress-cidrs is specified. When Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.routed-mode is set to True, this field is not allowed. An update operation only allows for addition of new CIDR blocks to the existing list.

attributes.name: nsx_tier0_gateway
attributes.description: NSX Tier0 Gateway used for this namespace. This field does not allow update once applied. If unset, cluster level settings specified in com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo#nsxTier0Gateway will be applied. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: NSXTier0Gateway. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: NSXTier0Gateway.

attributes.name: subnet_prefix_length
attributes.description: Size of the subnet reserved for namespace segments. If unset, cluster level settings specified in com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.Clusters.NCPClusterNetworkInfo#namespaceSubnetPrefix will be applied.

attributes.name: routed_mode
attributes.description: Routed mode for this namespace. When set to True, the traffic in the namespace is not NATed. If unset, defaults to False. When this field is set to True, Instances.NsxNetworkCreateSpec.egress-cidrs is not allowed. This field does not allow update once applied.

attributes.name: load_balancer_size
attributes.description: The size of the NSX Load Balancer used by the namespace. This field does not allow update once applied. If unset, defaults to SMALL.

Pods which are already using persistent storage from the earlier version of storage policies will be able to access them till the datastores are attached to the worker nodes.

attributes.name: storage_used

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespaces_namespace__self__service
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about Namespace Self Service of a specific cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.

methods.name: activate
methods.description: Activate Namespace Self Service on the cluster on which vSphere Namespaces enabled. This operation empowers Dev Users/Groups as self-service namespace users to create Supervisor Namespaces through kubectl create namespace command. activate requires the availability of one or more templates in the system. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.SelfServiceManage.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns basic information about Namespace Self Service on all clusters on which vSphere Namespaces are enabled on this vCenter. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Anonymous.

methods.name: deactivate
methods.description: Deactivate Namespace Self Service on the cluster on which vSphere Namespaces enabled. This operation reverses Dev Users/Group's self-service namespace capability on the cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires Namespaces.SelfServiceManage.

methods.name: activate_with_template
methods.description: Activate Namespace Self Service on the cluster after configuring namespace template. This is another variant of activate except configures template before activation. The template configuration includes either creating a new template or updating the existing template, depending on the template's existence. Here is supported the flow of actions using the activateWithTemplate call: 1. Activate with the new template using activateWithTemplate call. 2. Deactivate using deactivate call. 3. Active with updating the existing template using activateWithTemplate.

For an example of this, see ResourceQuotaOptionsV1.

The field must be left unset if the cluster hosting the namespace uses NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN as the network provider, since the network(s) for this namespace will be managed by NSX-T Container Plugin. If field is unset when the cluster hosting the namespace uses VSPHERE_NETWORK as its network provider, the namespace will automatically be associated with the cluster's Supervisor Primary Workload Network. The field currently accepts at most only 1 vSphere Namespaces network object reference. classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespaces_namespace__self__service_status
classes.description: The page describes the status of the namespace self-service on the cluster on which vSphere Namespaces enabled.

attributes.name: CONFIGURING
attributes.description: The configuration is being applied to the service.

attributes.name: RUNNING
attributes.description: The namespace self service is configured correctly. The expected transitions: 1. CONFIGURING --> RUNNING 2. RUNNING --> CONFIGURING. This transition occurs in the below scenarios: a. When different Dev Users/Groups are empowered with self-service namespace access. b. To reconcile the state of the cluster after the cluster upgrade.

attributes.name: REMOVING
attributes.description: The configuration is being removed and service is being deleted. The expected transitions: 1. CONFIGURING --> RUNNING --> REMOVING 2. CONFIGURING --> REMOVING

attributes.name: DEACTIVATED
attributes.description: The namespace self service is deactivated. This status also represents the initial status of the service before activation. The expected transitions after the service is activated: 1. CONFIGURING --> RUNNING --> REMOVING --> DEACTIVATED 2. CONFIGURING --> REMOVING --> DEACTIVATED

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: Failed to apply the configuration to the namespace self-service or unable to deactivate the namespace self-service, user intervention needed. The expected transitions: 1. CONFIGURING --> ERROR 2. CONFIGURING --> RUNNING --> ERROR 3. CONFIGURING --> RUNNING --> REMOVING --> ERROR 4. CONFIGURING --> REMOVING --> ERROR The Info.messages field captures the relevant error messages explaining this ERROR status.

methods.description: Updates a namespace template associated with a cluster on which vSphere Namespaces are enabled on this vCenter. The specified configuration is applied partially and unset fields in spec will leave those parts of configuration as-is. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.NamespaceTemplate referenced by the parameter template requires Namespaces.SelfServiceManage.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about all the namespace templates associated with a cluster on which vSphere Namespaces are enabled on this vCenter. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires System.Anonymous.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespaces_namespace__templates_create__spec
classes.description: The NamespaceTemplates.CreateSpec structure contains the specification required to create namespace template.

attributes.name: template
attributes.description: Name of the namespace template. The name is unique within the cluster. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

attributes.name: resource_spec
attributes.description: Resource quotas that this template defines. Resource quota on the namespace. Refer to com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NamespaceResourceOptions.Info#createResourceQuotaType and use com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.NamespaceResourceOptions#get for retrieving the type for the value for this field. For an example of this, see ResourceQuotaOptionsV1.

attributes.name: storage_specs
attributes.description: Storage that this template defines and will be associated with a namespace after namespace realization. This field should not be empty and at least one policy should be supplied. The {link create} throws {term InvalidArgument} exception if this field is set empty.

attributes.name: networks
attributes.description: vSphere Networks that this template captures and are associated with the namespace after namespace realization. vSphere Namespaces network objects to be associated with the namespace. The values of this list need to reference names of pre-existing Networks.Info structures. The field must be left unset if the cluster hosting the namespace uses NSXT_CONTAINER_PLUGIN as the network provider, since the network(s) for this namespace will be managed by NSX-T Container Plugin. If field is unset when the cluster hosting the namespace uses VSPHERE_NETWORK as its network provider, the namespace will automatically be associated with the cluster's Supervisor Primary Workload Network. The field currently accepts at most only 1 vSphere Namespaces network object reference. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

attributes.name: permissions
attributes.description: Permissions associated with namespace template. If unset, only users with the Administrator role can use this template; for example, this template is applied to the namespace created by self-service-users with the Administrator role.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespaces_resource__quota__options__v1
classes.description: The ResourceQuotaOptionsV1 structure represents the resource quota limits which can be applied on the namespace. Refer to for information related to the properties of this object and what they map to.

attributes.name: memory_limit
attributes.description: This is equivalent to 'limits.memory' option which is the maximum memory limit (in mebibytes) across all pods which exist in a non-terminal state in the namespace. This value translates to the memory limit on the ResourcePool in vCenter Server created for the namespace. If unset, no memory limits are set on the ResourcePool for the namespace.

attributes.name: memory_limit_default
attributes.description: This represents the default memory limit (in mebibytes) for containers in the pod. This translates to default memory limit in a LimitRange object. Refer for information about LimitRange. If unset, no default memory limits are set on containers in the pod.

attributes.name: memory_request_default
attributes.description: This represents the default memory request (in mebibytes) for containers in the pod. This translates to default memory request in a LimitRange object. Refer for information about LimitRange. If unset, no default memory requests are set on containers in the pod.

attributes.name: cpu_limit
attributes.description: This is equivalent to 'limits.cpu' option which is the maximum CPU limit (in MHz) across all pods which exist in a non-terminal state in the namespace. If specified, this limit should be at least 10 MHz. This value translates to the CPU limit on the ResourcePool in vCenter Server created for the namespace. If unset, no CPU limits are set on the ResourcePool for the namespace.

attributes.name: cpu_limit_default
attributes.description: This represents the default cpu limit (in MHz) for containers in the pod. If unset, no default CPU limits are set on containers in the pod. Refer for information about LimitRange. If specified, this limit should be at least 10 MHz.

attributes.name: cpu_request_default
attributes.description: This represents the default CPU request (in MHz) for containers in the pod. If unset, no default CPU requests are set on containers in the pod. Refer for information about LimitRange. If specified, this field should be at least 10 MHz.

attributes.name: storage_request_limit
attributes.description: This represents 'requests.storage' option which is the maximum storage request (in mebibytes) across all persistent volume claims from pods which exist in a non-terminal state in the namespace. If unset, no storage request limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: pod_count
attributes.description: This represents 'pods' option which is the maximum number of pods which exist in a non-terminal state in the namespace. If unset, no pod limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: service_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/services' option which is the maximum number of services in the namespace. If unset, no service limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: deployment_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/deployments.apps' option which is the maximum number of deployments in the namespace. If unset, no deployment limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: daemon_set_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/daemonsets.apps' option which is the maximum number of DaemonSets in the namespace. If unset, no daemonset limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: replica_set_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/replicasets.apps' option which is the maximum number of ReplicaSets in the namespace. If unset, no replicaset limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: replication_controller_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/replicationcontrollers' option which is the maximum number of ReplicationControllers in the namespace. If unset, no replicationcontroller limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: stateful_set_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/statefulsets.apps' option which is the maximum number of StatefulSets in the namespace. If unset, no statefulset limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: config_map_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/configmaps' option which is the maximum number of ConfigMaps in the namespace. If unset, no configmap limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: secret_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/secrets' option which is the maximum number of secrets in the namespace. If unset, no secret limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: persistent_volume_claim_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/persistentvolumeclaims' option which is the maximum number of PersistentVolumeClaims in the namespace. If unset, no persistentvolumeclaim limits are set on the namespace.

attributes.name: job_count
attributes.description: This represents 'count/jobs.batch' option which is the maximum number jobs in the namespace. If unset, no job limits are set on the namespace.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_namespaces_resource__quota__options__v1__update
classes.description: The ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update structure represents the changes to resource quota limits which are set on the namespace. Refer to <\a> Kubernetes Resource Quota for information related to the properties of this object and what they map to.

attributes.name: memory_limit
attributes.description: This represents the new value for 'limits.memory' option which is equivalent to the maximum memory limit (in mebibytes) across all pods in the namespace. This field is ignored if ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update.memory-limit-unset is set to true. If unset, the existing memory limit on the ResourcePool will be unchanged if ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update.memory-limit-unset is unset or set to false.

attributes.name: memory_limit_unset
attributes.description: This represents the intent of the change to ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update.memory-limit. If this field is set to true, the existing memory limit on the ResourcePool is removed. If this field is set to false, the existing memory limit will be changed to the value specified in ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update.memory-limit, if any. If unset, the existing memory limit will be changed to the value specified in ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update.memory-limit, if any.

attributes.name: memory_limit_default

If unset, the existing memory limit will be unchanged if ResourceQuotaOptionsV1Update.memory-limit-default-unset is unset or set to false.

When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.

attributes.name: master_host
attributes.description: IP address or FQDN of the API endpoint for the given namespace.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_network
classes.description: The {@term Network} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for manipulating a vCenter Server network.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_network
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) networks in vCenter matching the {@link FilterSpec}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_network_filter__spec
classes.description: The {@name FilterSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} used to filter the results when listing networks (see {@link #list}). If multiple {@term fields} are specified, only networks matching all of the {@term fields} match the filter.

attributes.name: networks
attributes.description: Identifiers of networks that can match the filter.

attributes.name: names
attributes.description: Names that networks must have to match the filter (see {@link Summary#name}).

attributes.name: types
attributes.description: Types that networks must have to match the filter (see {@link Summary#type}).

attributes.name: folders
attributes.description: Folders that must contain the network for the network to match the filter.

attributes.name: datacenters
attributes.description: Datacenters that must contain the network for the network to match the filter.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_network_summary
classes.description: The {@name Summary} {@term structure} contains commonly used information about a network.

attributes.name: network
attributes.description: Identifier of the network.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the network.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type ({@enum.values Type}) of the vCenter Server network.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_network_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of a vCenter Server network. The type of a network can be used to determine what features it supports and which APIs can be used to find more information about the network or change its configuration.

attributes.name: STANDARD_PORTGROUP
attributes.description: XXX: ESX based (created and managed on ESX)

attributes.name: DISTRIBUTED_PORTGROUP
attributes.description: XXX: vCenter based (create and managed through vCenter)

attributes.name: OPAQUE_NETWORK
attributes.description: A network for whose configuration is managed outside of vSphere. The identifer and name of the network is made available through vSphere so that host and virtual machine virtual ethernet devices can connect to them.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_capability

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_capability

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_capability_capability__info

attributes.name: import_ova

attributes.name: export_ova

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_certificate__params

attributes.name: subject

attributes.name: is_valid
attributes.description: Is the certificate chain validated.

attributes.name: is_self_signed
attributes.description: Is the certificate self-signed.

attributes.name: x509
attributes.description: The X509 representation of the certificate.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_datastore__disk__group
classes.description: The {@name DatastoreDiskGroup} {@term structure} contains information about a storage disk group described in the OVF package.

attributes.name: id

attributes.name: name

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of the disk group.

attributes.name: target_profile
attributes.description: The identifier of the storage profile to place this disk group on.

attributes.name: target_datastore

attributes.name: target_provisioning_type
attributes.description: The target provisioning type.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_datastore__mapping__params
classes.description: The {@name DatastoreMappingParams} {@term structure} contains information about the mapping from OVF storage groups to specific storage targets supported on the target platform.

attributes.name: available_storage_profiles

attributes.name: storage_profiles_enabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the storage profiles are enabled for the target.

attributes.name: available_disk_provisioning_types
attributes.description: Disk provisioning types available in the target platform.

attributes.name: target_profile
attributes.description: Identifier of the storage profile to use for the deployed virtual machine or virtual appliance.

attributes.name: target_datastore
attributes.description: Specifies the identifier of the datastore or datastore cluster the deployment should use.

attributes.name: target_provisioning_type
attributes.description: Specifies which disk provisioning type the deployment should use.

attributes.name: disk_groups
attributes.description: Information about disk groups.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_datastore__target
classes.description: The {@name DatastoreTarget} {@term structure} contains information about a datastore or datastore cluster in the target deployment environment.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The identifier of the datastore or datastore cluster.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the datastore or datastore cluster.

attributes.name: storage_profiles
attributes.description: The identifiers of the storage profiles this datastore or datastore cluster is part of.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_datastore__target_inaccessible__reason
classes.description: The {@name InaccessibleReason} {@term enumerated type} defines the reasons why a datastore can be inaccessible.

attributes.name: NOT_CONNECTED
attributes.description: The datastore is not connected.

attributes.name: MAINTENANCE_MODE
attributes.description: The datastore is in maintenance mode.

attributes.name: READ_ONLY
attributes.description: The datastore is mounted read-only.

attributes.name: NO_ALLOCATE_RIGHT
attributes.description: The current logged on user does not have Datastore.AllocateSpace privilege which is required to allocate to the datastore.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_deployment__option
classes.description: The {@name DeploymentOption} {@term structure} contains the information about a deployment option as defined in the OVF specification.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: The key of the deployment option, corresponding to the ovf:id attribute in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: A localizable label for the deployment option.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: A localizable description for the deployment option.

attributes.name: default_choice
attributes.description: A {@term boolean} flag indicates whether this deployment option is the default choice.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_deployment__option__params
classes.description: The {@name DeploymentOptionParams} {@term structure} describes the possible deployment options as well as the choice provided by the user.

attributes.name: deployment_options
attributes.description: {@term List} of deployment options. This {@term field} corresponds to the ovf:Configuration elements of the ovf:DeploymentOptionSection in the specification. It is a discrete set of intended resource allocation configurations from which one can be selected.

attributes.name: selected_key
attributes.description: The selected deployment option. Identifies the {@link DeploymentOption} in the list in the {@name #deploymentOptions} {@term field} with a matching value in the {@link DeploymentOption#key} {@term field}.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_disk__provisioning__type
classes.description: The {@name DiskProvisioningType} {@term enumerated type} defines the virtual disk provisioning types that can be set for a disk on the target platform.

attributes.name: thin
attributes.description: A thin provisioned virtual disk has space allocated and zeroed on demand as the space is used.

attributes.name: thick
attributes.description: A thick provisioned virtual disk has all space allocated at creation time and the space is zeroed on demand as the space is used.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_eula__params
classes.description: The {@name EulaParams} {@term structure} includes a {@term list} of end user licence agreements (EULAs) included in the OVF package.

attributes.name: eulas
attributes.description: {@term List} of EULAs in the OVF package.

attributes.name: all_EULA_accepted
attributes.description: If EULAs are provided, this must be set to true during deployment.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_export__flag
classes.description: The {@name ExportFlag} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for retrieving information about the export flags supported by the server. Export flags can be specified in a {@link LibraryItem.CreateSpec} to customize an OVF export.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_export__flag
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about the supported export flags by the server. The supported flags are: PRESERVE_MAC Include MAC addresses for network adapters. EXTRA_CONFIG Include extra configuration in OVF export. Future server versions might support additional flags.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_export__flag_info
classes.description: The {@name Info} {@term structure} describes an export flag supported by the server.

attributes.name: option
attributes.description: The name of the export flag that is supported by the server.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Localizable description of the export flag.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_extra__config
classes.description: The {@name ExtraConfig} {@term structure} contains the information about a vmw:ExtraConfig element which can be used to specify configuration settings that are transferred directly to the .vmx file. The behavior of the vmw:ExtraConfig element is similar to the extraConfig property of the VirtualMachineConfigSpec object in the VMware vSphere API. Thus, the same restrictions apply, such as you cannot set values that could otherwise be set with other properties in the VirtualMachineConfigSpec object. See the VMware vSphere API reference for details on this.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: The key of the ExtraConfig element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the ExtraConfig element.

attributes.name: virtual_system_id
attributes.description: The identifier of the virtual system containing the vmw:ExtraConfig element.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_extra__config__params
classes.description: The {@name ExtraConfigParams} {@term structure} contains the parameters with information about the vmw:ExtraConfig elements in an OVF package.

attributes.name: extra_configs
attributes.description: {@term List} of vmw:ExtraConfig elements in the OVF package.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_import__flag
classes.description: The {@name ImportFlag} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for retrieving information about the import flags supported by the deployment platform. Import flags can be specified in a {@link LibraryItem.ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec} to customize an OVF deployment.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_import__flag
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about the import flags supported by the deployment platform. The supported flags are: LAX Lax mode parsing of the OVF descriptor. Future server versions might support additional flags.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_import__flag_info
classes.description: The {@name Info} {@term structure} describes an import flag supported by the deployment platform.

attributes.name: option
attributes.description: The name of the import flag that is supported by the deployment platform.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Localizable description of the import flag.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_ip__allocation__params
classes.description: The {@name IpAllocationParams} {@term structure} specifies how IP addresses are allocated to OVF properties. In particular, it informs the deployment platform whether the guest supports IPv4, IPv6, or both. It also specifies whether the IP addresses can be obtained through DHCP or through the properties provided in the OVF environment.

attributes.name: supported_allocation_scheme
attributes.description: Specifies the IP allocation schemes supported by the guest software. This {@term field} defines the valid values for the IP allocation policy. This setting is often configured by the virtual appliance template author or OVF package author to reflect what the guest software supports, and the IP allocation policy is configured at deployment time. See {@link #ipAllocationPolicy}.

attributes.name: supported_ip_allocation_policy
attributes.description: Specifies the IP allocation policies supported. The set of valid options for the policy is based on the capabilities of the virtual appliance software, as specified by the {@link #supportedAllocationScheme} {@term field}.

attributes.name: ip_allocation_policy
attributes.description: Specifies how IP allocation is done through an IP Pool. This is typically specified by the deployer.

attributes.name: supported_ip_protocol
attributes.description: Specifies the IP protocols supported by the guest.

attributes.name: ip_protocol
attributes.description: Specifies the chosen IP protocol for this deployment. This must be one of the IP protocols supported by the guest software. See {@link #supportedIpProtocol}.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_ip__allocation__params_ip__allocation__policy
classes.description: The {@name IpAllocationPolicy} {@term enumerated type} defines the possible IP allocation policy for a deployment.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: Specifies that DHCP will be used to allocate IP addresses.

attributes.name: TRANSIENT_IPPOOL
attributes.description: Specifies that IP addresses are allocated from an IP pool. The IP addresses are allocated when needed, typically at power-on, and deallocated during power-off. There is no guarantee that a property will receive same IP address when restarted.

attributes.name: STATIC_MANUAL
attributes.description: Specifies that IP addresses are configured manually upon deployment, and will be kept until reconfigured or the virtual appliance destroyed. This ensures that a property gets a consistent IP for its lifetime.

attributes.name: STATIC_IPPOOL
attributes.description: Specifies that IP addresses are allocated from the range managed by an IP pool. The IP addresses are allocated at first power-on, and remain allocated at power-off. This ensures that a virtual appliance gets a consistent IP for its life-time.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_ip__allocation__params_ip__allocation__scheme
classes.description: The {@name IpAllocationScheme} {@term enumerated type} defines the possible IP allocation schemes that can be supported by the guest software.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: It supports DHCP to acquire IP configuration.

attributes.name: OVF_ENVIRONMENT
attributes.description: It supports setting the IP configuration through the properties provided in the OVF environment.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_ip__allocation__params_ip__protocol
classes.description: The {@name IpProtocol} {@term enumerated type} defines the IP protocols supported by the guest software.

attributes.name: IPV4
attributes.description: It supports the IPv4 protocol.

attributes.name: IPV6
attributes.description: It supports the IPv6 protocol.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item
classes.description: The {@name LibraryItem} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to deploy virtual machines and virtual appliances from library items containing Open Virtualization Format (OVF) packages in content library, as well as {@term operations} to create library items in content library from virtual machines and virtual appliances.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Queries an OVF package stored in content library to retrieve information to use when deploying the package. See {@link #deploy}. This {@term operation} retrieves information from the descriptor of the OVF package stored in the library item specified by {@param.name ovfLibraryItemId}. The information returned by the {@term operation} can be used to populate the deployment specification (see {@link ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec} when deploying the OVF package to the deployment target specified by {@param.name target}.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a library item in content library from a virtual machine or virtual appliance. This {@term operation} creates a library item in content library whose content is an OVF package derived from a source virtual machine or virtual appliance, using the supplied create specification. The OVF package may be stored as in a newly created library item or in an in an existing library item. For an existing library item whose content is updated by this {@term operation}, the original content is overwritten.

methods.name: deploy
methods.description: Deploys an OVF package stored in content library to a newly created virtual machine or virtual appliance. This {@term operation} deploys an OVF package which is stored in the library item specified by {@param.name ovfLibraryItemId}. It uses the deployment specification in {@param.name deploymentSpec} to deploy the OVF package to the location specified by {@param.name target}.
methods.parameters: client_token: string, ovf_library_item_id: string, target: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_deployment__target, deployment_spec: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_resource__pool__deployment__spec

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_create__result
classes.description: The {@name CreateResult} {@term structure} defines the result of the {@name #create} {@term operation}. See {@link #create}.

attributes.name: succeeded
attributes.description: Whether the {@name LibraryItem#create} {@term operation} completed successfully.

attributes.name: ovf_library_item_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the created or updated library item.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Errors, warnings, and informational messages produced by the {@name LibraryItem#create} {@term operation}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_create__spec
classes.description: The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} defines the information used to create or update a library item containing an OVF package.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name to use in the OVF descriptor stored in the library item.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description to use in the OVF descriptor stored in the library item.

attributes.name: flags
attributes.description: Flags to use for OVF package creation. The supported flags can be obtained using {@link ExportFlag#list}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_create__target
classes.description: The {@name CreateTarget} {@term structure} specifies the target library item when capturing a virtual machine or virtual appliance as an OVF package in a library item in a content library. The target can be an existing library item, which will be updated, creating a new version, or it can be a newly created library item in a specified library. See {@link #create}.

attributes.name: library_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the library in which a new library item should be created. This {@term field} is not used if the {@name #libraryItemId} {@term field} is specified.

attributes.name: library_item_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the library item that should be should be updated.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_deployable__identity
classes.description: The {@name DeployableIdentity} {@term structure} describes the resource created by a deployment, or the source resource from which library item can be created, by specifying its resource type and resource identifier.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the deployable resource.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifier of the deployable resource.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_deployment__result
classes.description: The {@name DeploymentResult} {@term structure} defines the result of the {@name #deploy} {@term operation}. See {@link #deploy}.

attributes.name: succeeded
attributes.description: Whether the {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation} completed successfully.

attributes.name: resource_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the deployed resource entity.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Errors, warnings, and informational messages produced by the {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_deployment__target
classes.description: The {@name DeploymentTarget} {@term structure} describes the location (target) where a virtual machine or virtual appliance should be deployed. It is used in the {@name #deploy} and {@name #filter} {@term operations}. See {@link #deploy} and {@link #filter}.

attributes.name: resource_pool_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the resource pool to which the virtual machine or virtual appliance should be attached.

attributes.name: host_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the target host on which the virtual machine or virtual appliance will run. The target host must be a member of the cluster that contains the resource pool identified by {@link #resourcePoolId}.

attributes.name: folder_id
attributes.description: Identifier of the vCenter folder that should contain the virtual machine or virtual appliance. The folder must be virtual machine folder.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_ovf__summary
classes.description: The {@name OvfSummary} {@term structure} defines the result of the {@name #filter} {@term operation}. See {@link #filter}. The {@term fields} in the {@term structure} describe parameterizable information in the OVF descriptor, with respect to a deployment target, for the {@name #deploy} {@term operation}. See {@link #deploy}.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Default name for the virtual machine or virtual appliance.

attributes.name: annotation
attributes.description: Default annotation for the virtual machine or virtual appliance.

attributes.name: EULAs
attributes.description: End User License Agreements specified in the OVF descriptor. All end user license agreements must be accepted in order for the {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation} to succeed. See {@link ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec#acceptAllEula}.

attributes.name: networks
attributes.description: Section identifiers for sections of type ovf:NetworkSection in the OVF descriptor. These identifiers can be used as keys in {@link ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec#networkMappings}.

attributes.name: storage_groups
attributes.description: Section identifiers for sections of type vmw:StorageGroupSection in the OVF descriptor. These identifiers can be used as keys in {@link ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec#storageMappings}.

attributes.name: additional_params
attributes.description: Additional OVF parameters which can be specified for the deployment target. These OVF parameters can be inspected, optionally modified, and used as values in {@link ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec#additionalParameters} for the {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_resource__pool__deployment__spec
classes.description: The {@name ResourcePoolDeploymentSpec} {@term structure} defines the deployment parameters that can be specified for the {@name #deploy} {@term operation} where the deployment target is a resource pool. See {@link #deploy}.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name assigned to the deployed target virtual machine or virtual appliance.

attributes.name: annotation
attributes.description: Annotation assigned to the deployed target virtual machine or virtual appliance.

attributes.name: accept_all_EULA
attributes.description: Whether to accept all End User License Agreements. See {@link OvfSummary#eulas}.

attributes.name: network_mappings
attributes.description: Specification of the target network to use for sections of type ovf:NetworkSection in the OVF descriptor. The key in the {@term map} is the section identifier of the ovf:NetworkSection section in the OVF descriptor and the value is the target network to be used for deployment.

attributes.name: storage_mappings
attributes.description: Specification of the target storage to use for sections of type vmw:StorageGroupSection in the OVF descriptor. The key in the {@term map} is the section identifier of the ovf:StorageGroupSection section in the OVF descriptor and the value is the target storage specification to be used for deployment. See {@link StorageGroupMapping}.

attributes.name: storage_provisioning
attributes.description: Default storage provisioning type to use for all sections of type vmw:StorageSection in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: storage_profile_id
attributes.description: Default storage profile to use for all sections of type vmw:StorageSection in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use for parsing the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: flags
attributes.description: Flags to be use for deployment. The supported flag values can be obtained using {@link ImportFlag#list}.

attributes.name: default_datastore_id
attributes.description: Default datastore to use for all sections of type vmw:StorageSection in the OVF descriptor.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_result__info
classes.description: The {@name ResultInfo} {@term structure} defines the information returned along with the result of a {@name #create} or {@name #deploy} {@term operation} to describe errors, warnings, and informational messages produced by the server.

attributes.name: errors
attributes.description: Errors reported by the {@name LibraryItem#create} or {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation}. These errors would have prevented the {@name LibraryItem#create} or {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation} from completing successfully.

attributes.name: warnings
attributes.description: Warnings reported by the {@name LibraryItem#create} or {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation}. These warnings would not have prevented the {@name LibraryItem#create} or {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation} from completing successfully, but there might be issues that warrant attention.

attributes.name: information
attributes.description: Information messages reported by the {@name LibraryItem#create} or {@name LibraryItem#deploy} {@term operation}. For example, a non-required parameter was ignored.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_storage__group__mapping
classes.description: The {@name StorageGroupMapping} {@term structure} defines the storage deployment target and storage provisioning type for a section of type vmw:StorageGroupSection in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of storage deployment target to use for the vmw:StorageGroupSection section. The specified value must be {@link Type#DATASTORE} or {@link Type#STORAGE_PROFILE}.

attributes.name: datastore_id
attributes.description: Target datastore to be used for the storage group.

attributes.name: storage_profile_id
attributes.description: Target storage profile to be used for the storage group.

attributes.name: provisioning
attributes.description: Target provisioning type to use for the storage group.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_library__item_storage__group__mapping_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the supported types of storage targets for sections of type vmw:StorageGroupSection in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: DATASTORE
attributes.description: Storage deployment target is a datastore.

attributes.name: STORAGE_PROFILE
attributes.description: Storage deployment target is a storage profile.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_name__and__product__params
classes.description: The {@name NameAndProductParams} {@term structure} contains name, description, and product information about an OVF package. The information in this package is derived from the ovf:AnnotationSection, ovf:ProductSection, and the name/id information on the root content type.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the OVF package.

attributes.name: annotation
attributes.description: The annotation for the OVF package.

attributes.name: virtual_app
attributes.description: Whether or not the OVF package contains a virtual appliance. If true, the OVF package contains a virtual appliance (containing one or more virtual appliances and/or virtual machines), otherwise it contains a single virtual machine.

attributes.name: product_name
attributes.description: Name of the product.

attributes.name: vendor
attributes.description: Vendor of the product.

attributes.name: version
attributes.description: Short version of the product, for example, 1.0.

attributes.name: full_version
attributes.description: Full-version of the product, for example, 1.0-build 12323.

attributes.name: vendor_url
attributes.description: URL to vendor homepage.

attributes.name: product_url
attributes.description: URL to product homepage.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_network__mapping__params
classes.description: The {@name NetworkMappingParams} {@term structure} specifies how source networks in the OVF package are mapped to target networks in the deployment environment. A mapping must be provided for each source network or the deployment will fail.

attributes.name: source_networks
attributes.description: Name of networks in OVF descriptor with descriptions. As a create parameter, this is also specifying the chosen mapping.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Unique identifier describing the type of the OVF parameters. The value is the name of the OVF parameters {@term structure}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_ovf__error
classes.description: The {@name OvfError} {@term structure} describes an error related to accessing, validating, deploying, or exporting an OVF package.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: The message category.

attributes.name: issues
attributes.description: {@term List} of parse issues (see {@link ParseIssue}).

attributes.name: name

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_parse__issue
classes.description: The {@name ParseIssue} {@term structure} contains the information about the issue found when parsing an OVF package during deployment or exporting an OVF package including:

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: The category of the parse issue.

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: The name of the file in which the parse issue was found.

attributes.name: line_number
attributes.description: The line number of the line in the file (see {@link #file}) where the parse issue was found (or -1 if not applicable).

attributes.name: column_number
attributes.description: The position in the line (see {@link #lineNumber}) (or -1 if not applicable).

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: A localizable message describing the parse issue.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_ovf_parse__issue_category
classes.description: The {@name Category} {@term enumerated type} defines the categories of issues that can be found when parsing files inside an OVF package (see {@link ParseIssue}) including OVF descriptor (which is an XML document), manifest and certificate files, or exporting an OVF package.

attributes.name: VALUE_ILLEGAL
attributes.description: Illegal value error. For example, the value is malformed, not a number, or outside of the given range, and so on.

attributes.name: ATTRIBUTE_REQUIRED
attributes.description: Required attribute error. It indicates that a required attribute is missing from an element in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: ATTRIBUTE_ILLEGAL
attributes.description: Illegal attribute error. It indicates that an illegal attribute is set for an element in the OVF descriptor. For example, empty disks do not use format, parentRef, and populatedSize attributes, if these attributes are present in an empty disk element then will get this pasrse issue.

attributes.name: ELEMENT_REQUIRED
attributes.description: Required element error. It indicates that a required element is missing from the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: ELEMENT_ILLEGAL
attributes.description: Illegal element error. It indicates that an element is present in a location which is not allowed, or found multiple elements but only one is allowed at the location in the OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: ELEMENT_UNKNOWN
attributes.description: Unknown element error. It indicates that an element is unsupported when parsing an OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: SECTION_UNKNOWN
attributes.description: Section unknown error. It indicates that a section is unsupported when parsing an OVF descriptor.

attributes.name: SECTION_RESTRICTION
attributes.description: Section restriction error. It indicates that a section appears in place in the OVF descriptor where it is not allowed, a section appears fewer times than is required, or a section appears more times than is allowed.

attributes.name: GENERATE_ERROR
attributes.description: OVF descriptor (which is an XML document) generating error, for example, well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.

attributes.name: VALIDATION_ERROR
attributes.description: An issue with the manifest and signing.

attributes.name: EXPORT_ERROR
attributes.description: Issue during OVF export, for example, malformed deviceId, controller not found, or file backing for a device not found.

attributes.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
attributes.description: Server encountered an unexpected error which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool
classes.description: The {@term ResourcePool} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for manipulating a vCenter Server resource pool.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get

methods.name: list
