classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_create__spec
classes.description: The #CreateSpec structure contains information used to create a resource pool, see ResourcePool.create.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the resource pool.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.description: Parent of the created resource pool. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool.

attributes.name: cpu_allocation
attributes.description: Resource allocation for CPU. if unset or empty, use the default CPU allocation specification.

attributes.name: memory_allocation
attributes.description: Resource allocation for memory. if unset or empty, use the default memory allocation specification.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_filter__spec
classes.description: The {@name FilterSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} used to filter the results when listing resource pools (see {@link #list}). If multiple {@term fields} are specified, only resource pools matching all of the {@term fields} match the filter.

attributes.name: resource_pools
attributes.description: Identifiers of resource pools that can match the filter.

attributes.name: names
attributes.description: Names that resource pools must have to match the filter (see {@link Info#name}).

attributes.name: parent_resource_pools
attributes.description: Resource pools that must contain the resource pool for the resource pool to match the filter.

attributes.name: datacenters
attributes.description: Datacenters that must contain the resource pool for the resource pool to match the filter.

attributes.name: hosts
attributes.description: Hosts that must contain the resource pool for the resource pool to match the filter.

attributes.name: clusters
attributes.description: Clusters that must contain the resource pool for the resource pool to match the filter.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_info
classes.description: The {@name Info} {@term structure} contains information about a resource pool.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the vCenter Server resource pool.

attributes.name: resource_pools
attributes.description: Identifiers of the child resource pools contained in this resource pool.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_resource__allocation__create__spec
classes.description: The ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationCreateSpec structure contains resource allocation information used to create a resource pool, see ResourcePool.create.

attributes.name: reservation
attributes.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to a resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are MB fo memory, and MHz for CPU. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationCreateSpec.reservation will be set to 0.

attributes.name: expandable_reservation
attributes.description: In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationCreateSpec.expandable-reservation will be set to true.

attributes.name: limit
attributes.description: The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Units are MB for memory, and MHz for CPU. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationCreateSpec.limit will be set to -1.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: Shares are used in case of resource contention. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationCreateSpec.shares will be set to 'NORMAL'.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_resource__allocation__info
classes.description: The ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationInfo structure contains resource allocation information of a resource pool.

attributes.name: reservation
attributes.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to a resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are MB fo memory, and MHz for CPU.

attributes.name: expandable_reservation
attributes.description: In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation.

attributes.name: limit
attributes.description: The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Units are MB for memory, and MHz for CPU.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: Shares are used in case of resource contention.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_resource__allocation__update__spec
classes.description: The structure descrives the updates to be made to the resource allocation settings of a resource pool.

attributes.name: reservation
attributes.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to a resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are MB fo memory, and MHz for CPU. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationUpdateSpec.reservation will be set to 0.

attributes.name: expandable_reservation
attributes.description: In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationUpdateSpec.expandable-reservation will be set to true.

attributes.name: limit
attributes.description: The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Units are MB for memory, and MHz for CPU. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationUpdateSpec.limit will be set to -1.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: Shares are used in case of resource contention. If unset or empty, ResourcePool.ResourceAllocationUpdateSpec.shares will be set to 'NORMAL'.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_shares__info
classes.description: The ResourcePool.SharesInfo structure provides specification of shares. Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers. In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the resource, subject to certain other constraints.

attributes.name: level
attributes.description: The allocation level. It maps to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as CUSTOM.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: When ResourcePool.SharesInfo.level is set to CUSTOM, it is the number of shares allocated. Otherwise, this value is ignored. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools. This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of ResourcePool.SharesInfo.level is CUSTOM.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_shares__info_level
classes.description: The ResourcePool.SharesInfo.Level enumerated type defines the possible values for the allocation level.

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: For CPU: Shares = 500 * number of virtual CPUs. For Memory: Shares = 5 * virtual machine memory size in MB.

attributes.name: NORMAL
attributes.description: For CPU: Shares = 1000 * number of virtual CPUs. For Memory: Shares = 10 * virtual machine memory size in MB.

attributes.name: HIGH
attributes.description: For CPU: Shares = 2000 * number of virtual CPUs. For Memory: Shares = 20 * virtual machine memory size in MB.

attributes.name: CUSTOM
attributes.description: If set, in case there is resource contention the server uses the shares value to determine the resource allocation.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_resource__pool_summary

attributes.description: Identifier of the resource pool.

attributes.description: Name of the resource pool. if unset or empty, the name of the resource pool will not be changed.

attributes.name: cpu_allocation
attributes.description: Resource allocation for CPU. if unset or empty, the CPU allocation of the resource pool will not be changed.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tagging_associations
classes.description: The Associations service provides operations to list tag associations.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tagging_associations
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns tag associations that match the specified iteration spec.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tagging_associations_iteration__spec
classes.description: The Associations.IterationSpec structure contains fields used to break results into pages when listing tags associated to objects see Associations.list).

attributes.name: marker
attributes.description: Marker is an opaque token that allows the caller to request the next page of tag associations. If unset or empty, first page of tag associations will be returned. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.tagging.associations.Marker. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.tagging.associations.Marker.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tagging_associations_last__iteration__status
classes.description: The last status for the iterator. A field of this type is returned as part of the result and indicates to the caller of the API whether it can continue to make requests for more data. The last status only reports on the state of the iteration at the time data was last returned. As a result, it not does guarantee if the next call will succeed in getting more data or not. Failures to retrieve results will be returned as Error responses. These last statuses are only returned when the iterator is operating as expected.

attributes.name: READY
attributes.description: Iterator has more data pending and is ready to provide it. The caller can request the next page of data at any time. The number of results returned may be less than the usual size. In other words, the iterator may not fill the page. The iterator has returned at least 1 result.

attributes.name: END_OF_DATA
attributes.description: Iterator has finished iterating through its inventory. There are currently no more entities to return and the caller can terminate iteration. If the iterator returned some data, the marker may be set to allow the iterator to continue from where it left off when additional data does become available. This value is used to indicate that all available data has been returned by the iterator.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tagging_associations_list__result
classes.description: The Associations.ListResult structure contains the list of tag associations in a page, as well as related metadata fields.

attributes.name: associations
attributes.description: List of tag associations.

attributes.name: marker
attributes.description: Marker is an opaque data structure that allows the caller to request the next page of tag associations. If unset or empty, there are no more tag associations to request. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.tagging.associations.Marker. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.tagging.associations.Marker.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The last status for the iterator that indicates whether any more results can be expected if the caller continues to make requests for more data using the iterator.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tagging_associations_summary
classes.description: The Associations.Summary describes a tag association.

attributes.name: tag
attributes.description: The identifier of a tag. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.tagging.Tag.

attributes.name: object
attributes.description: The identifier of an associated object.

classes.description: The {@name Error} {@term error} describes the{@term fields} common to all standard {@term errors}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_invalid__grant
classes.description: The {@name InvalidGrant} {@term error} indicates that provided authorization grant (e.g., authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_invalid__request
classes.description: The {@name InvalidRequest} {@term error} indicates that {@link TokenExchange.ExchangeSpec} is missing a required parameter, includes an unsupported parameter value (other than {@link TokenExchange.ExchangeSpec#grant_type})

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_invalid__scope
classes.description: The {@name InvalidScope} {@term error} indicates requested scope is invalid, unknown, malformed, or exceeds the scope granted by the resource owner.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_token__exchange
classes.description: The {@name TokenExchange} {@term interface} provides possibility to exchange between different tokens types. Implementation of "OAuth 2.0 Token Exchange" standard (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-token-exchange-12).

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_token__exchange
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: exchange
methods.description: Exchanges incoming token based on the spec and current client authorization data. This {@term operation} has been deprecated in the vSphere 7.0 U2 release. Use {@code com.vmware.vcenter.authentication.Token#issue} instead.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_token__exchange_exchange__spec
classes.description: The {@name ExchangeSpec} {@term structure} contains arguments required for token exchange.

attributes.name: grant_type
attributes.description: The value of {@link TokenExchange#TOKEN_EXCHANGE_GRANT} indicates that a token exchange is being performed.

attributes.name: resource
attributes.description: Indicates the location of the target service or resource where the client intends to use the requested security token.

attributes.name: audience
attributes.description: The logical name of the target service where the client intends to use the requested security token. This serves a purpose similar to the {@link ExchangeSpec#resource} parameter, but with the client providing a logical name rather than a location.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: A list of space-delimited, case-sensitive strings, that allow the client to specify the desired scope of the requested security token in the context of the service or resource where the token will be used.

attributes.name: requested_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier for the type of the requested security token. If the requested type is unspecified, the issued token type is at the discretion of the server and may be dictated by knowledge of the requirements of the service or resource indicated by the {@link ExchangeSpec#resource} or {@link ExchangeSpec#audience} parameter.

attributes.name: subject_token
attributes.description: A security token that represents the identity of the party on behalf of whom exchange is being made. Typically, the subject of this token will be the subject of the security token issued. Token is base64-encoded.

attributes.name: subject_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier, that indicates the type of the security token in the {@link ExchangeSpec#subject_token} parameter.

attributes.name: actor_token
attributes.description: A security token that represents the identity of the acting party. Typically, this will be the party that is authorized to use the requested security token and act on behalf of the subject.

attributes.name: actor_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier, that indicates the type of the security token in the {@link ExchangeSpec#actor_token} parameter.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_tokenservice_token__exchange_info
classes.description: The {@name Info} {@term structure} contains data that represents successful token exchange response.

attributes.name: access_token
attributes.description: The security token issued by the server in response to the token exchange request. Token is base64-encoded.

attributes.name: issued_token_type
attributes.description: An identifier, that indicates the type of the security token in the {@link Info#access_token} parameter.

attributes.name: token_type
attributes.description: A case-insensitive value specifying the method of using the access token issued.

attributes.name: expires_in
attributes.description: The validity lifetime, in seconds, of the token issued by the server.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: Scope of the issued security token.

attributes.name: refresh_token
attributes.description: A refresh token can be issued in cases where the client of the token exchange needs the ability to access a resource even when the original credential is no longer valid.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trust__authority__clusters_attestation_tpm2_ca__certificates
classes.description: The CaCertificates service provides operations to manage Trusted Platform Module (TPM) CA certificates. Endorsement Keys are typically packaged in a certificate that is signed by a certificate authority (CA). This service allows the CA certificate to be registered with the Attestation Service in order to validate TPM EK certificates when presented at attestation time.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A unique name for the TPM CA certificate. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.trust_authority_clusters.attestation.tpm2.CaCertificate. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.trust_authority_clusters.attestation.tpm2.CaCertificate.

attributes.name: cert_chain
attributes.description: The CA certificate chain. Certificates may either be added one at a time, or as a chain. Adding the certificates as a chain allows the group to be managed as a whole. For example, an entire chain can be deleted in one CaCertificates.delete operation. When certificates are added one at a time, the order must be root first, followed by any intermediates. The intermediates certificates must also be ordered in the direction from root to leaf. Similarly, when added as a chain the list must be ordered in the direction from root to leaf. If unset creation will fail.

classes.description: The EndorsementKeys.CreateSpec structure contains information that describes a TPM endorsement key. Only one of EndorsementKeys.CreateSpec.public-key or EndorsementKeys.CreateSpec.certificate must be specified.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A unique name for the TPM endorsement key. The unique name should be something that an administrator can use to easily identify the remote system. For example, the hostname, or hardware UUID. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.trust_authority_clusters.attestation.tpm2.EndorsementKey. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.trust_authority_clusters.attestation.tpm2.EndorsementKey.

attributes.name: public_key
attributes.description: TPM public endorsement key in PEM format. If unset EndorsementKeys.CreateSpec.certificate must be set.

attributes.name: certificate
attributes.description: TPM endorsement key certificate in PEM format. When a endorsement key certificate is provided, it will be verified against the CA certificate list. Endorsement key certificates that are not signed by one of the CA certificates will be rejected. Using this format allows for failures to be caught during configuration rather than later during attestation. If unset EndorsementKeys.CreateSpec.public-key must be set.

classes.description: The Settings.Info structure contains information that describes the TPM 2.0 protocol settings.

attributes.name: require_endorsement_keys
attributes.description: Require registered TPM endorsement keys. During attestation, the attested host will always send its endorsement key to the Attestation Service. With this option is set, the Attestation Service will only proceed with attestation if the endorsement key has been added to the list of configured trusted endorsement keys.

attributes.name: require_certificate_validation
attributes.description: Require TPM endorsement key certificate validation. During attestation, the attested host will send its endorsement key certificate if one is available. With this option set, the Attestation Service will validate the endorsement key certificate against the list of configured trusted TPM CA certificates. Only endorsement key certificates that are signed by a trusted TPM CA certificate will be able to successfully attest.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: A health indicator which indicates whether each host in the cluster has the same attestation settings.

attributes.name: details
attributes.description: Details regarding the health. When the Settings.Health is not OK or NONE, this member will provide an actionable description of the issues present.

methods.description: Update the client certificate. The key server will use this certificate to validate the client connection. If a client certificate already exists, it will be replaced. An optional private key can be specified if the certificate has already been provisioned.

methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get$task
methods.description: Get existing certificate signing request (CSR) for the client certificate. The CSR will allow the certificate to be signed by a third party. Once the CSR is signed, certificate may be added as a client certificate.

methods.name: create$task
methods.description: Generate a certificate signing request (CSR) for the client certificate. This overwrites any existing CSR. The CSR will allow the certificate to be signed by a third party. Once the CSR is signed, certificate may be added as a client certificate. Calling the API repeatedly will result in a generating a new CSR each time.

methods.name: list$task
methods.description: Return the remote server certificates. Contacts the configured key servers and attempts to retrieve their certificates. These certificates might not yet be trusted. If the returned certificates are to be considered trustworthy, then it must be added to the list of trusted server certificates by adding to the certificates returned by TrustedPeerCertificates.get and invoking TrustedPeerCertificates.update with the updated list of certificates.

attributes.name: server_names
attributes.description: Names that key server must have to match the filter (see CurrentPeerCertificates.Summary.server-name). If unset or empty, key servers with any name match the filter.

attributes.name: trusted
attributes.description: Trust status that server certificates must have to match the filter (see CurrentPeerCertificates.Summary.trusted). If unset, trusted and untrusted server certificates match the filter.

attributes.description: Name of the server.

attributes.name: certificate
attributes.description: Server certificate. If unset, the certificate cannot be retrieved from the remote system, and CurrentPeerCertificates.Summary.trusted is undefined. See CurrentPeerCertificates.Summary.error-messages for details.

attributes.name: error_messages
attributes.description: Server certificate retrieval errors. Specifies error details when retrieving the remote server certificate fails. This list will be empty when CurrentPeerCertificates.Summary.certificate is set.

attributes.name: trusted
attributes.description: whether server certificate is already trusted .

methods.description: Returns a list of the hosts running a Attestation Service matching the specified Attestation.FilterSpec. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires TrustedAdmin.ReadTrustedHosts. - The resource HostSystem referenced by the attribute Attestation.FilterSpec.hosts requires System.View. - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the attribute Attestation.FilterSpec.clusters requires System.View.

When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: HostSystem. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: HostSystem.

attributes.name: clusters
attributes.description: A set of cluster IDs by which to filter the services. If unset, the services will not be filtered by the clusters on which they run. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: The group determines reports issued by which Attestation Service instances this Key Provider Service can accept. If unset, the services will not be filtered by groupId.

methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns detailed information about the given registered Attestation Service instance that is configured for the given cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires TrustedAdmin.ReadTrustedHosts. - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.View.

methods.name: create$task
methods.description: Configures the cluster to use a the given registered Attestation Service.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns the basic information about all configured Attestation Service instances used by this cluster. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - Operation execution requires TrustedAdmin.ReadTrustedHosts. - The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.View.

methods.name: delete$task
methods.description: Removes the Attestation Service instance from the configuration of the given cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_attestation_services__applied__config
classes.description: The ServicesAppliedConfig service provides information about the aggregate health of the applied Attestation Service configuration on the Trusted Clusters. The desired state of the Attestation Service is stored within vCenter, while the applied configuration is stored on the hosts in the cluster. The ServicesAppliedConfig service is available for all clusters, not only Trusted Clusters. In such cases empty desired state is assumed, e.g. when an applied Attestation Service configuration is found outside of a Trusted Cluster it is considered an ERROR. The ServicesAppliedConfig service is able to put the applied Attestation Service configuration into a consistent state when individual host configurations have diverged from the desired state.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_attestation_services__applied__config
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list$task
methods.description: Returns basic information about the health of all Attestation Service configurations applied to the cluster with respect to the desired state.

methods.name: get$task
methods.description: Returns detailed information about the health of the specified Attestation Service configuration applied to the cluster with respect to the desired state.

methods.name: update$task
methods.description: Update the applied Attestation Service configuration on the given Trusted Cluster to be consistent with the desired state. This method has no affect on the desired state, apart from it being used as a reference point for the remediation.

methods.name: delete$task
methods.description: Delete the Attestation Service configuration that has been applied to the given cluster. This method has no affect on the desired state, it only removes applied Attestation Service configuration from any Trusted Hosts within the given cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_attestation_services__applied__config_filter__spec
classes.description: The ServicesAppliedConfig.FilterSpec structure specifies the matching criteria to be applied when filtering out ServicesAppliedConfig.Summary structures from the collection returned by the list method. Only ServicesAppliedConfig.Summary structures containing the values specified in this structure will be returned from the list method. If multiple members of the filter spec are set, all of them must match for a result to be filtered out and returned.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: The health of the applied Attestation Service configuration. If unset, no filtration will be performed by health.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: The network address of the Attestation Service configured for use in the Trusted Cluster. If unset, no filtration will be performed by network address.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_attestation_services__applied__config_health
classes.description: The ServicesAppliedConfig.Health enumerated type is an indicator for the consistency of the applied Attestation Service configuration in a cluster with respect to the desired state.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: The consistency of the applied configuration is unknown.

attributes.name: OK
attributes.description: The applied Attestation Service configuration is consistent with the desired state.

attributes.name: ERROR
attributes.description: The applied Attestation Service configuration has diverged from the desired state.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_attestation_services__applied__config_info
classes.description: The ServicesAppliedConfig.Info structure contains detailed information about an applied Attestation Service configuration in a Trusted cluster.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: A health value which indicates whether the configuration applied to the cluster differs from the desired state.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: The network address of the Attestation Service configured for use in the Trusted Cluster.

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: The unique identifier of an Attestation Service configuration from the desired state. If unset, this Attestation Service is not registered within this vCenter and thus the applied configuration is not present in the desired state. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.attestation.Service. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.attestation.Service.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: The set of distinct groups found on the hosts in the cluster which differ from the desired state.

attributes.name: trustedc_as
attributes.description: A list of distinct trusted CA chains found on the hosts in the cluster which differ from the desired state.

attributes.name: details
attributes.description: Details regarding the health. When the ServicesAppliedConfig.Health is not OK, this member will provide a detailed description of the issues present.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_services__applied__config
classes.description: The ServicesAppliedConfig service provides information about the aggregate health of the applied Trust Authority Component configurations on the Trusted Clusters. The desired state of the Trust Authority Component configurations is stored within vCenter, while the applied configuration is stored on the hosts in the cluster and is a copy of the desired state. The ServicesAppliedConfig service is available for all clusters, not only Trusted Clusters. When an applied Trust Authority Component configuration is found outside of a Trusted Cluster it is considered an ERROR. The ServicesAppliedConfig service is able to make the applied Trust Authority Component configuration consistent with the desired state when individual host configurations have diverged from the desired state.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_trusted__infrastructure_trusted__clusters_services__applied__config
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get$task
methods.description: Returns detailed information about the health of the applied Trust Authority Component configurations in the given cluster.

methods.name: update$task
methods.description: Update all applied Trust Authority Component configuration on the given cluster to be consistent with the desired state. This method has no affect on the desired state, apart from it being used as a reference point for the remediation. If the cluster is not a Trusted Cluster, the method will remove all Trust Authority Component configuration from the Trusted Hosts in the cluster, if such hosts are found.

methods.name: delete$task
methods.description: Delete all Trust Authority Components configuration that has been applied to the given cluster. This method has no affect on the desired state, it only removes applied Trust Authority Component configurations from any Trusted Hosts within the given cluster.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vcha_cluster
classes.description: The {@name Cluster} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to deploy and undeploy a vCenter High Availability (VCHA) cluster, failover from the active VCHA node to the passive VCHA node, and retrieve the status of the VCHA cluster.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vcha_cluster
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: failover$task
methods.description: Initiates failover from the active vCenter node to the passive node. For forced failover, Active node immediately initiates a failover. This may result into a data loss after failover. For planned failover, Active node flushes all the state to the Passive node, waits for the flush to complete before causing a failover. After the failover, Passive node starts without any data loss. A failover is allowed only in the following cases: Cluster's mode is enabled and all cluster members are present. Cluster's mode is maintenance and all cluster members are present.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves the status of a VCHA cluster.

methods.name: deploy$task
methods.description: Prepares, clones, and configures a VCHA cluster.

methods.name: undeploy$task
methods.description: Destroys the VCHA cluster and removes all VCHA specific information from the VCVA appliance. Optionally, the passive and witness node virtual machines will be deleted only if VCHA was deployed using automatic deployment. The active node in the cluster continues to run as a standalone VCVA appliance after the destroy operation has been performed. If the VCHA cluster is in a transition state and not configured, then the VCHA cluster specific information is removed.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vcha_cluster_mode
classes.description: The {@term Mode} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage the operating mode of a vCenter High Availability Cluster (VCHA Cluster).

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vcha_cluster_mode
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves the current mode of a VCHA cluster.

methods.name: set$task
methods.description: Manipulates the mode of a VCHA Cluster. Following mode transitions are allowed: enabled -> disabled - Allowed only in healthy and degraded states. enabled -> maintenance - Allowed only in healthy state. disabled -> enabled - Allowed only in healthy state. maintenance -> enabled - Allowed only in healthy state with all nodes are running the same version. maintenance -> disabled - Allowed only in healthy state with all nodes are running the same version. All other transitions are not allowed. VCHA Cluster configuration remains intact in any of the cluster modes.

attributes.name: parallel_ports
attributes.description: {@term Map} of parallel ports, keyed by the {@link ParallelPortModel#deviceId}. Refer to the {@link ParallelPortModel} documentation for a description of the device id format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@link ParallelPortModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the {@link ParallelPortModel} itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link ParallelPortModel} itself is not used. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the {@link ParallelPortModel#deviceId} of the {@link ParallelPortModel} to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

attributes.description: {@term Map} of serial ports, keyed by the Serial Port's device identifier. Refer to the {@link SerialPortModel} documentation for a description of the device identifier format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@link SerialPortModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the {@link SerialPortModel} itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link SerialPortModel} itself is not used. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the {@link SerialPortModel#deviceId} of the {@link SerialPortModel} to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

attributes.name: floppies
attributes.description: {@term Map} of Floppy drives, keyed by the {@link FloppyModel#deviceId}. Refer to the {@link FloppyModel} documentation for a description of the device identifier format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@link FloppyModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the Floppy itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the Floppy itself is not used. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the {@link FloppyModel#deviceId} of the {@link FloppyModel} to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_cpu__resource__allocation
classes.description: The {@name CpuResourceAllocation} {@term structure} specifies the reserved resource requirements as well as the limit (maximum allowed usage) for a virtual machine's CPU, specified in MHz.

attributes.name: limit
attributes.description: The utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure consistent performance of virtual machines independent of available resources. Units are in MHz.

attributes.name: reservation
attributes.description: Amount of resources that are guaranteed available to the virtual machine. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are in MHz.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers. In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the resource, subject to certain other constraints.

attributes.name: pci_slot_number
attributes.description: The PCI slot number location of this controller.

attributes.name: type

attributes.description: An LsiLogic parallel controller.

attributes.description: A Para-virtualized SCSI controller.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_disk__model
classes.description: The {@name DiskModel} {@term structure} defines the basic configuration of a virtual disk attached to a virtual machine.

attributes.name: device_id
attributes.description: The device identifier for the disk. The device identifier identifies both the disk in the virtual machine and its controller type. It is of the form: {@code ide:}, {@code scsi:}, {@code sata:} where {@code x} is the bus number on the controller of specified type and {@code y} is the unit number of the device on the specified bus.

attributes.name: capacity
attributes.description: Capacity of this virtual disk in bytes.

attributes.name: storage_profile
attributes.description: Storage profile for the disk. If not specified, no change is made, that is, the disk retains its storage profile association, if it had one. Specifying the Storage Profile identifier as an empty string signifies that the disk should no longer be associated with a storage profile if it already was. This doesn't apply to certain disk types such RDM passthrough disk.

attributes.name: datastore_id
attributes.description: Identifier of datastore or storage pod for the virtual disk.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_disk__model_persistence__mode
classes.description: Persistence modes of a disk.

attributes.name: PERSISTENT
attributes.description: Changes are immediately and permanently written to the virtual disk.

attributes.name: NONPERSISTENT
attributes.description: Changes to virtual disk are made to a redo log and discarded at power off.

attributes.name: INDEPENDENT_PERSISTENT
attributes.description: Same as PERSISTENT, but the changes to the disk are permanent even if the virtual machine is reverted to a snapshot.

attributes.name: INDEPENDENT_NONPERSISTENT
attributes.description: Same as NONPERSISTENT, but the contents of the disk return to their original state when the virtual machine is reverted to a snapshot.

attributes.name: UNDOABLE
attributes.description: Changes are made to a redo log, but you are given the option to commit or undo.

attributes.name: APPEND
attributes.description: Changes are appended to the redo log; you revoke changes by removing the undo log.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_disk__spec
classes.description: The {@name DiskSpec} {@term structure} describes the specification of a disk.

attributes.name: resource_type
attributes.description: Disk type. Supported resource types are as defined in this class.

attributes.name: connected

attributes.name: start_connected

attributes.name: spec

attributes.name: client_device
attributes.description: Indicates whether the device is on the client.

attributes.name: DEVICE

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_ip__assignment
classes.description: The {@name IpAssignment} {@term structure} specifies how the guest operating system is configured with IP addresses, including protocol type (IPv4 or IPv6) and whether the assignment should be software driven (DHCP) or allocated by the system and passed into the guest.

attributes.name: ip_allocation_policy
attributes.description: Specifies how IP allocation is done for this virtual appliance. This is typically specified by the deployer of the virtual appliance. The set of valid options for the policy is based on the capabilities of the virtual appliance software, as specified by the {@link #supportedAllocationScheme} {@term field}.

attributes.name: ip_protocol
attributes.description: Specifies the chosen IP protocol for this deployment. This must be one of the values in the {@link #supportedIpProtocol} {@term field}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_ip__assignment_allocation__scheme
classes.description: The {@name AllocationScheme} {@term enumerated type} defines IP allocation schemes supported by the guest.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: The virtual appliance supports DHCP to acquire IP configuration.

attributes.name: OVF_ENVIRONMENT
attributes.description: The virtual machine or virtual appliance supports setting the IP configuration through the properties provided in the OVF environment.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_ip__assignment_ip__allocation__policy
classes.description: The {@name IpAllocationPolicy} {@term enumerated type} defines IP allocation policies for a deployment.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: Specifies that DHCP must be used to allocate IP addresses.

attributes.name: TRANSIENT
attributes.description: Specifies that IP allocation is allocated through an IP pool. The IP addresses are allocated when needed, typically at power-on, and deallocated during power-off. There is no guarantee that a property will receive the same IP address when restarted.

attributes.name: FIXED
attributes.description: Specifies that IP addresses are configured manually upon deployment, and will be kept until reconfigured or the virtual appliance is destroyed. This will ensure that a property gets a consistent IP for its lifetime.

attributes.name: FIXED_ALLOCATED
attributes.description: Specifies that IP allocation is done through the range managed by an IP pool. The IP addresses are allocated at first power-on, and remain allocated at power-off. This will ensure that a virtual appliance gets a consistent IP for its lifetime.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_ip__assignment_protocol
classes.description: The {@name Protocol} {@term enumerated type} defines IP protocols supported by the guest.

attributes.name: IPV4
attributes.description: The virtual appliance or virtual machine supports IPv4 protocol.

attributes.name: IPV6
attributes.description: The virtual appliance or virtual machine supports IPv6 protocol.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_memory__resource__allocation
classes.description: The {@name MemoryResourceAllocation} {@term structure} specifies the reserved resource requirement as well as the limit (maximum allowed usage) for a virtual machine's memory, specified in MB.

attributes.name: limit
attributes.description: The utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure consistent performance of virtual machines independent of available resources. Units are in MB.

attributes.name: reservation
attributes.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are in MB.

attributes.name: shares
attributes.description: Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers. In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the resource, subject to certain other constraints. Memory shares are used in case of resource contention.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_nic__model
classes.description: The {@name NicModel} {@term structure} describes the configuration of a NIC of a virtual machine.

attributes.name: device_id
attributes.description: The device identifier for the NIC. The device identifier is of the form: {@code ethernet}, where {@code x} is the NIC's sequence number within the virtual machine.

attributes.name: pci_slot_number
attributes.description: The PCI slot number location of this NIC.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of NIC.

attributes.name: connected
attributes.description: Specifies whether the device is currently connected. Valid only while the virtual machine is running.

attributes.name: start_connected
attributes.description: Specifies whether or not to connect the device when the virtual machine starts.

attributes.name: mac_address_type
attributes.description: MAC address type assigned to the virtual network adapter. Clients can set this property to any of the allowed address types in {@link MacAddressType}. The server might override the specified value for {@link MacAddressType#GENERATED} or {@link MacAddressType#ASSIGNED} if it does not fall in the right ranges or is determined to be a duplicate.

attributes.name: mac_address
attributes.description: MAC address for the virtual network adapter, if the {@link NicModel#macAddressType} is set to {@link MacAddressType#MANUAL}.

attributes.name: wake_on_lan_enabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether wake-on-LAN is enabled on this virtual network adapter. Clients can set this property to selectively enable or disable wake-on-LAN.

attributes.name: allow_guest_control
attributes.description: Enables guest control over whether or not the NIC is connected.

attributes.name: connection
attributes.description: Reference to network resource. It cannot be {@term unset} or be empty while adding new NIC. If set to {@term unset} while updating the NIC, then the NIC connection will not be changed. Empty string is not a valid value for the connection.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_nic__model_mac__address__type
classes.description: The {@name MacAddressType} {@term enumerated type} defines MAC address types.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: Statically assigned MAC address.

attributes.name: GENERATED
attributes.description: Automatically generated MAC address.

attributes.name: ASSIGNED
attributes.description: MAC address assigned by vCenter Server.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_nic__model_nic__type
classes.description: The {@name NicType} {@term enumerated type} defines NIC types.

attributes.name: E1000

attributes.name: E1000E

attributes.name: PCNET32
attributes.description: A PCNet32 ethernet card.

attributes.name: VMXNET
attributes.description: The VmxNet ethernet card.

attributes.name: VMXNET2
attributes.description: The VmxNet2 ethernet card.

attributes.name: VMXNET3
attributes.description: The VmxNet3 ethernet card.

attributes.name: FILE
attributes.description: Backing that connects a virtual parallel port with a host file.

attributes.name: DEVICE

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_product__spec
classes.description: The {@name ProductSpec} {@term structure} describes product information of a virtual appliance or a virtual machine. This is used solely for informational purposes.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the product.

attributes.name: vendor
attributes.description: Vendor of the product.

attributes.name: version
attributes.description: Short version of the product, for example, {@code 1.0}.

attributes.name: full_version
attributes.description: Full-version of the product, for example, {@code 1.0-build 12323}.

attributes.name: vendor_url
attributes.description: URL to vendor homepage.

attributes.name: product_url
attributes.description: URL to product homepage.

attributes.name: app_url
attributes.description: URL to entry-point for application. This is defined as a {@term string} as it is often specified using a macro, for example, {@code http:///}, where {@code app.ip} is a defined property on the virtual machine or virtual appliance container.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_property__spec
classes.description: The {@name PropertySpec} {@term structure} describes information about a property.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: If this is set to a non-empty {@term string}, this property starts a new category. If the category is empty, the property is in the same category as the previous item. Previous is based on the value of the order field.

attributes.name: ui_optional
attributes.description: Whether a category is UI optional. This is only used if this property starts a new category.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The display name for the property.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: A description of the field.

attributes.name: user_configurable
attributes.description: Whether the property is user-configurable or a system property. This is not used if the type is expression.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_rdm__disk__spec
classes.description: The {@name RdmDiskSpec} {@term structure} describes specification for a raw disk mapping (RDM) disk.

attributes.name: uuid
attributes.description: Virtual disk UUID.

attributes.name: change_id
attributes.description: The change identifier of the virtual disk for the corresponding snapshot or virtual machine. This can be used to track incremental changes to a virtual disk.

attributes.name: lun_uuid
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the LUN accessed by the raw disk mapping.

attributes.name: resource_type
attributes.description: Disk type. Supported resource types are as defined in this class.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_rdm__disk__spec_virtual__disk__compatibility__mode
classes.description: The {@name VirtualDiskCompatibilityMode} {@term enumerated type} defines RDM disk backing modes.

attributes.name: VIRTUAL
attributes.description: A disk device backed by virtual compatibility mode can participate in snapshots.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_serial__port__model
classes.description: A {@name SerialPortModel} {@term structure} contains configurations of a serial port of a virtual machine.

attributes.name: device_id
attributes.description: The device ID for the serial port. The device ID is of the form: {@code serial}.

attributes.name: connected
attributes.description: Specifies whether the device is currently connected. Valid only while the virtual machine is running.

attributes.name: yield_on_poll
attributes.description: Enables CPU yield behavior. If set to true, the virtual machine will periodically relinquish the processor if its sole task is polling the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: spec
attributes.description: Backing specification for the serial port

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_serial__port__spec
classes.description: The {@name SerialPortSpec}{@term structure} provides specification of serial port backing.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of serial port.

attributes.name: device_name
attributes.description: The name of the device on the host system.

attributes.name: auto_detect
attributes.description: Indicates whether the device should be auto detected instead of directly specified. If this value is set to TRUE, {@link SerialPortSpec#deviceName} is ignored.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: The direction of the connection.

attributes.name: proxy_uri
attributes.description: Identifies a proxy service that provides network access to the serviceURI. If you specify a proxy URI, the virtual machine initiates a connection with the proxy service and forwards the serviceURI and direction to the proxy.

attributes.name: service_uri
attributes.description: Identifies the local host or a system on the network, depending on the value of direction.

attributes.name: endpoint
attributes.description: Indicates the role the virtual machine assumes as an endpoint for the pipe.

attributes.name: no_rx_loss
attributes.description: Enables optimized data transfer over the pipe. When you use this feature, the ESX server buffers data to prevent data overrun. This allows the virtual machine to read all of the data transferred over the pipe with no data loss. To use optimized data transfer, set {@param.name noRxLoss} to true. To disable this feature, set the property to false. To use this property, optimized data transfer must be supported on the host. If the ESX server does not support the option, it ignores the noRxLoss setting in the pipe backing information object.

attributes.name: pipe_name
attributes.description: Pipe name for the host pipe associated with this backing.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_serial__port__spec_direction__type
classes.description: The {@name DirectionType} {@term enumerated type} provides values for the direction of a network connection.

attributes.name: CLIENT
attributes.description: Indicates that the virtual machine can initiate a connection with a system on the network using the specified {@link SerialPortSpec#serviceUri}.

attributes.name: SERVER
attributes.description: Indicates that the virtual machine can listen for a connection on the specified {@link SerialPortSpec#serviceUri}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_serial__port__spec_end__point__type
classes.description: The {@name EndPointType} {@term enumerated type} enum type provides values for the endpoint type of a pipe.

attributes.name: CLIENT
attributes.description: Indicates that the virtual machine is acting as a client endpoint for the pipe.

attributes.name: SERVER
attributes.description: Indicates that the virtual machine is acting as a server endpoint for the pipe.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_serial__port__spec_type
classes.description: Serial port backing types.

attributes.name: FILE
attributes.description: Backing that connects a virtual serial port with a host file.

attributes.name: DEVICE
attributes.description: Backing that allows a host serial port device to be used as backing for virtual serial port.

attributes.name: PIPE
attributes.description: Backing used to associate a virtual serial port with a named pipe. You can use a pipe to connect a virtual serial port to a host application or to another virtual machine on the host computer. This is useful for capturing debugging information sent through the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: THIN_PRINT
attributes.description: Backing that connects a virtual serial port with a ThinPrint device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_shares__info
classes.description: The {@name SharesInfo} {@term structure} specifies the shares information of resources.

attributes.name: level
attributes.description: The simplified view of shares for allocation level. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, then the level is set as {@link SharesLevel#CUSTOM}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_shares__info_shares__level
classes.description: The {@name SharesLevel} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of share levels. These designations have different meanings for different resources.

attributes.name: CUSTOM
attributes.description: If you specify CUSTOM for the level property, the server uses the share value to determine resource allocation when there is resource contention.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_sound__card__model
classes.description: The {@name SoundCardModel} {@term structure} represents a sound card in a virtual machine.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of sound card.

attributes.name: pci_slot_number
attributes.description: The PCI slot number location of this sound card.

attributes.name: spec
attributes.description: Backing specification for the sound card.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_sound__card__model_sound__card__type
classes.description: The {@name SoundCardType} {@term enumerated type} defines sound card types.

attributes.name: ENSONIQ1371
attributes.description: An Ensoniq1371 sound card.

attributes.name: HDAUDIO
attributes.description: An HDAudio sound card.

attributes.name: SOUNDBLASTER
attributes.description: A SoundBlaster sound card.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_sound__card__spec
classes.description: The {@name SoundCardSpec} {@term structure} describes the specification for sound card backing.

attributes.name: device_name
attributes.description: The name of the device on the host system.

attributes.name: auto_detect
attributes.description: Indicates whether the device should be auto detected instead of directly specified. If this value is set to true, {@link #deviceName} is ignored.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__client__device__spec
classes.description: The {@name UsbClientDeviceSpec} {@term structure} defines a USB device on a client machine. It specifies the physical path and the client name of a USB device.

attributes.name: client_name
attributes.description: Fully qualified domain name of the client machine to which the physical USB device is attached.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__controller__model
classes.description: A {@name UsbControllerModel} {@term structure} contains configurations of a USB controller. It defines a type and a PCI number of a USB controller.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the USB controller.

attributes.name: pci_slot_number
attributes.description: The PCI slot number location of this controller.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__controller__model_usb__controller__type
classes.description: The {@name UsbControllerType} {@term enumerated type} defines the acceptable types for a USB controller.

attributes.name: UHCI
attributes.description: Universal Host Controller Interface, standard USB 1.1 Host Controller (Low- and full-speed devices).

attributes.name: EHCI
attributes.description: Enhanced Host Controller Interface, standard USB 2.0 Host Controller (High-speed devices only).

attributes.name: XHCI
attributes.description: Extensible Host Controller Interface, standard USB 3.0 Host Controller (Introducing Super-speed). This controller is capable of interfacing with USB 1.x, 2.0 and 3.0 devices at all speeds.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__device__model
classes.description: A {@name UsbDeviceModel} contains configurations of a USB device. It contains the device ID, the connectivity and the configuration of a USB device.

attributes.name: connected
attributes.description: Specifies whether the device is connected.

attributes.name: spec
attributes.description: Specification of the USB device.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__device__spec
classes.description: The {@name UsbDeviceSpec} {@term structure} identifies a USB device and defines its specification, such as name, serial number, type, and so on. Based on the location of the USB device(device on host or device on client), it contains an additional specification ({@name UsbHostDeviceSpec} or {@name UsbClientDeviceSpec}) that specifies the path and the hostname.

attributes.name: device_name
attributes.description: Name of the USB device.

attributes.name: families
attributes.description: Device families of the USB device.

attributes.name: vendor
attributes.description: Vendor ID of the USB device.

attributes.name: product
attributes.description: Product ID of the USB device.

attributes.name: serial_number
attributes.description: Serial number of the USB device.

attributes.name: speeds
attributes.description: Device speeds of a USB device detected by server.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Device type of the USB device.

attributes.name: host_device
attributes.description: Additional spec for physical device on host. See {@link UsbHostDeviceSpec}.

attributes.name: client_device
attributes.description: Additional spec for physical device on client. See {@link UsbClientDeviceSpec}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__device__spec_family
classes.description: The {@name Family} {@term enumerated type} defines the family of a USB device.

attributes.name: AUDIO
attributes.description: Any audio-input or audio-output device.

attributes.name: BLUETOOTH
attributes.description: Standard bluetooth adapter that uses HCI protocol, this is a subset of wireless controllers.

attributes.name: COMMUNICATION
attributes.description: Communications devices such as modems and wired networking adapters.

attributes.name: HID
attributes.description: Human interface device.

attributes.name: HID_BOOTABLE
attributes.description: Human interface devices that are available at boot time, this is a subset of HID devices.

attributes.name: HUB
attributes.description: USB hubs.

attributes.name: IMAGING
attributes.description: Still imaging device.

attributes.name: OTHER
attributes.description: Other miscellaneous device.

attributes.name: PDA
attributes.description: Personal digital assistants, such as Palm PDA, and Micorsoft ActiveSync PDA.

attributes.name: PHYSICAL
attributes.description: Physical interface device.

attributes.name: PRINTER
attributes.description: Printer device.

attributes.name: SECURITY
attributes.description: Security devices such as fingerprint readers.

attributes.name: SMART_CARD
attributes.description: Smart card device.

attributes.name: STORAGE
attributes.description: Mass storage devices such as flash drives and external hard disk drives.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN_FAMILY
attributes.description: Device family not known.

attributes.name: VENDOR_SPECIFIC
attributes.description: Device that has an interface using a vendor-specific protocol.

attributes.name: VIDEO
attributes.description: Video device.

attributes.name: WIRELESS
attributes.description: Wireless networking adapters.

attributes.name: WUSB
attributes.description: Wireless device related to the Wireless USB standard, this is a subset of wireless controllers.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__device__spec_speed
classes.description: The {@name Speed} {@term enumerated type} defines the speed of a USB device.

attributes.name: LOW
attributes.description: This device operates at low speed (1.5Mb/s).

attributes.name: FULL
attributes.description: This device operates at full speed (12Mb/s).

attributes.name: HIGH
attributes.description: This device can operate at high speed (480Mb/s).

attributes.name: SUPER
attributes.description: This device can operate at super speed (5Gb/s).

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: This device's speed is unknown.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__device__spec_type
classes.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of a USB device.

attributes.name: PHYSICAL_ON_HOST
attributes.description: Indicates that the device is a physical device on a host.

attributes.name: PHYSICAL_ON_CLIENT
attributes.description: Indicates that the device is a physical device on a client machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_usb__host__device__spec
classes.description: The {@name UsbHostDeviceSpec} {@term structure} defines a USB device on a physical host. It specifies the physical path and host name of a USB device. It also supports the USB remote host backing capability for vMotion.

attributes.name: vmotion_compatible
attributes.description: Indicates whether the virtual machine is configured to support vMotion with the USB device. If it is set to true, the virtual machine is configured to support the USB remote host backing capability when vMotion operations migrate a virtual machine to a different host. The vCenter server will not migrate the virtual machine to a host that does not support the USB remote host backing capability.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app
classes.description: Service used to provision policy-based vApps.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get the vApp model that corresponds to the given vApp ID.

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Clone a vApp

methods.name: create_with_placement
methods.description: Create a new vApp from the provided spec and place is according to the associated placement requirements. The VAppModel in the spec must specify a VDC to place the vApp in.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new vApp from the provided spec. If a VDC is specified in the VAppModel the vApp will be placed on and confined to an arbitrary cluster backing the VDC. If a resource pool is specified in the VAppModel the vApp will be create in and confined to that resource pool.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update the vApp name and description.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a vApp. The method is idempotent meaning that if a vApp is not found the method just returns rather than throwing an error.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__customization
classes.description: Service used to configure the vApp customization model.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__customization
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieve the vApp's customization model.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update the VApp's customization model.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__customization__model
classes.description: Class containing the vApp configuration regarding product information, OVF properties, and IP assignment.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Self identifier

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__model
classes.description: Class containing the most basic configuration of a vApp. It is defined as includable to allow extension to add their own vApp configuration needed at create time.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Id of the vApp. Generated on create.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the vApp.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: vApp description. Defaults to the empty string.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__startup
classes.description: Service used to set and retrieve startup parameters for VMs or vApps in another vApp.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__startup
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get the startup model for a vApp.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the startup parameters for a vApp.

methods.name: get_by_vm
methods.description: Get the startup model for a VM.

methods.name: update_by_vm
methods.description: Updates the startup parameters for a VM.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__startup__model
classes.description: Model for vAppStartup service.

attributes.name: start_action
attributes.description: What to do when the containing vApp is started

attributes.name: stop_action
attributes.description: What to do when the containing vApp is stopped

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__startup__model_start__action
classes.description: The possible values for startAction.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: Specifies the VM or vApp should not start when the containing vApp is started

attributes.name: POWER_ON
attributes.description: A VM will be powered on when the containing vApp is started. A vApp will be started when the containing vApp is started.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app__startup__model_stop__action
classes.description: The possible values for stopAction.

attributes.name: NONE
attributes.description: The VM or vApp will not be stopped when the containing vApp is stopped.

attributes.name: POWER_OFF
attributes.description: A VM will be powered off, and a vApp will be stopped when the containing vApp is stopped.

attributes.name: GUEST_SHUTDOWN
attributes.description: The guest OS of a VM will be shutdown, and a vApp will be stopped when the containing vApp is stopped.

attributes.name: SUSPEND
attributes.description: A VM will be suspended, and a vApp will be stopped when the containing vApp is stopped.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app_clone__spec
classes.description: vApp clone spec used when cloning a vApp. It is defined as includable to allow extension to add their own vApp clone settings.

attributes.name: srcv_app_id
attributes.description: Source vApp to clone.

attributes.name: dst_vdc_id
attributes.description: Destination VDC. Defaults to same VDC if not specified.

attributes.name: dstv_app_name
attributes.description: Name of destination vApp. If not specified defaults to "Clone of <srcVAppName>".

attributes.name: vdc_network_map
attributes.description: Map from source VDC networks to destination VDC networks. This is used to reconnect the VMs at the destination. If no mapping is specified and cloning to a different VDC, VMs previously connected to a VDC network will be disconnected. If no mapping is specified and cloning to the same VDC, VMs will be connected to the same networks as the source vApp's VMs.

attributes.name: storage_profile_map
attributes.description: Map from source VDC storage profiles to destination VDC profiles. This is used to place VMs on the destination storage. If no mapping is specified and cloning to a different VDC, VMs will be placed at the first storage profile with enough capacity to contain a given VM. If no mapping is specified and cloning to the same VDC, VMs will be placed on the same storage profiles as the source vApp's VMs.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app_compute__requirement
classes.description: Information about the cpu and memory requirements for a specific VM. Used to place vApp correctly.

attributes.name: cpu_reservation
attributes.description: CPU reservation in MHz, minimum CPU available for a specific VM in MHz.

attributes.name: mem_reservation
attributes.description: Memory reservation in megabytes, minimum memory available for a specific VM.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app_config__spec
classes.description: vApp configuration spec used when creating a vApp. It is defined as includable to allow extension to add their own vApp configuration needed at create time.

attributes.name: customization
attributes.description: vApp product information, ovf properties, and ip assignment policy.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app_placement__requirements
classes.description: Placement requirements for a vApp. This class is defined as \@includable to allow extensions to define their own placement requirements related to their configuration.

attributes.name: vm_requirements
attributes.description: Per VM requirements used to place the vApp at a location with the required resources.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app_storage__requirement
classes.description: Information about the vApp's storage requirements for a specific storage profile in the VDC. Used to place vApp correctly.

attributes.name: storage_profile_id
attributes.description: Storage profile that must be accessible from the vApp.

attributes.name: storage_capacity
attributes.description: Required storage capacity in megabytes.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_V__app_vm__requirement
classes.description: Placement requirements for a single VM in the vApp. This class is defined as \@includable to allow extensions to define their own placement requirements related to their configuration.

attributes.name: compute_requirement
attributes.description: Compute requirements for a VM in the vApp.

attributes.name: storage_requirement
attributes.description: Storage requirements for a VM in the vApp.

attributes.name: required_networks
attributes.description: Set of networks that must be accessible to the vms in this vApp.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_video__card__model
classes.description: The {@name VideoCardModel} {@term structure} models configuration of a video card.

attributes.name: video_ram
attributes.description: The size of the framebuffer in KB.

attributes.name: auto_detect
attributes.description: Flag to indicate whether the display settings of the host on which the virtual machine is running should be used to automatically determine the display settings of the virtual machine's video card. This setting takes effect at virtual machine power-on time. If this value is set to true, numDisplays and videoRam size will be ignored.

attributes.name: enable_mediated_passthrough
attributes.description: Indicate whether the virtual video device supports mediated passthrough.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Display label for the device.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_video__card__model_rendering__mode
classes.description: 3d render modes.

attributes.name: AUTOMATIC
attributes.description: The virtual device chooses how to render 3D graphics (default).

attributes.name: SOFTWARE
attributes.description: The virtual device will use software rendering and will not attempt to use hardware acceleration.

attributes.name: HARDWARE
attributes.description: The virtual device will use hardware acceleration and will not activate without it.

attributes.name: parallel_ports
attributes.description: {@term Map} of parallel ports, keyed by the {@link ParallelPortModel#deviceId}. Refer to the {@link ParallelPortModel} documentation for a description of the device id format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@link ParallelPortModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the {@link ParallelPortModel} itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link ParallelPortModel} itself is not used. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the {@link ParallelPortModel#deviceId} of the {@link ParallelPortModel} to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link SerialPortModel} itself is not used. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the {@link SerialPortModel#deviceId} of the {@link SerialPortModel} to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@link FloppyModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the Floppy itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the Floppy itself is not used. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the {@link FloppyModel#deviceId} of the {@link FloppyModel} to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.
