classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_vm__bios__model
classes.description: The {@name VmBiosModel} {@term structure} contains the virtual machine BIOS configuration.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifier of the virtual machine.

attributes.name: uuid
attributes.description: 128-bit SMBIOS UUID of a virtual machine represented as a hexadecimal string in {@code "12345678-abcd-1234-cdef-123456789abc"} format.

attributes.name: firmware
attributes.description: Information about firmware type for this virtual machine.

attributes.name: boot_delay
attributes.description: Delay in milliseconds before starting the boot sequence. The boot delay specifies a time interval between virtual machine power on or restart and the beginning of the boot sequence.

attributes.name: enter_bios_setup
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether the virtual machine automatically enters BIOS setup the next time it boots. The virtual machine resets this flag to false so that subsequent boots proceed normally.

attributes.name: bootable_devices
attributes.description: The {@term list} of bootable devices ordered by boot order. After the {@term list} is exhausted, the default BIOS boot device algorithm is used for booting. Note that the order of the entries in the {@term list} is important: the device listed first is used for boot first, if that one fails the second entry is used, and so on. The platform may have some internal limit on the number of devices it supports. If a bootable device is not reached before the platform's limit is hit, boot will fail. At least a single entry is supported by all products supporting boot order settings.

attributes.name: EFI

attributes.name: CSM

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: Indicates that the compliance status of the virtual machine is unknown.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_vm__storage
classes.description: The {@name VmStorage} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to manage storage specific properties of a virtual machine.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_vm__storage
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the {@name VmStorageModel} that corresponds to the given virtual machine identifier.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the storage related settings of the virtual machine. If a {@term field} is left {@term unset}, that {@term field} will not be updated. This applies to the nested structures as well, for example, if only the size {@term field} of a disk has a value, the size of the disk is updated, but all other values are left as is. For the {@param.name vmStorage} disk {@term map}, missing elements are treated as an unset {@term field}, and left unchanged. For example, if the disk {@term map} consists of a single entry with key equal to {@code scsi0:1} and value equal to a {@link DiskModel} with {@link DiskModel#capacity} equal to {@code 4096}, then it will update the capacity of {@code scsi0:1}, but will leave all other disks unchanged. If a device with the given device identifier already exists, the device is updated. Otherwise, a new device is created. In case of creation, any unset {@term field} will be assigned default values based on the chosen guest operating system. Removal of devices is specified by setting the device's device identifier as the key in the {@term map} of devices, with the value in the {@term map} set to {@term unset}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_vm__storage__model

attributes.name: datastore_id
attributes.description: Identifier of datastore or storage pod for the virtual machine home.

attributes.name: disk_controllers
attributes.description: {@term Map} of {@link DiskControllerModel}, keyed by device identifier. Refer to the {@link DiskControllerModel} documentation for a description of the device identifier format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the {@name DiskControllerModel#deviceId}, and the device identifier in the {@link DiskControllerModel} itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link DiskControllerModel} itself can be left unset. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the device identifier of the device to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

attributes.name: disks
attributes.description: {@term Map} of {@link DiskModel}, keyed by device identifier. Refer to the {@link DiskModel} for a description of the device identifier format. When specified for virtual machine creation, the key of the {@term map} is used as the disk's device identifier, and the device identifier in the Disk itself is not used. For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the disk itself can be left unset. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the device identifier of the device to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

For virtual machine update, the device identifier in the {@link DiskControllerModel} itself can be left unset. For deletion, the key of the {@term map} should be set to the device identifier of the device to delete, and the value should be set to {@term unset}.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_vmdk__disk__spec
classes.description: The {@name VmdkDiskSpec} {@term structure} describes specification for a virtual machine disk (VMDK). The type of the disk is {@link DiskSpec#RDM_DISK_TYPE}.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: The format of the disk. Cannot be changed in update once the disk is created.

attributes.name: uuid
attributes.description: Disk UUID.

attributes.name: change_id
attributes.description: The change ID of the virtual disk for the corresponding snapshot or virtual machine. This can be used to track incremental changes to a virtual disk.

attributes.name: digest_enabled
attributes.description: Indicates whether the disk backing has digest disk file enabled. The digest disk file contains the metadata and set of hashes representing the values of the block.

attributes.name: grain_size
attributes.description: The grain (block of sectors containing data for the virtual disk) size in kB. The default size is 1024 kB.

attributes.name: thin_provisioned
attributes.description: Indicates to the underlying filesystem whether the virtual disk backing file should be allocated lazily using thin provisioning. This flag is only used for file systems that support configuring the provisioning policy on a per file basis, such as VMFS3.

attributes.name: write_through
attributes.description: Indicates whether writes should go directly to the file system or should be buffered.

attributes.name: resource_type
attributes.description: Disk type. Supported resource types are as defined in this class.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vdcs_vmdk__disk__spec_disk__format
classes.description: The {@name DiskFormat} {@term enumerated type} defines VMDK disk backing formats. The following virtual machine disk persistence modes are supported by these formats:

attributes.name: FLAT
attributes.description: Flat file format. Disk space is allocated when created.

attributes.name: SE_SPARSE
attributes.description: Space efficient sparse file format. Disk space is allocated as it grows.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.description: Returns information about a virtual machine.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a virtual machine.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm__template_library__items
classes.description: The {@name LibraryItems} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to deploy virtual machines from library items containing virtual machine templates, as well as {@term operations} to create library items containing virtual machine templates. The {@name LibraryItems} {@term service} also provides an operation to retrieve information about the template contained in the library item.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm__template_library__items
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about a virtual machine template contained in the library item specified by {@param.name templateLibraryItem}

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a library item in content library from a virtual machine. This {@term operation} creates a library item in content library whose content is a virtual machine template created from the source virtual machine, using the supplied create specification. The virtual machine template is stored in a newly created library item.

methods.name: deploy
methods.description: Deploys a virtual machine as a copy of the source virtual machine template contained in the library item specified by {@param.name templateLibraryItem}. It uses the deployment specification in {@param.name spec}. If {@link DeploySpec#poweredOn} and/or {@link DeploySpec#guestCustomization} are specified, the server triggers the power on and/or guest customization operations, which are executed asynchronously.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm__template_library__items_check__outs
classes.description: The {@name CheckOuts} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for managing the checkouts of a library item containing a virtual machine template. This {@term service} provides operations to check out a library item to update the virtual machine template, and to check in the library item when the virtual machine changes are complete.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm__template_library__items_check__outs
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: check_out
methods.description: Checks out a library item containing a virtual machine template. This {@term operation} makes a copy of the source virtual machine template contained in the library item as a virtual machine. The virtual machine is copied with the same storage specification as the source virtual machine template. Changes to the checked out virtual machine do not affect the virtual machine template contained in the library item. To save these changes back into the library item, {@link #checkIn} the virtual machine. To discard the changes, {@link #delete} the virtual machine.

methods.name: check_in
methods.description: Checks in a virtual machine into the library item. This {@term operation} updates the library item to contain the virtual machine being checked in as a template. This template becomes the latest version of the library item. The previous virtual machine template contained in the library item is available as a backup and its information can be queried using the {@name Versions} {@term service}. At most one previous version of a virtual machine template is retained in the library item.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the information about a checked out virtual machine.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns commonly used information about the virtual machines that are checked out of the library item.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the checked out virtual machine.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm__template_library__items_versions
classes.description: The {@name Versions} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for managing the live versions of the virtual machine templates contained in a library item. Live versions include the latest and previous virtual machine templates that are available on disk. As new versions of virtual machine templates are checked in, old versions of virtual machine templates are automatically purged. Currently, at most one previous virtual machine template version is stored.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM_clone__placement__spec
classes.description: The VM.ClonePlacementSpec structure contains information used to place a clone of a virtual machine onto resources within the vCenter inventory.

attributes.name: folder
attributes.description: Virtual machine folder into which the cloned virtual machine should be placed. If field is unset, the system will use the virtual machine folder of the source virtual machine. If this results in a conflict due to other placement parameters, the virtual machine clone operation will fail. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Folder. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Folder.

attributes.name: resource_pool
attributes.description: Resource pool into which the cloned virtual machine should be placed. If field is unset, the system will use the resource pool of the source virtual machine. If this results in a conflict due to other placement parameters, the virtual machine clone operation will fail. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool.

attributes.name: host
attributes.description: Host onto which the cloned virtual machine should be placed. If VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host and VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool are both specified, VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool must belong to VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host. If VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host and VM.ClonePlacementSpec.cluster are both specified, VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host must be a member of VM.ClonePlacementSpec.cluster. If this field is unset, if VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool is unset, the cloned virtual machine will use the host of the source virtual machine. if VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool is set, and the target is a standalone host, the host is used. if VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool is set, and the target is a DRS cluster, a host will be picked by DRS. if VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool is set, and the target is a cluster without DRS, InvalidArgument will be thrown. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.

attributes.name: cluster
attributes.description: Cluster into which the cloned virtual machine should be placed. If VM.ClonePlacementSpec.cluster and VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool are both specified, VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool must belong to VM.ClonePlacementSpec.cluster. If VM.ClonePlacementSpec.cluster and VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host are both specified, VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host must be a member of VM.ClonePlacementSpec.cluster. If VM.ClonePlacementSpec.resource-pool or VM.ClonePlacementSpec.host is specified, it is recommended that this field be unset. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

attributes.name: datastore
attributes.description: Datastore on which the cloned virtual machine's configuration state should be stored. This datastore will also be used for any virtual disks that are created as part of the virtual machine clone operation unless individually overridden. If field is unset, the system will use the datastore of the source virtual machine. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM_clone__spec
classes.description: Document-based clone spec.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Virtual machine to clone from. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: VirtualMachine. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: VirtualMachine.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Virtual machine name.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Virtual machine placement information. If this field is unset, the system will use the values from the source virtual machine. If specified, each field will be used for placement. If the fields result in disjoint placement the operation will fail. If the fields along with the placement values of the source virtual machine result in disjoint placement the operation will fail.

attributes.name: disks_to_remove
attributes.description: Set of Disks to Remove. If unset, all disks will be copied. If the same identifier is in VM.CloneSpec.disks-to-update InvalidArgument fault will be returned. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will contain identifiers for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

attributes.name: disks_to_update
attributes.description: Map of Disks to Update. If unset, all disks will copied to the datastore specified in the VM.ClonePlacementSpec.datastore field of VM.CloneSpec.placement. If the same identifier is in VM.CloneSpec.disks-to-remove InvalidArgument fault will be thrown. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Disk.

attributes.name: power_on
attributes.description: Attempt to perform a VM.CloneSpec.power-on after clone. If unset, the virtual machine will not be powered on.

attributes.name: guest_customization_spec
attributes.description: Guest customization spec to apply to the virtual machine after the virtual machine is deployed. If unset, the guest operating system is not customized after clone.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM_compute__placement__spec
classes.description: The VM.ComputePlacementSpec structure contains information used to place a virtual machine on compute resources.

attributes.name: resource_pool
attributes.description: Resource pool into which the virtual machine should be placed. This field is currently required if both VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host and VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster are unset. In the future, if this field is unset, the system will attempt to choose a suitable resource pool for the virtual machine; if a resource pool cannot be chosen, the virtual machine creation operation will fail. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool.

attributes.name: host
attributes.description: Host onto which the virtual machine should be placed. If VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host and VM.ComputePlacementSpec.resource-pool are both specified, VM.ComputePlacementSpec.resource-pool must belong to VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host. If VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host and VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster are both specified, VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host must be a member of VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster. This field may be unset if VM.ComputePlacementSpec.resource-pool or VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster is specified. If unset, the system will attempt to choose a suitable host for the virtual machine; if a host cannot be chosen, the virtual machine creation operation will fail. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.

attributes.name: cluster
attributes.description: Cluster into which the virtual machine should be placed. If VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster and VM.ComputePlacementSpec.resource-pool are both specified, VM.ComputePlacementSpec.resource-pool must belong to VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster. If VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster and VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host are both specified, VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host must be a member of VM.ComputePlacementSpec.cluster. If VM.ComputePlacementSpec.resource-pool or VM.ComputePlacementSpec.host is specified, it is recommended that this field be unset. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.

classes.description: The Tickets service provides operations for managing the virtual machine console tickets.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_console_tickets
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a virtual machine console ticket of a given ticket type. The created ticket is a one time use URI. The validity of the ticket is 30 minutes, if not used with in the time frame the ticket expires. The VMRC ticket contains the IP address or the DNS resolvable name of the vCenter server. This ticket requires installation of VMware Workstation, VMware Fusion or VMRC to be installed on the machine where the ticket has to be opened. This ticket can be acquired even when the VM is turned off. The WEBMKS ticket contains the IP address of the DNS resolvable name of the ESX server. This ticket requires user to embed this ticket in a HTML page using VMware HTML Console SDK - https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/html-console This ticket can be acquired only when the VM is turned on.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_console_tickets_create__spec
classes.description: The Tickets.CreateSpec structure defines the information used to create the virtual machine console ticket.

attributes.name: ticket

classes.description: The Tickets.Type enumerated type defines the types of console tickets.

attributes.name: VMRC

attributes.name: WEBMKS
attributes.description: Web socket console ticket

attributes.name: datastore
attributes.description: Destination datastore to clone disk. This field is currently required. In the future, if this field is unset disk will be copied to the datastore specified in the VM.ClonePlacementSpec.datastore field of VM.CloneSpec.placement. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore.

In the future, if this field is unset, disk will use the datastore specified in VM.RelocatePlacementSpec.datastore field of VM.RelocateSpec.placement. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials
classes.description: The Credentials structure defines the guest credentials used for guest operation authentication.

attributes.name: interactive_session
attributes.description: If set, the operation will interact with the logged-in desktop session in the guest. This requires that the logged-on user matches the user specified by the Credentials. This is currently only supported for USERNAME_PASSWORD.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The guest credentials type

attributes.name: user_name
attributes.description: For SAML_BEARER_TOKEN, this is the guest user to be associated with the credentials. For USERNAME_PASSWORD this is the guest username. If no user is specified for SAML_BEARER_TOKEN, a guest dependent mapping will decide what guest user account is applied.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: password This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Credentials.type is USERNAME_PASSWORD.

attributes.name: saml_token
attributes.description: SAML Bearer Token This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Credentials.type is SAML_BEARER_TOKEN.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials_type
classes.description: Types of guest credentials

attributes.name: USERNAME_PASSWORD
attributes.description: USERNAME_PASSWORD credentials contains the information necessary to authenticate within a guest using a username and password. This method of authentication is stateless. To use USERNAME_PASSWORD, populate userName and password with the appropriate login information. Once populated, you can use USERNAME_PASSWORD in any guest operations operation.

attributes.name: SAML_BEARER_TOKEN
attributes.description: SAML_BEARER_TOKEN contains the information necessary to authenticate within a guest using a SAML token. SAML Bearer token credentials relies on a guest alias that associates a guest account with the subject and certificate encoded in a SAML Bearer token obtained from the VMware SSO Server.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_customization
classes.description: The Customization service provides operations to apply a customization specification to a virtual machine.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_customization
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Applies a customization specification in spec on the virtual machine in vm. This operation only sets the specification settings for the virtual machine. The actual customization happens inside the guest when the virtual machine is powered on. If spec has unset values, then any pending customization settings for the virtual machine are cleared. If there is a pending customization for the virtual machine and spec has valid content, then the existing customization setting will be overwritten with the new settings. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.Provisioning.Customize.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the status of the customization operation that has been applied for the virtual machine in vm. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires System.View.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_customization_info
classes.description: The Customization.Info structure contains the status of a customization operation applied to a virtual machine.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The status of the customization operation.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Description of the error if the Customization.Info.status of customization operation is FAILED. This field will be unset if the status is not FAILED or there is no information available for the error.

attributes.name: start_time
attributes.description: Time when the customization process has started inside the guest operating system. This field will be unset if the status is PENDING.

attributes.name: end_time
attributes.description: Time when the customization process has completed inside the guest operating system. This field will be unset if the status is not SUCCEEDED or FAILED.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_customization_info_status
classes.description: The Customization.Info.Status enumerated type defines the status values that can be reported for the customization operation.

attributes.name: IDLE
attributes.description: No customization spec is applied to the guest operating system.

attributes.name: PENDING
attributes.description: The customization process has not yet started inside the guest operating system.

attributes.name: RUNNING
attributes.description: The customization process is currently running inside the guest operating system.

attributes.name: SUCCEEDED
attributes.description: The customization process has completed successfully inside the guest operating system.

attributes.name: FAILED
attributes.description: The customizatio process has failed inside the guest operating system.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_customization_set__spec
classes.description: The Customization.SetSpec structure contains specification information that has to be applied to a virtual machine.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the customization specification that has be retrieved from the virtual center inventory and applied for the virtual machine. Either one of Customization.SetSpec.name or Customization.SetSpec.spec or none of them should be specified. If unset and Customization.SetSpec.spec is also unset when executing Customization.set operationg, then any pending customization for the virtual machine will be cleared.

attributes.name: spec
attributes.description: The customization specification that has to be applied for the virtual machine. Either one of Customization.SetSpec.name or Customization.SetSpec.spec or none of them should be specified. If unset and Customization.SetSpec.name is also unset when executing Customization.set operationg, then any pending customization for the virtual machine will be cleared.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_dhcp__config__info
classes.description: The DhcpConfigInfo structure specifies when Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol is enabled.

attributes.name: ipv4_enabled
attributes.description: True if IPv4 DHCP is enabled, false otherwise.

attributes.name: ipv6_enabled
attributes.description: True if IPv6 DHCP is enabled, false otherwise.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_dns__assigned__values
classes.description: The {@name DnsAssignedValues) structure describes values assigned by a Domain Name Server (DNS).

attributes.name: host_name
attributes.description: The host name portion of DNS name. For example, "esx01" part of esx01.example.com.

attributes.name: domain_name
attributes.description: The domain name portion of the DNS name. "example.com" part of esx01.example.com.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_dns__config__info
classes.description: The DnsConfigInfo structure describes the configuration of RFC 1034 DNS settings.

attributes.name: ip_addresses
attributes.description: The IP addresses of the DNS servers in order of use. IPv4 addresses are specified using dotted decimal notation. For example, "192.0.2.1". IPv6 addresses are 128-bit addresses represented as eight fields of up to four hexadecimal digits. A colon separates each field (:). For example, 2001:DB8:101::230:6eff:fe04:d9ff. The address can also consist of the symbol '::' to represent multiple 16-bit groups of contiguous 0's only once in an address as described in RFC 2373.

attributes.name: search_domains
attributes.description: The domain in which to search for hosts, placed in order of preference. These are the domain name portion of the DNS names.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_environment
classes.description: The Environment service provides operations to manage environment variables in the guest operating system.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_environment
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Reads a single environment variable from the guest operating system. If the authentication uses Credentials.interactive-session, then the environment being read will be that of the user logged into the desktop. Otherwise it's the environment of the system user. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Query.
methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, name: string

methods.name: list
methods.description: Reads a list of environment variables from the guest operating system. If the authentication uses Credentials.interactive-session, then the environment being read will be that of the user logged into the desktop. Otherwise it's the environment of the system user. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Query.
methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, names: string[]

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_directories
classes.description: The Directories service provides operations to manage directories in the guest filesystem.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_directories
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: create_temporary
methods.description: Creates a temporary directory. Creates a new unique temporary directory for the user to use as needed. The guest operating system may clean up the directory after a guest specific amount of time if parentPath is not set, or the user can remove the directory when no longer needed. The new directory name will be created in a guest-specific format using prefix, a guest generated string and suffix in parentPath. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Modify.
methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, prefix: string, suffix: string, parent_path: string

methods.name: move
methods.description: Renames a directory in the guest. Renames the directory, or copies and deletes the old contents as required by the underlying filsystem. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Modify.
methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, path: string, new_path: string

methods.name: create

methods.name: delete

methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, path: string, recursive: boolean

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: Attributes of a file.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_files_iteration__spec
classes.description: The Files.IterationSpec structure contains fields used to break results into pages when listing files. See Files.list).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to return. If unset information about at most 50 files will be returned.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: Which result to start the list with. If this value exceeds the number of results, an empty list will be returned. If unset, the start of the list of files will be returned.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_files_last__iteration__status
classes.description: The last status for the iterator. A field of this type is returned as part of the result and indicates to the caller of the API whether it can continue to make requests for more data. The last status only reports on the state of the iteration at the time data was last returned. As a result, it not does guarantee if the next call will succeed in getting more data or not. Failures to retrieve results will be returned as Error responses. These last statuses are only returned when the iterator is operating as expected.

attributes.name: READY
attributes.description: Iterator has more data pending and is ready to provide it. The caller can request the next page of data at any time. The number of results returned may be less than the requested size. In other words, the iterator may not fill the page. The iterator has returned at least 1 result.

attributes.name: END_OF_DATA
attributes.description: Iterator has finished iterating through its inventory. There are currently no more entities to return and the caller can terminate iteration. If the iterator returned some data, the marker may be set to allow the iterator to continue from where it left off when additional data does become available. This value is used to indicate that all available data has been returned by the iterator.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_files_list__result
classes.description: The Files.ListResult structure describes the results of a Files.list operation.

attributes.name: files
attributes.description: A list of Files.Summary structures containing information for all the matching files.

attributes.name: total
attributes.description: The total number of results from the Files.list. This is a hint to the user of the iterator regarding how many items are available to be retrieved. The total could change if the inventory of items are being changed.

attributes.name: start_index
attributes.description: Positional index into the logical item list of the first item returned in the list of results. The first item in the logical item list has an index of 0. This is a hint to the user of the iterator regarding the logical position in the iteration. For example, this can be used to display to the user which page of the iteration is being shown. The total could change if the inventory of items are being changed. If unset no items were returned.

attributes.name: end_index
attributes.description: Positional index into the logical item list of the last item returned in the list of results. The first item in the logical item list has an index of 0. This is a hint to the user of the iterator regarding the logical position in the iteration. For example, this can be used to display to the user which page of the iteration is being shown. The total could change if the inventory of items are being changed. If unset no items were returned.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The last status for the iterator that indicates whether any more results can be expected if the caller continues to make requests for more data using the iterator.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_transfers
classes.description: The Transfers service provides operations to copy files into and out of the guest file system.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_transfers
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: create
methods.description: Initiates an operation to transfer a file to or from the guest. If the power state of the Virtual Machine is changed when the file transfer is in progress, or the Virtual Machine is migrated, then the transfer operation is aborted. When transferring a file into the guest and overwriting an existing file, the old file attributes are not preserved. In order to ensure a secure connection to the host when transferring a file using HTTPS, the X.509 certificate for the host must be used to authenticate the remote end of the connection. The certificate of the host that the virtual machine is running on can be retrieved using the following fields: XXX insert link to certificate in Host config XXX if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Modify.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_transfers_create__spec
classes.description: The Transfers.CreateSpec structure describes the details of a file transfer operation.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The complete destination path in the guest to transfer the file to or from the client. It cannot be a path to a directory or a symbolic link.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: Details about the file to be transferred into the guest. Must be set if the file is being transferred to the guest. Must not be set if the file is being transferred from the guest.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_transfers_file__creation__attributes
classes.description: The Transfers.FileCreationAttributes structure describes file attributes used when transferring a file into the guest.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size in bytes of the file to be transferred into the guest.

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.description: Whether an existing file should be overwritten. If unset any existing file will not be overwritten.

attributes.name: last_modified
attributes.description: The date and time the file was last modified. If unset the value will be the time when the file is transferred into the guest.

attributes.name: last_accessed
attributes.description: The date and time the file was last accessed. If unset the value will be the time when the file is transferred into the guest.

attributes.name: windows
attributes.description: Windows-specific file creation information. If unset, the behavior is equivalent to a Transfers.WindowsFileAttributesCreateSpec with all fields unset which means the defaults are used. May only be set if the guest operating system is Windows.

attributes.name: posix
attributes.description: Posix-specific file creation information. If unset, the behavior is equivalent to a Transfers.PosixFileAttributesCreateSpec with all fields unset which means the defaults are used. May only be set if the guest operating system is Posix.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_transfers_posix__file__attributes__create__spec
classes.description: The Transfers.PosixFileAttributesCreateSpec structure describes creation information about file attributes specific to Posix guest operating systems.

attributes.name: owner_id
attributes.description: The owner ID. If this property is not specified when passing a Transfers.PosixFileAttributesCreateSpec object to Transfers.create, the default value will be the owner Id of the user who invoked the file transfer operation. Defaults to uid of user invoking the operation.

attributes.name: group_id
attributes.description: The group ID. If this property is not specified when passing a Transfers.PosixFileAttributesCreateSpec object to Transfers.create, the default value will be the group Id of the user who invoked the file transfer operation. Defaults to gid of user invoking the operation.

attributes.name: permissions
attributes.description: The file permissions in chmod(2) format. If this property is not specified when passing a Transfers.PosixFileAttributesCreateSpec object to Transfers.create, the file will be created with 0644 permissions. This field is interpreted as octal. Defaults to 0644.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_filesystem_transfers_windows__file__attributes__create__spec
classes.description: The Transfers.WindowsFileAttributesCreateSpec structure describes creation information about file attributes specific to Windows guest operating systems.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: The file is hidden. If unset the file will not be hidden.

attributes.name: read_only
attributes.description: The file is read-only. If unset the file will be writeable.

When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet. classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_interfaces_ip__address__info
classes.description: The Interfaces.IpAddressInfo structure describes a specific IP Address.

attributes.name: ip_address
attributes.description: IPv4 address is specified using dotted decimal notation. For example, "192.0.2.1". IPv6 addresses are 128-bit addresses specified using eight fields of up to four hexadecimal digits. A colon separates each field (:). For example, 2001:DB8:101::230:6eff:fe04:d9ff. The address can also consist of the symbol '::' to represent multiple 16-bit groups of contiguous 0's only once in an address as described in RFC 2373.

attributes.name: prefix_length
attributes.description: Denotes the length of a generic Internet network address prefix. Prefix length: the valid range of values is 0-32 for IPv4, and 0-128 for IPv6. A value of n corresponds to an IP address mask that has n contiguous 1-bits from the most significant bit (MSB), with all other bits set to 0. A value of zero is valid only if the calling context defines it.

attributes.name: origin
attributes.description: How this address was configured. If unset the data was not available.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: The state of this ipAddress.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_interfaces_ip__address__origin
classes.description: The Interfaces.IpAddressOrigin enumerated type specifies how an IP address was obtained for an interface. See RFC 4293 IpAddressOriginTC.

attributes.name: OTHER
attributes.description: Any other type of address configuration other than the below mentioned ones will fall under this category. For e.g., automatic address configuration for the link local address falls under this type.

attributes.name: MANUAL
attributes.description: The address is configured manually.

attributes.name: DHCP
attributes.description: The address is configured through dhcp.

attributes.name: LINKLAYER
attributes.description: The address is obtained through stateless autoconfiguration (autoconf). See RFC 4862, IPv6 Stateless Address Autoconfiguration.

attributes.name: RANDOM
attributes.description: The address is chosen by the system at random e.g., an IPv4 address within 169.254/16, or an RFC 3041 privacy address.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_interfaces_ip__address__status
classes.description: The Interfaces.IpAddressStatus enumerated type defines the present status of an address on an interface. See RFC 4293 IpAddressStatusTC.

attributes.name: PREFERRED
attributes.description: Indicates that this is a valid address.

attributes.name: DEPRECATED
attributes.description: Indicates that this is a valid but deprecated address that should no longer be used as a source address.

attributes.name: INVALID
attributes.description: Indicates that this isn't a valid address.

attributes.name: INACCESSIBLE
attributes.description: Indicates that the address is not accessible because interface is not operational.

attributes.name: UNKNOWN
attributes.description: Indicates that the status cannot be determined.

attributes.name: TENTATIVE
attributes.description: Indicates that the uniqueness of the address on the link is presently being verified.

attributes.name: DUPLICATE
attributes.description: Indicates the address has been determined to be non-unique on the link, this address will not be reachable.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_interfaces_ip__config__info
classes.description: The Interfaces.IpConfigInfo structure describes the protocol version independent address reporting data object for network interfaces.

attributes.name: ip_addresses
attributes.description: IP addresses configured on the interface.

attributes.name: dhcp
attributes.description: Client side DHCP for an interface. If unset the IP was not configured by DHCP.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_routes
classes.description: The Routes service provides operations for retrieving guest operating system network routing information.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_routes
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns information about network routing in the guest operating system.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_networking_routes_info
classes.description: The Routes.Info structure describes an individual host, network or default destination network reachable through a gateway.

attributes.name: network
attributes.description: IP Address of the destination IP network. IPv4 address is specified using dotted decimal notation. For example, "192.0.2.1". IPv6 addresses are 128-bit specified using as eight fields of up to four hexadecimal digits. A colon separates each field (:). For example, 2001:DB8:101::230:6eff:fe04:d9ff. The address can also consist of symbol '::' to represent multiple 16-bit groups of contiguous 0's only once in an address as described in RFC 2373.

attributes.name: prefix_length
attributes.description: The prefix length. For IPv4 the value range is 0-32. For IPv6 prefixLength is a decimal value range 0-128. The property represents the number of contiguous, higher-order bits of the address that make up the network portion of the IP address.

attributes.name: gateway_address
attributes.description: Where to send the packets for this route. Unicast IP Address of the next hop router. IPv4 address is specified using dotted decimal notation. For example, "192.0.2.1". IPv6 addresses are 128-bit specified using as eight fields of up to four hexadecimal digits. A colon separates each field (:). For example, 2001:DB8:101::230:6eff:fe04:d9ff. The address can also consist of symbol '::' to represent multiple 16-bit groups of contiguous 0's only once in an address as described in RFC 2373. If unset no gateway is set for the route.

attributes.name: interface_index
attributes.description: The network interface associated with this route. This is an index into the result of Interfaces.list The index refers to the relative position of an element in a list. For example, an index of 0 refers to the first element in the list while an index of 1 refers to the second element. If unset the route is not associated with a network interface.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_processes
classes.description: The Processes service provides operations to manage processes in the guest operating system.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_processes
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns the status of a process running in the guest operating system, including those started by Processes.create that may have recently completed. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Query.
methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, pid: number

methods.name: create
methods.description: Starts a program in the guest operating system. A process started this way can have its status queried with Processes.list or Processes.get. When the process completes, its exit code and end time will be available for 5 minutes after completion. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Execute.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List the processes running in the guest operating system, plus those started by Processes.create that have recently completed. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Query.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Terminates a process in the guest OS. On Posix guests, the process is sent a TERM signal. If that doesn't terminate the process, a KILL signal is sent. A process may still be running if it's stuck. if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows: - The resource VirtualMachine referenced by the parameter vm requires VirtualMachine.GuestOperations.Execute.
methods.parameters: vm: string, credentials: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_credentials, pid: number

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_guest_processes_create__spec
classes.description: The Processes.CreateSpec structure describes the arguments to Processes.create.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The absolute path to the program to start. For Linux guest operating systems, /bin/bash is used to start the program. For Solaris guest operating systems, if /bin/bash exists, its used to start the program, otherwise /bin/sh is used. If /bin/sh is used, then the process ID returned by Processes.create will be that of the shell used to start the program, rather than the program itself, due to the differences in how /bin/sh and /bin/bash work. This PID will still be usable for watching the process with Processes.list to find its exit code and elapsed time. For Windows, no shell is used. Using a simple batch file instead by prepending c:\windows\system32\cmd.exe /c will allow stdio redirection to work if passed in the Processes.CreateSpec.arguments parameter.

attributes.name: arguments
attributes.description: The arguments to the program. Characters which must be escaped to the shell should also be escaped in Processes.CreateSpec.arguments. In Linux and Solaris guest operating systems, stdio redirection arguments may be used. For Windows, stdio redirection can be added to the argments if Processes.CreateSpec.path is prefixed with c:\windows\system32\cmd.exe /c. If unset no arguments are passed to the program.

attributes.name: working_directory
attributes.description: The absolute path of the working directory for the program to be run. VMware recommends explicitly setting the working directory for the program to be run. If unset or is an empty string, the behavior depends on the guest operating system. For Linux guest operating systems, if unset or is an empty string, the working directory will be the home directory of the user associated with the guest authentication. For other guest operating systems, if unset, the behavior is unspecified.

attributes.name: environment_variables
attributes.description: A map of environment variables, specified using the guest OS rules (for example PATH, c:\bin;c:\windows\system32 or LD_LIBRARY_PATH,/usr/lib:/lib), to be set for the program being run. Note that these are not additions to the default environment variables; they define the complete set available to the program. If unset, the environment variables used are guest dependent defaults.

attributes.name: start_minimized
attributes.description: Makes any program window start minimized in Windows operating systems. Returns an error if set for non-Windows guests. Defaults to false.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_boot_device
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the virtual devices that will be used to boot the virtual machine. The virtual machine will check the devices in order, attempting to boot from each, until the virtual machine boots successfully. If the {@term list} is empty, the virtual machine will use a default boot sequence. There should be no more than one instance of {@link Entry} for a given device type except {@link Device.Type#ETHERNET} in the {@term list}.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns an ordered list of boot devices for the virtual machine. If the {@term list} is empty, the virtual machine uses a default boot sequence.

The boot order of the specific device instance will be the order in which the Ethernet and Disk devices appear in the {@name com.vmware.vcenter.VM.CreateSpec#nics} and {@name com.vmware.vcenter.VM.CreateSpec#disks} respectively.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_cdrom
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects a virtual CD-ROM device of a powered-on virtual machine from its backing. The virtual device is still present and its backing configuration is unchanged, but from the perspective of the guest operating system, the CD-ROM device is not connected to its backing resource. For a powered-off virtual machine, the {@link #update} {@term operation} may be used to configure the virtual CD-ROM device to start in the disconnected state when the virtual machine is powered on.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about a virtual CD-ROM device.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a virtual CD-ROM device to the virtual machine.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the configuration of a virtual CD-ROM device.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns commonly used information about the virtual CD-ROM devices belonging to the virtual machine.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Removes a virtual CD-ROM device from the virtual machine.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects a virtual CD-ROM device of a powered-on virtual machine to its backing. Connecting the virtual device makes the backing accessible from the perspective of the guest operating system. For a powered-off virtual machine, the {@link #update} {@term operation} may be used to configure the virtual CD-ROM device to start in the connected state when the virtual machine is powered on.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_disk
classes.description: The {@name Disk} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for configuring the virtual disks of a virtual machine. A virtual disk has a backing such as a VMDK file. The backing has an independent lifecycle from the virtual machine when it is detached from the virtual machine. The {@link #create} {@term operation} provides the ability to create a new virtual disk. When creating a virtual disk, a new VMDK file may be created or an existing VMDK file may used as a backing. Once a VMDK file is associated with a virtual machine, its lifecycle will be bound to the virtual machine. In other words, it will be deleted when the virtual machine is deleted. The {@link #delete} {@term operation} provides the ability to detach a VMDK file from the virtual machine. The {@link #delete} {@term operation} does not delete the VMDK file that backs the virtual disk. Once detached, the VMDK file will not be destroyed when the virtual machine to which it was associated is deleted.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_disk
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about a virtual disk.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a virtual disk to the virtual machine. While adding the virtual disk, a new VMDK file may be created or an existing VMDK file may be used to back the virtual disk.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the configuration of a virtual disk. An update {@term operation} can be used to detach the existing VMDK file and attach another VMDK file to the virtual machine.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns commonly used information about the virtual disks belonging to the virtual machine.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Removes a virtual disk from the virtual machine. This {@term operation} does not destroy the VMDK file that backs the virtual disk. It only detaches the VMDK file from the virtual machine. Once detached, the VMDK file will not be destroyed when the virtual machine to which it was associated is deleted.

classes.description: The {@name Ethernet} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for configuring the virtual Ethernet adapters of a virtual machine.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_ethernet
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects a virtual Ethernet adapter of a powered-on virtual machine from its backing. The virtual device is still present and its backing configuration is unchanged, but from the perspective of the guest operating system, the Ethernet adapter is not connected to its backing resource. For a powered-off virtual machine, the {@link #update} {@term operation} may be used to configure the virtual Ethernet adapter to start in the disconnected state when the virtual machine is powered on.

methods.description: Returns information about a virtual Ethernet adapter.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a virtual Ethernet adapter to the virtual machine.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the configuration of a virtual Ethernet adapter.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns commonly used information about the virtual Ethernet adapters belonging to the virtual machine.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Removes a virtual Ethernet adapter from the virtual machine.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects a virtual Ethernet adapter of a powered-on virtual machine to its backing. Connecting the virtual device makes the backing accessible from the perspective of the guest operating system. For a powered-off virtual machine, the {@link #update} {@term operation} may be used to configure the virtual Ethernet adapter to start in the connected state when the virtual machine is powered on.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Backing type for the virtual Ethernet adapter.

attributes.name: network
attributes.description: Identifier of the network that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter.

attributes.name: distributed_port
attributes.description: Key of the distributed virtual port that backs the virtual Ethernet adapter. Depending on the type of the Portgroup, the port may be specified using this field. If the portgroup type is early-binding (also known as static), a port is assigned when the Ethernet adapter is configured to use the port. The port may be either automatically or specifically assigned based on the value of this {@term field}. If the portgroup type is ephemeral, the port is created and assigned to a virtual machine when it is powered on and the Ethernet adapter is connected. This {@term field} cannot be specified as no free ports exist before use.

The virtual device is still present and its backing configuration is unchanged, but from the perspective of the guest operating system, the floppy drive is not connected to its backing resource. classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_serial
classes.description: The {@name Serial} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for configuring the virtual serial ports of a virtual machine.

methods.name: com_vmware_vcenter_vm_hardware_serial
methods.description: Auto-generated constructor

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects a virtual serial port of a powered-on virtual machine from its backing. The virtual device is still present and its backing configuration is unchanged, but from the perspective of the guest operating system, the serial port is not connected to its backing. For a powered-off virtual machine, the {@link #update} {@term operation} may be used to configure the virtual serial port to start in the disconnected state when the virtual machine is powered on.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Returns information about a virtual serial port.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a virtual serial port to the virtual machine.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the configuration of a virtual serial port.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns commonly used information about the virtual serial ports belonging to the virtual machine.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Removes a virtual serial port from the virtual machine.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects a virtual serial port of a powered-on virtual machine to its backing. Connecting the virtual device makes the backing accessible from the perspective of the guest operating system. For a powered-off virtual machine, the {@link #update} {@term operation} may be used to configure the virtual serial port to start in the connected state when the virtual machine is powered on.

attributes.description: Backing type for the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: Path of the file backing the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: host_device
attributes.description: Name of the device backing the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: auto_detect
attributes.description: Flag indicating whether the virtual serial port is configured to automatically detect a suitable host device.

attributes.name: pipe
attributes.description: Name of the pipe backing the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: no_rx_loss
attributes.description: Flag that enables optimized data transfer over the pipe. When the value is true, the host buffers data to prevent data overrun. This allows the virtual machine to read all of the data transferred over the pipe with no data loss.

attributes.name: proxy
attributes.description: Proxy service that provides network access to the network backing. If set, the virtual machine initiates a connection with the proxy service and forwards the traffic to the proxy.

classes.description: The {@name BackingType} {@term enumerated type} defines the valid backing types for a virtual serial port.

attributes.name: FILE
attributes.description: Virtual serial port is backed by a file.

attributes.name: HOST_DEVICE
attributes.description: Virtual serial port is backed by a device on the host where the virtual machine is running.

attributes.name: PIPE_SERVER
attributes.description: Virtual serial port is backed by a named pipe server. The virtual machine will accept a connection from a host application or another virtual machine on the same host. This is useful for capturing debugging information sent through the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: PIPE_CLIENT
attributes.description: Virtual serial port is backed by a named pipe client. The virtual machine will connect to the named pipe provided by a host application or another virtual machine on the same host. This is useful for capturing debugging information sent through the virtual serial port.

attributes.name: NETWORK_SERVER
attributes.description: Virtual serial port is backed by a network server. This backing may be used to create a network-accessible serial port on the virtual machine, accepting a connection from a remote system.

attributes.name: NETWORK_CLIENT
attributes.description: Virtual serial port is backed by a network client. This backing may be used to create a network-accessible serial port on the virtual machine, initiating a connection to a remote system.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM_instant__clone__placement__spec
classes.description: The VM.InstantClonePlacementSpec structure contains information used to place an InstantClone of a virtual machine onto resources within the vCenter inventory.

attributes.name: folder
attributes.description: Virtual machine folder into which the InstantCloned virtual machine should be placed. If field is unset, the system will use the virtual machine folder of the source virtual machine. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Folder. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Folder.

attributes.name: resource_pool
attributes.description: Resource pool into which the InstantCloned virtual machine should be placed. If field is unset, the system will use the resource pool of the source virtual machine. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: ResourcePool.

attributes.name: datastore
attributes.description: Datastore on which the InstantCloned virtual machine's configuration state should be stored. This datastore will also be used for any virtual disks that are created as part of the virtual machine InstantClone operation. If field is unset, the system will use the datastore of the source virtual machine. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Datastore.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM_instant__clone__spec
classes.description: Document-based InstantClone spec.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Virtual machine to InstantClone from. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: VirtualMachine. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: VirtualMachine.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the new virtual machine.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Virtual machine placement information. If this field is unset, the system will use the values from the source virtual machine. If specified, each field will be used for placement. If the fields result in disjoint placement the operation will fail. If the fields along with the placement values of the source virtual machine result in disjoint placement the operation will fail.

attributes.name: nics_to_update
attributes.description: Map of NICs to update. If unset, no NICs will be updated. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.Ethernet.

attributes.name: disconnect_all_nics
attributes.description: Indicates whether all NICs on the destination virtual machine should be disconnected from the newtwork If unset, connection status of all NICs on the destination virtual machine will be the same as on the source virtual machine.

attributes.name: parallel_ports_to_update
attributes.description: Map of parallel ports to Update. If unset, no parallel ports will be updated. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ParallelPort. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.ParallelPort.

attributes.name: serial_ports_to_update
attributes.description: Map of serial ports to Update. If unset, no serial ports will be updated. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the key in the field map must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.SerialPort. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the key in the field map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.vm.hardware.SerialPort.

attributes.name: bios_uuid
attributes.description: 128-bit SMBIOS UUID of a virtual machine represented as a hexadecimal string in "12345678-abcd-1234-cdef-123456789abc" format. If unset, will be generated.

classes.name: com_vmware_vcenter_VM_inventory__placement__spec
classes.description: The VM.InventoryPlacementSpec structure contains information used to place a virtual machine in the vCenter inventory.

attributes.name: folder
attributes.description: Virtual machine folder into which the virtual machine should be placed. This field is currently required. In the future, if this field is unset, the system will attempt to choose a suitable folder for the virtual machine; if a folder cannot be chosen, the virtual machine creation operation will fail. When clients pass a value of this structure as a parameter, the field must be an identifier for the resource type: Folder. When operations return a value of this structure as a result, the field will be an identifier for the resource type: Folder.
